description:
Woah! Update! Came for Happy Hour and Taco Tuesdays! I love how their happy hour has legit good deals! 

I knew the beer would be good (I tried one named something like Moraga and it was good!) and pretty much love all tacos. I always get their fried fish tacos. Hot crispy fish with creamy slaw.. yum. Sign me up!

But it was their wings that prompted me to write this update. HH wings are $10 and they had tamarind-chipotle sauce. I don't know what I was expecting, but not that huge bowl of wings. My eyes literally bugged out when I saw how many wings were in that bowl. A friend and I split the wings and also had some tacos, but I ate until I thought I would pop (or maybe my jeans) and we still were not done. When all was said and done, we had 10 wings left over. Yes, the quantity blew me away but it was pretty tasty too! Saucy and crispy. Sweet and savory. So yum. Can't wait to go back for another round!
author: Kim W.

description:
It was a great find! Super big and really nice farm house style decor. Saturday night dinner out with my man and we shared the fish & chips. I figured the plates would be big and yes it was enough for the 2 of us. The plate came with a nice slaw and yummer fries :p 
Service was great, very attentive. 
My non-stars for the very hard seats in the restaurant. They are completely flat and honestly hurt your behind :/ maybe you need to bring your cushion like at the ball games? Lol
author: Tere C.

description:
My friends and I met at Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company for trivia and to catch up over some dinner. I made a reservation but my friend asked me to call to make sure we were close enough to the trivia host to hear everything as the space is pretty big and you can't hear trivia very well from upstairs. They were very accommodating and put us in a booth closest to the trivia area by the bar. The place was not busy when we got there around 6 but it filled up by the end of the night.

They have a taco special every Tuesday - 3 for $10 or $4 each. We got one of each kind; al pastor, chicken, beer battered fish, and a special for that night, an ahi tuna taco. They have other food and drink specials for Taco Tuesday including chips and salsa and a $7 margarita. We also got fried green beans and a "big bowl o' wings" to share. The food was really great! The tacos all had great flavor and the proteins were cooked perfectly. They all had a sauce that really complemented the meat well and tied them all together and kept them from being dry. That said, the tortillas were miniature, making the tacos impossible to eat normally. Not a bad problem to have, but keep it in mind if you're on a first date or something. The wings were really good! Crispy and perfectly buffalo medium, with an awesome dipping sauce. The green beans were okay, a little too heavily battered for me but still tasty.

My only complaint was the service was painfully slow. We were there for several hours for trivia, but our server kind of ignored us most of the time even when we wanted to order more drinks or get water refills, etc. Then when we wanted to pay, we had to wait around even longer. He was a nice guy, just not very attentive even though we saw him around at other tables pretty often. If I lived in the area, I would definitely go back for trivia and more tacos! Just plan ahead for extra time.
author: Katy C.

description: I'm still not enthused about their beer options but their food is really good and they're an especially great option for happy hour (fish and chips!). Definitely a godsend to the sunset.
author: Vivian H.

description: The food is decent here...there's good bar good. The portion is actually pretty big, enough to share and you'll get full. Ambiance is nice...great place for drinks, beer, watch a game of sports. There's an upstairs and downstairs...so the space is very spacious.i came here on a Friday night at around 7pm to catch the warriors game and got seated almost  immediately.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
3.5 stars.
Food isn't bad, the chilaquiles tasted good but a bit spicy. Service was fast and attentive on a late Sat afternoon. BF had the 2 eggs dish and he liked his plate too. I'd probably check out other restaurants in the area before coming back here again, but it isn't bad.
author: Irene L.

description:
Awesome trendy spot in outer sunset. Stopped in for a quick lunch and we weren't disappointed. Really extensive menu. Great options and a super beer list.

Had the grilled corn and really enjoyed it. Also ordered the yellow tofu curry. Loved it once I took all the kale off. Kids loved the Mac and cheese. Refills of iced tea made this a really complete and great meal.
author: Bob K.

description: I've never eaten here so I can only comment on the beer, but I like it and the vibe is really great. There are lots of seats, and lot of space. The food selection looks pretty cool, and I've had a bite of the mac and cheese which was pretty tasty. I'd love to come back and have more of the food.
author: Jenna G.

description: The beer is good here. But that's about it. The food here isn't great, definitely not worth the price. Service is fine, but they rounded up on my written tip that was charged on my card.. Because of that, I would not come here again or recommend it.
author: Cory C.

description: I crave this food...their homemade veggie burger is absolutely delicious. I bring my newborn in with me for lunch as it is spacious and the bench seats fit her car seat so she can sleep while I get out and about.
author: Monique P.

description:
Sunset Reservoir has it all. If you're coming here for beer and just beer, this place probably isn't for you. Sunset has an amazing cocktail menu, great food, and of course--craft beer.

We tried all of the beer, and by far our favorite was the Guava Gose. It's light with a hint of guava and tastes refreshingly sour. I also liked the Saison, which had a bit of an herbal taste. The others were pretty good too, but a little mild so they didn't stick out as much.

The food is another plus! They have bar bites, small plates, AND entrees. We tried the shishito peppers (which they give you a TON of) and the homemade french onion dip, both of which were tasty. The mac and cheese is gooey and has the perfect amount of crunch on top. The steak is incredible too--very juicy and has amazing flavor. The only reason I gave Sunset 4 stars is because I ordered a pulled pork sandwich with garlic fries and I wasn't really a fan. The pulled pork was too soggy to even hold and the garlic fries were covered in a huge mass of minced garlic. Otherwise though, the food was great.

We ordered a banana split to top it all off, and the cherry ice cream was awesome! It was the perfect end to an experience full of beer and food. Overall, I can't wait to go back, and although I probably wouldn't get the pulled pork again, I know there are tons of other great choices on this menu!
author: Claire C.

description: The Mrs. and I are just huge fans of this spot! Great vareity of beer and cocktails, and the food is really really good! I had the burger and and the mrs. had yr he ceasar salad with grilled salmon (super fresh and tasty) -- we'll be coming back for sure
author: Aaron W.

description: Sunday night in the Sunset is so effin' fantastic; SRBC melds NFL on-screen, Al Green crooning background, kids gleefully thumping about & a refreshed menu with thoughtfully crafted cocktails. CHEERS to more than BEERS + many thanks for a smooth and easy way to wind down the weekend:) The Burger bomb, charred hard then perfectly balanced with the right amount of roll, the veggie burger rocked too, fries fun & grown folks ought not leave out without sippin on the splendid, somewhat smokey Fumidor. Brava Ma! Note: THANKSGIVING DINING ON OFFER-
author: Hali R.

description:
My friend and I heard about this brewery and wanted to taste the house beers. 

Arrived at 2pm on a Sunday. 1/2 the place is empty. No hostess in sight. Legit waited a couple minutes before anyone acknowledged us and brought us to a table. 

Young female server with long brown hair arrived at our table with a pissed off attitude, no smile, and no hello. 

Server notifies us "we don't have anything on the menu". After asking a few beer related questions our server sharply replies "we only have two out of the four beers we brew in house". 

This is a problem. How can you be a brewery with no brews? How dreadful. 

I tried your chicken biscuit sliders. No joke, the plate was brought out to me cold. The potatoes were cold and covered in some weird tomato gravy. The salad was lukewarm. Both sliders were dead cold. How does fried chicken make it to your customer cold? The cheese on the sliders wasn't even melted. Sad. 

Even worse, our server never checked up on us. Would have told her to send the plate back. 

Moreover, I'm completely shocked to see a $12 devils teeth breakfast sandwich on the menu. Especially when I could walk down to the source and get it for $6. Insane. 

Lastly, being a sunset native we left your business and went to a better brewery not too far away in the sunset. We were treated way better there. If they can do it you can do it. Step your game up. You have potential.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Hadn't been in a while and glad I came back! They've worked out a few of the kinks!

Most important their beer is better than it was before. Smoother, more refined.  I really enjoyed my hoppy amber - great level of hop, but still an amber.

The food is still really good. Loved our shishito peppers.

The Wings are quite good and there are a ton of them - great deal.

Really nicely done meat on the pulled pork sandwich.

Mac & cheese didn't blow me away - but it was solid - not like I didn't finish it or anything. :)

Happy atmosphere. Lots of strollers and many ages!
author: Sarah C.

description:
I had the burger here and it was pretty solid. It was filling and they give you a good amount of fries! My friend got the mac n' cheese and I think thats the winner! It was deliciously cheese and filling! Brussel sprouts were good but very simple. 

The ambiance of this place is nice. And I prefer sitting downstairs. It is a bit loud at times but this place has pretty high ceilings so it doesn't seem like the noise traps in the room.

This is a nice place to go to if you are in the area and want some food and drinks!
author: Joyce S.

description:
I was amazed with the fish and chips here. The breading is light, fish moist and flaky, and just plain yummy! I used to drive up to Fort Bragg for fish and chips at the brewery up there. Now that I've discovered this hip new place with the best fish and chips in the city, this is my new go to place. The chicken sandwich, mac & cheese, fried green beans were all delicious. While the fried chicken is supposed to be one of their specialties, I wasn't impressed. 

I would gladly go back and try their beer offerings, when I have a DD along.

The parking situation is street with a two hour limit. I've managed to score a parking spot in front on all three occasions I've been there. The restaurant is a little on the cool side, so bring a wrap or sweater. But you know, SF is always on the cooler side anyhow.
author: Carol H.

description:
Why the fuck is there never a host to seat people? Where did you go host? What is more important than bringing in costumers? Your twitter can wait pal. Servers and bar staff: if you see that your host is AFK then step up and help seat guests. It's just unacceptable for my party of 3 to be waiting 12 minutes to be seated in an empty restaurant. We left and don't plan to come back which is a shame because we are local. Feel free to text me when the service improves and we will talk. 

Edit: was previous 2 stars but is now 5 because of Steven the server at brunch only. He is Lebron James and carries the rest of the bunch.
author: Christopher M.

description:
4-Stars here is a bit of a stretch, but I'll go there because the cocktail list is good and I think we would return (even with the kid).

The iffy vibe is because some of the food was hit or miss. French onion dip was "eh", but chips were great. Mussels tasted "fishy" but the chorizo sauce and bread was fantastic. Pork tacos were legit all around.

Cocktails were a hit, I had devils tooth and house old fashioned. Wifey had a stout.

Plenty of seating in general. I would be ok bringing our toddler here in the future.
author: Ross H.

description:
Came here on a Sunday morning aftermath of my BFF's 24th. They seated us upstairs on a huge round table, made us feel special.
I don't do meat usually, but opted for the breakfast sliders, one with bacon and avocado and the jalapeño jelly and the other with the fried chicken. 
The fried chicken was weird, I'm thinking it was a thigh but honestly, the cut of meat was indistinguishable and there was a strange chewy piece in the center. It really threw my meal off. Other than that, I really appreciated that this meal came with a generous side salad (arugula and light oily citrus dressing) and house potatoes. I think that's what really got my attention with this meal--I mean it's San Francisco and people are health conscious I guess. I really decked this meal out with a giant double bloody. They honored our request of more lime juice in the mix which we all really loved !

Did I mention this place is owned by the same people as Devils Teeth? You can even get a special breakfast sandwich just like at the bakery! Dope!
author: William R.

description:
Great place to go for brunch when you really don't want to stand on the sidewalk for an hour and as an after work/weekend destination with friends.

Sunset Reservoir Brewing is an expansive, high-ceilinged space and the deep caramel wood of the bar and tables warm up the industrial chic. 

Service is the real standout: Our party of 3 was seated within five minutes and attentively given menus, water and had coffee and cream set down while we gave the menu a final scan.

Plates came quickly and we were checked on frequently including an offer to re-do my plate when I mentioned the breakfast sliders ($12) were a little cold.

I seemed to have had the plate needing a little extra love: The scrambled egg slider didn't have any bacon muchless jalapeño jelly. The fried chicken slider had zero pepper jack cheese and if there was a promised drizzle of maple syrup, I didn't taste it.

While slightly disappointing, I didn't initially miss these things as this main was delicious, complete with a refreshing green salad and spicy, chunky home fries but I bet it would've hit it outta the park if the dish were complete. 

Sad face: I guess we'll have to return for a mulligan. 

My little boy gobbled up his kids' menu French toast with caramelized pear ($9 on the children's menu) and the side of bacon ($4) was cooked exactly as requested, not too crispy, and it was generously sized. 

Even given its expanse, the restaurant was nicely populated with hipsters, couples and families

(don't let the the name containing "brewery" discourage you that it's not kid-friendly for brunch; it is.)

Great bar and a serious brewery - I saw the brewing tanks behind a glass wall beyond the bar- make this a great place to spend the evening with a large or small group of friends. 

Huge TV screens broadcasting a football game made nearly every seat the best seat in the house from either level. 

The upstairs level has a great room-sized space perfect for a private party or a large group of friends wanting their own area to hang out. 

Two-tops along the outside ring look down onto the main dining area, perfect for people watching on a Friday or Saturday night. 

Hipster place in the Outer Sunset without the attitude but with all the elements that make it the next spot to really pop on the San Francisco scene.

Parking is extremely difficult in this neighborhood, it's a must to take Lyft or a taxi at night - and then you can also imbibe without worry. 

Atmosphere: 4.85
Service: 5.0
Food: 4.50 (ding for the missing elements from the bfast slider plate)
author: Jennifer O.

description: It's okay, nothing spectacular, I tried several items and it's was fine. I can't really remember so must not be outstanding. Nice selection of beer, it's not a place I would go searching for to eat at.
author: Regina G.

description: I don't give 4 stars often and I may be a little generous here, but this is about as good as it gets in the bay when considering everything: food, service, drinks, and general ambiance. These guys are not a Micheline 5-star 5-diamond dining experience, but I believe you'll agree that they make it difficult to not have an excellent experience.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Breweries are always a favorite of my friend and I, so we decided to check out the one close to home -- Sunset Reservoir.

The first thing that hit me was the lack of beer names! They're just the type of beer they are: "Pale Ale" and "Irish Red" aren't fun at all, especially when the Bay Area beer naming game is so hot. It seems like a minor thing, but I'm much more likely to enjoy a beer if it's got a fun name to go with it.

The second thing that hit me was the abundance of spirits. That's pretty uncommon for a brewery, but given that they only had a small handful of beers to choose from, I guess they have to pad out their selection somehow.

Anyway, since I'm a sucker for picso, I selected the Sunset Punch cocktail. What I got was baaaasically just lemon juice with a hint of pineapple and booze. I think it was the first cocktail I've ever had that physically pained me to drink. It was so sour that each sip caused a mini heartburn on the way down. Please, do not get this, _especially_ at $14.

Okay, attempt number two. Barley wine this time. It was bitter, as was expected given its 100 IBU rating, but didn't really have anything else to speak of. I just had it last night and have already completely forgotten what it tasted like. I remember not liking it much, though.

The only thing I liked about the place was the space itself. It had some verticality and felt, well, homey. But the refreshments made me wish I was at home instead, drinking out of a can.
author: Shawn W.

description:
The unexpected! Sunset Reservoir is nothing you'd expect! First who  expects to find a modern American brewery smack in the middle of mom and pop Chinese shops and restaurants in the Sunset District? 

Who expects to make on the spot reservations for a restaurant on a Friday night? We called from the car as we were driving from Daly City and the hostess said she will have a table for our party of 7 ready upon arrival. Really? On a busy Friday night???

And best of all, who expects alcoholic drinks, appetizers and dinner for 7 people to cost under $200 with tax and tip! Every dish we had was delicious and good sized portions. The green bean fries and pozole were AMAZING!!! And that right there is another unexpected...good pozole in an American brewery! Seriously, it was so good I wanted to pick up my bowl and thank mi abuela but then I remembered I'm not Mexican and don't have a Mexican Grandmother! 

So whether you're looking for a night of fun, good drinks, or yummy food Head to Sunset Reservoir. Remember Yelpers, drink responsibly and eat until you can't!
author: Celina Y.

description:
I admire what they've done with this space - a sprawling, modern affair - and I love how you can do tasting flights here too. Yet the offerings here are interchangeable with what's available in the rest of the West Bay. Don't get me wrong, the beers are fairly decent, whether the sour wheat, blonde, rye amber, Scottish ale, English IPA, and dry Irish stout (yes, I tasted them all), as is the food and the service, but is it really different from any other brewery that serves food, or any beer bar or restaurant out there?

Not really. At the end of the day, this is the perfect place for gentrifiers who probably wouldn't bother stepping into, say, any of the solid, down-home Asian eateries in the Sunset, let alone say, actually being part of the community. It's simply bringing more of the Mission or, worse yet, brotastic areas like the Marina to somewhat less expensive West Bay neighborhoods that, as a result, are becoming more banal and more vanilla by the minute.
author: Vincent L.

description:
This is my second try since they opened. I was hesitant about coming back since it lacked the brewery feel last time. 

Today, the food was great but the service was not good. 

Service:
When we came in it was pretty empty and got sat right away. The server toke our order and forgot my drink till way I was eating my meal. I watched other tables around us receive carafes of water but us. The server never came to ask how we were doing or refill our water and coffee till I asked a different server who helped pick up the slack. 
 
Food:
The chicken sandwich was delicious. It was moist and cooked perfectly. The breakfast sliders was a huge portion and kept us very full. 

Overall, I would come back for the food, but hope I get a better server.
author: Doris C.

description:
Over price. Waiters were tipsy. Beer was nasty. Food was just okay. Only thing I like was the location and atmosphere. The waiter didn't noticed us when we arrive even we we're right next to them for 2 min until I said Hello?
Beer we ordered pilsner and IPA, both not good at all.
author: Nazuki Y.

description: This place has everything, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves here. The bartenders take a bit to warm up but when they did, they were great. We spent most of the day here and experienced 3 bartenders, all very good and all made delicious cocktails. And the food - wow! The beet salad was fabulous, the pork chop was magnificent, the curry dish excellent. And all the sides were especially good: the deep fried snap peas, sweet potatoes fries and regular fries, all of them. The only disappointment, and the reason for only 4 stars were the beignets - overcooked hard little potato-like things, yuck. My daughter, who eats here often, said this was an anomaly. Maybe but won't try them again as it's hard to understand how a cook lets what we were served out of the kitchen when everything else was beautifully prepared and delicious. We will come here again and again tho, Sunset Reservoir is a total find for us :-)
author: Kim G.

description: While I had a bad experience in the past......... I decided to give this place a second chance since they are in my neighborhood. Came here with my girlfriend it was Taco Tuesday so we ordered the taco trio, which was ok. We also each ordered their pooled soup which was one of theeeeeeeeeeeee best I have ever had. Love it! I would recommend this dish to anyone looking to eat here. I have been back several times since. Just to get this soup
author: Michael W.

description:
Came back here for a second time. I like trying dishes here. Today I had the fish and chips and it did not disappoint. I wish I had more fish. It was good. Fries seem fresh. Comes with a unique tartar sauce and vinegar. Would like to try the burger sometime and the desserts although they are a little overpriced..that's why I am reluctant. Love the atmosphere. Service is good.

I do wish they had more items on the menu. It's a limited menu. Wish there was more variety and that it didn't have to be such an event to come here. Also, whenever they give change back, they don't give the exact change. Say your bill is $14.70 and you gave a $20, they'll give you $5, but you won't get the petty change. That's a pretty strange practice. I think you should give the full change!
author: Denise C.

description:
The 10 Of us came her for dinner on a Thursday night. We shared an order of arugula salad with pear
And Peacons and also the fried chicken which came with mashed potatoes and gravy and Cole slaw.  The salad was good but not worth $16. It was very small and the nuts were too big. I didn't want to crack my teeth. The fried chicken was excellent. However we got one big piece and one small piece.The mashed potatoes and gravy was delicious but the Cole slaw had no taste. The bill came to $60 for The salad, fried chicken, a beer and ginger beer. Apparently this place Charges $2 per Person for Some Health thing.
author: Donna L.

description:
Love having this place in my neighborhood!
The place is spacious and airy. Good beers, good food, and a decent wine list.
author: Mimi T.

description:
When I first came here, there was no sign. It was hardly on Yelp too so the hours of operation were not easy to find. Initially, this place was ok. It wasn't great, but it was just ok, considering the prices, food, and atmosphere. 

Now, I know it's called Sunset Reservoir (I guess it beats 'Outer Sunset hipster bar and grill'). The atmosphere is great. There's lots of wood and I think during brunch they put a little plant on your table so...the millennial 'rustic minimalist' vibe is still there, but honestly I love it. 

The staff is young and very friendly and accommodating. I appreciate honest recommendations and that's what they give here if it's your first time! Last time I was here, I ordered their special which was a bowl of wings dressed in their house-made spicy BBQ sauce. My dad ordered the mussels that came with chorizo and a tasty and zesty broth. yum! 

At first I thought the prices were a little high but realize that it was the standard price of bar food now so eat on, my friends! I have no complaints about their food! The only thing you should definitely know is that unlike other bar & grills, this place closes at 9pm because of its residential location.
author: Greg Y.

description: This was such a fun place to visit and is a great date spot.  The music is on point; great playlist.  Also the beer and liquor selection is excellent.  The mixed drinks were tasty and the beer was delicious.  The food was good too. I had a veggie burger however I wasn't the biggest fan of the fries.  The portions are a bit too small for my liking especially for the price.  One beer and an entree costed $30 which is pretty steep, however the dinning experience was excellent and the hostess was very friendly.  I would definitely come back here.
author: Jordan S.

description: If it wasn't for the some what decent beer, I would more or less be giving this place 1 star. Service is non-existent to the point where the staff are either chit chatting or only providing service to their friends. Our friends and I weren't the only group visibly questioning the staff inability to perform basic service. One individual even said "I know the owner" which is somehow great to brag about to customers? We could care less! If you're working or is supposed to work, please show some effort in doing it. Don't plant your feet into the floor with your friends/family while leaving everyone else waiting.
author: Mike Z.

description:
Usually I really like my neighborhood eateries and I have been here more than a dozen times.  The food is usually good and drinks well made.  But slowly the cocktails, and food have declined in its taste and speed on which it gets to your table.   But this last time I was here pretty much many many things went south.  From the service, waiter (blonde haired 20something Guy- too cool for school type)... took him a long time just to get our drink order.  Then he finally came to get our orders - we had a large group so I understand it took a while.... but when they completely forget 1 of the dishes and never ever apologized for the mishap... I was done!  I had to ask two other people where my friend's fish and chip.  Not even saying oh we will do something anything but nothing.  
My salmon was a bit undercooked, so were the veggies and had some hard beans. Took it home and fed it to the dog.  I had a bad taste in my mouth since the forgotten dish- it was my friend's first time to come to the restaurant and I believe her last time.  Everyone else drank and said they had good food... it's gonna be a long time before I go back.  Too many other places to eat and spend money at!
author: A. Marie L.

description: The staff is non existent, the managers are rude and abrasive, the place is filthy. It's honestly the most unprofessional, dirty bar I have had the displeasure of going to-which is unfortunate bc it's in a nice location and looks pretty from the outside and the inside. Don't let looks fool you...this place is an absolute dump!
author: Claire L.

description: My first time here.  Great food and very friendly staff.  I had the chicken sandwich, it's HUGE but of so good.  If you like spicy, this is for you.
author: Donatella Y.

description: Taco Tuesdays! We didn't even know and it was so good. I lived in San Diego for 10 years and I'll be honest, I'm always a bit hesitant to order beer battered fish tacos but they were amazing! The margarita was delicious too - more fresh lime flavor and not at all sweet. Looking forward to trying more items in the future. So happy to have discovered this neighborhood gem. Do yourself a favor and check it out. Happy hour menu from 3-6 too.
author: Christine V.

description:
This is a little hidden gem in the sunset. We were looking for a new dinner spot one night and there just happened to be parking right out front. Walked in without reservations and were immediately seated. Kiddo was given a kids menu and a set of crayons. The food and drinks were great! 

Chips/Dip - the dip was really well flavored!

Beet Salad - fresh and delicious!

Fish and chips - perfect texture and was not dry! Fish was fresh and sauces were great!

Kids pasta - as simple as it was, it was perfectly cooked pasta with just the right amount of butter.
author: Anyta L.

description:
The food here is super solid. I came in with no expectations but my buddy said the food was good and it was a pretty chill spot to eat at. 

If you love broccoli, they have a delicious appetizer that was full of flavor. The fries were good as well as the chicken sando. 

The best part of the meal was the pasta, the spaghetti bolognese. It was packed with flavor and had a familiarity to it. 

All in all, a great meal and would come back since we work pretty close by on Judah! Love supporting local! Next time, I'm trying the beer.
author: Gordon L.

description:
Was here last night. Wasn't packed at all for a Thursday night! I was pretty surprised since the NBA finals. My bud and I put our name down with the hostess, she said 25 min wait. I grabbed a brew and we just hung around watching the end of the game. Once the game ended we were say promptly. It cleared out even more after the game finished.  

Onto the brews. They make their own beer. I had the porter and my friend had the ipa. Both were ok. Not the best porter I've ever had but it was still good. A little bland. That being saod, my second drink was a mean Manhattan and that was everything I could've wished for. Conclusion, their crafted beers are cool, but get a proper drink. 

The food, I got the quesadilla based on the pretty servers recommendation. It was ok as well. Stuffed but no flavor. I am still surprised how much chicken they put in there. My bud went with a burger, he said it was solid. The Brussels sprouts appetizer is where it's at. That was wonderful. 

The ambiance is relaxed. Foot traffic is constant. It's not too crowded but at the same time there's people there. It would be weird if I was the only person there. I would definitely go back.
author: Mark G.

description: Gabby is by far the best server you can have !!! She served my party of 10 with such patients and attentiveness. Definitely coming back and hopefully I get her again!!
author: Tierra B.

description:
I'm kind of late with this review.

I honestly forgot until I was going over my bank statement and saw the charge for this restaurant.

There was a female host who seemed like she was a little stressed out but there was a lot of people that evening, so I believe she was trying to focus. She was excellent, and I think we only had to wait less than ten minutes for a table.

Now the server is who I remember. Ben, the comedian, is how I remember him. I already noticed him because of the bar I go to for an after work drink from time to time; he does an open mic there on Mondays. Ben was well spoken and a great server. He suggested the wings to start things off then suggested you guys fried chicken sandwich for the main course. The food came out hot and promptly also. Ben did a great job with checking on us to see how the food was and how things are going in general. 

All in all, I definitely will be back, and I hope Ben is working there also. Good food and some jokes are a great way to end the night.
author: Robert G.

description:
We personally probably wouldn't come here if it weren't a block and a half from our house.  

First of all, for those who don't know the Sunset, this bar/restaurant is in the CENTRAL - Not the Outer Sunset.  Outer Sunset means past Sunset Blvd.

Anyway, I'm surprised at all reviewers who loved the beer and food here.  We think the food is only OK, but maybe because we're mostly vegetarian.  I did have the baby kale salad which was awesome.  But the veggie burger is totally meh.  Our grade-schooler had the kids rotini pasta and butter + parmesan which she liked and cleared the bowl.  

The beer is disappointing.  It's just not that tasty.  

The service was meh.  The person who seated us was quite nice, but our server seemed in a bad mood or maybe she's just not super friendly.  But she did check up on us several times.  

Overall, this is a decent place to come if you're already close by.   But not worth a trip for your whole party.
author: Vinayak J.

description:
TL:DR Slow service , expensive food, pass!!

Came for Sunday brunch during the NLF playoffs. I was told it would be a 15 min said but it ended up being 40. There were at least 3-4 tables that were uncleaned. There was about 2 waitresses and one waiter working this big restaurant. Another busboy and waiter came after we were seated. 

Food:
We ordered the French toast, eggs Benedict, and devil teeth's sandwich(double the price of the store front). The food took about 30 minutes to arrive. 

Our French toast arrived and we waited for the other dishes to arrive. 5 minutes later and still no food! The waiter came by and noticed that they had forgotten the other dishes. When the sandwiches arrived, they looked so pathetic. The egg in the devils teeth sandwich was non existent. 
We were starving so we ate It anyways. When the waiter asked us how the food was, we told him and he automatically knew and apologized. He comped us both sandwiches and a desert and remade us a new one which was nice. 

We ordered the ice cream sandwich and it was so frozen I think I chipped my teeth biting into it

Nice atmosphere but the lack of service and mediocre food kills it
author: Daniel S.

description: I have definitely grown to love this place, even if their beer selection can be monotonous at times. First off, who can say no to that huge plate of mac and cheese? For only $11, you get a massive bowl of ooey mac goodness with crunchy breadcrumbs on top and plenty of bacon in between. It'll burn your tongue and still leave you feeling amazing. Then, you've got their fish and chips, which comes in an even larger bowl of kennebec fries and perfectly crisp, flaky hunks of fish. Also a steal at under $15. During happy hours, you'll get their taps for $5-6, and even when it's not, drinks are still $6-7. This place is packed now though; the word is out. My only wish is that they have a larger variety of beers. I love my IPAs, but they are palette wreckers, and after a couple, I long for a house lager or just pale ale, but most of the time, it's not available.
author: Danny C.

description: 3.5 stars on Yelp is a tough place to be. But maybe that's a good thing for those like me who actually liked the place and don't want it to become over run! For starters, parking on a Friday evening wasn't impossible. The space was lovely with high ceilings and lots of seating. Portions were generous, making city dining less painful. Service was solid. Our burgers were cooked medium as preferred, with a yummy chipotle aioli spread. Fries were great. Kid friendly with booster seats, crayons and paper place mats to color on, plastic cups with lids and straws, and a thoughtful kids menu - all options $9. Ordered fish and chips for the kiddo, and they were really tasty. The pool of good restaurant options shrink when dining with a squirmy toddler, so we were happy to find this place. Bless you, Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Solid 4.5 stars. The food was great! The service was friendly. The crowd was ok. The beer was the only small drawback. My stout was VERY carbonated. Not sure if it was the draught or the beer itself. 

MUST HAVES: shishito peppers and the burger

SKIP OUT: brussel sprouts (oily and overly salty)
author: Stephen Y.

description:
Ok so first thing: draft beer at the bar is TWO DOLLARS cheaper than draft beer at the restaurant. Maybe I don't get out enough.. is that a thing???

I beat my friend here so I sat at the bar and grabbed a beer just to pass the time as I scrolled through endless social media things (as millenials are wont to do, amirite?) Anyway. It was $5 which I thought was pretty sweet for a hipster-ish bar in San Francisco. When he got there and we were seated, I was going to order a second drink but listed on the menu they were $7. Mreh. I know it's not that much money but it's the principle of the thing!

Also, the food was fairly standard which is probably why I can't give this place four stars. We shared the french onion dip, the pork tacos, and the fish and chips. This was actually a good amount of food for the two of us and the dishes themselves were pretty tasty but I don't know that they were anything to write home about.

The brewery is actually housed in this location I believe but it looked pretty small and didn't seem like they did tours or any such things there. The tanks are just viewable from the restaurant.

Good food, cool vibe, beer at a reasonable price (if you sit at the bar). I'd say this place is more suited for football games (the bar area is equipped with several TVs that were playing the sports things while we were there) than a date or a family meal.
author: Shannon H.

description: Waited for a while to get service at the bar, a server actually called the bartender for me which was nice of her, she also let me know I was sitting in a bar service area. The bartender got je beer and took my order. Ipa and a chicken sandwich. Fried chicken Cole slaw and chipotle aioli. The fries were super crispy and so was the chicken. The chicken was also tender and juicy. A chicken breast it wasn't, likely a couple of breast tenders( they are cheaper than breasts) but still very good. Luckily I opened my sandwich before biting in because there were 7 extremely sloppily cut jalapenos on the 1 sandwich. I wont be back with my kids unfortunately since I would have to go through all their food just to make sure things that weren't supposed to be there weren't.
author: Coco T.

description: Ok went for the steak over the burger.  Meh.  Steak was good but absolute smallest portion you could get to still call it a entree.  26 bucks should get you something that is a size of a steak (8-9 ounces at least right???- even if it sucks) oversized asparagus (cheap) too.  A brewing company without a brewer as well.  Keep fooling the hipsters or try and survive selling 16$ burgers.  I should of got the burger.
author: albert h.

description:
DATE NIGHT! =)

This spot is a gem. I love that it is tucked away in the City and you probably have to know about it to stumble upon it. The outside is discreet aside from a HUGE light display that reads, "BEER". Awwww, yea! 

Walking in, you will be met with a smile from any of their hosts, and a charming wooden antique dream of an establishment. I'm a sucker for rustic decor. GOT'eem! 

I ordered the fish and chips and their signature IPA. I left a very happy camper and will definitely be back. 

ps. PLAYLIST ON POINT. =)
author: Daniela G.

description: Love this place! Great atmosphere! Great food! Great drinks! Love the bar staff, everyone is super nice! Bathrooms clean and a great place to spend your weekends Jeremiah is so great! Always attentive and our favorite bartender!
author: Flavia D.

description: Food's good, fried green beans are to die for. Wasn't crazy about their own brews, but I'm not a beer snob so... Yeah... Drinks are expensive, but they do have a cool happy hour. Parking can be a beotch! Neat little spot to chill though, very hipster if you're into that... But if you're not, probably other places that'd float your boat better with less expensive drinks and regular beers on tap
author: Danielle K.

description:
Wood, metal and glass. From the large floor-to-ceiling glass windows to the wood beams, the Sunset Reservoir Brewery is a large modern space serving up some delicious in-house beers. The interior is beautifully designed with wood-paneled railings and a large wall with live plants, setting up a good contrast between organic and industrial elements of the building. 

There were six beers on tap: a Baltic Porter, London Brown Ale, Pale Ale, Sour Ale, Amber Ale and a IPA. I ordered the Pale Ale, Kennebec fries and wings during happy hour and was pleased with the food and drinks. The fries were firm and crispy with just the right amount of herbs and the wings weren't too saucy. 

Sunset Reservoir Brewery is an excellent spot to hang out  with friends and family and I would recommend it.
author: Steven L.

description:
Am I at a shared tech work space or a bar?? 

This is probably one of my favorite local breweries. 
Until one night the owner came up and kicked out myself and 5 of my close friends, apparently after our 1 glass of wine and 4 burgers, we needed to be cut off. This is the most straight edge brewery in SF. Never come here, unless you are bringing ur 80 year old grandma and want to be watched like a hawk while you enjoy a shitty IPA. Do they even brew their own beer?
author: Scott V.

description: I thought this place was okay. Came with a bunch of coworkers that one day when it was 106 in SF...they didn't have AC so I was sweating bullets while eating my burger (I believe I ordered "the burger"). The food was alright, basically your standard bar food - burgers, sandwiches, salad, fried chicken, etc. I did like the setting and the vibe, but the food was just A-OK.
author: Angela C.

description:
This review is for the bar and beer only as I have not tried any of the food there!

Great brewery in the Outer Sunset! I been here a few times now and believe now is a good time to write up a review!

Bartenders are great! They are knowledgeable on what kind of beer they got and they are pleasant to be around! 

So far i have tried the Pilsner, Pale Ale, IPA, and the Brown Sugar Pale Porter! All of them are great! Great spot for some awesome brews! There are'nt too many bars in the sunset area but this one is definitely up there!
author: Daniel S.

description: Love having a great brewery in the neighborhood. Fantastic beer and a really solid selection of apps and brunch food for those hungover Sundays.
author: Shiv C.

description: Made a same day yelp reservation for a Sat early afternoon.  Easy free parking by the reservoir on Ortega.  A bit loud with the 2 tvs going, but the booths were comfortable and able to hold a conversation.  Family friendly as many parents with young kids there.  Ordered the burger with sweet potato fries hit the spot; juicy grass fed beef.  Would come again for the more expanded dinner menu.  The brunch menu was a bit limited and just okay and nothing special.  Service was attentive and friendly as the waitress stopped by 3 times in about 2 hrs to see if anything was needed was perfect.  For early afternoon I don't think reservations were necessary, but probably later after 6pm is probably a good idea.
author: David K.

description: First time here and definitely going back food is really good definitely recommend their burgers. Fries might need a little work but over all place is great. Fried calamari was cooked perfect. Place and ambiance is good good vibe from ppl
author: Ivan C.

description:
When this place popped up a couple years ago I came in for lunch and have been coming back on a regular basis ever since. 

The menu isn't large, but everything is very good! My favorites: BLTE (E stands for egg). One of the best sandwiches in the City. Get that with the Shoshito peppers and a beer and you are living the good life. The beers are always solid, with the exception of the sour, which isn't very sour. 

The waiters and bartenders are very nice and pleasant to talk to.  Most of the time I strike up a conversation with other patrons who sit near me at the bar. Everyone is very nice. 

The location is great with not much else in the area to go for lunch. Parking is not hard, and free one hour parking can be found on the street in front of the place. 

All in all if you are in the Sunset and want a place to eat join me for lunch at Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company!
author: David W.

description: Good selection on food. Nice salad selection. Their specialty is their fried chicken and the fish and chip which are both good. Their fired peppers are also great. The beer is okay. The staff are friendly and attentive. Parking can be difficult but it's worth the time. Everything is fresh and very tasty.
author: Andrew M.

description: Went here for a GNO and at first the location kind of threw me off but it's actually a chill spot! I like how they have outside seating upstairs, there's plenty of seats downstairs & upstairs. We ordered wings, garlic fries, and I had a beer flight! The wings were good, they give a good amount.. enough for 3 ppl! We asked for the sauce on the side and they gave us like 4 types of sauce which were super yummy! The garlic fries were good too, average.. but good! I also really enjoyed the beer flight, enough for a good buzz! I def reccommend this place for a night out with friends or significant other. Really enjoyed the vibez here!
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Happy hour worthy. Spanish peppers a good deal. Nice selection of beers and they know how to charge for foo foo drinks. 
Return for beer and basics. Nice bartenders
author: K H.

description: Came here for beers and wings. Only had the ipa and enjoyed it.  Got the fenion dip and chips.  Awesome.  The shishito peppers, kale salad w/salmon and way more wings then a human can consume.  All great and delivered with style.  Will come again
author: Robert F.

description:
First and foremost: great beer. They do a good job of rotating their lineup and it's always high quality. Prices might've gone up a bit lately but it's hard to blame them for that since costs are rising across the board for restaurants in SF. 
Food is solid as well and the volume level makes it fairly kid-friendly. Glad this place is in our neighborhood as a solid go-to with or without the little ones.
author: Greg C.

description:
CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD STATEMENT AFTER EATING HERE. On 11/21 I ate at the Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company- charged $27.27 to my credit card and left a cash tip. The charge on my credit card statement for that evening was $41.27, which is $14.00 more than what I authorized. Contacted my bank and the restaurant about this fraud. 

KEEP YOUR CUSTOMER RECEIPT!
author: Jamie R.

description:
This place severely missed the mark. 

I had heard about this place through friends and was told it was something worth checking out. My friends and I already had dinner, so we decided to come here for some drinks and a couple of bites.

There was a decent amount of people with a waitlist built up, so we decided to be flexible and do bar seating. We were at a table just off to the side of the bar, which was fine. The hostess was sweet and everything seemed fine, until...

I ordered the stout, which was really just a super dark ale. It was horrible, I didn't care for it. But hey, maybe that was just a pallet thing, fine. We ordered our food at the bar, told them where we would be sitting, everything checked out fine. All we ordered was some brussel sprouts and churros.

We then find ourselves waiting 20 minutes with no sign of food. I went and checked in with one of the staff members, I believe she was the hostess. She was nice, being that she helped out even though it wasn't her job to make sure orders were going through. 5-7 minutes later we get these brussel sprouts. We snack on them expecting churros to come out shortly. 

I kid you not, after a grand total of maybe 45 minutes, we checked in again and mentioned we had been waiting for 45 minutes for our damn churros Guy at the repsonds with "sorry bro, uh, let me check on that." I'm sorry, that response really rubbed me the wrong way. Shortly after, we then get a waiter showing up at our tables telling us the POS system had been messing up all night and that they were out of churros. I'm sorry, but that just doesn't cut it. We had to keep inquiring about our order when you knew your POS system wasn't cooperating? The waiter asked us if we wanted something else, maybe telling us you were out of churros (35 minutes ago) would have been nice.

Total disappointment, disgraceful service. 45 minutes for a stout, some brussel sprouts, and to be told churros were out. Thanks for nothing
author: Aaron C.

description:
I would never have thought I'd write a 5 star review for brewery pizza... yet here I am. The crust was absolutely perfect (!!!) and there was no shortage of fresh toppings. But back to the crust - there was just the right amount of crunch on the outside but it was still soft and a little gooey (is that even the right descriptor?) on the inside. The cheese was melty and it wasn't dripping with grease. 5/5 for sure. We also tried the buffalo wings which were pretty good. You get about 15 in a basket and there was a good amount of kick in the sauce. For beer, we tried the pale ale and the big red. I liked the big red and they have a decent selection, enough that you have a good amount of choices but not too many where you get choice paralysis. 

Total came out to be about $40 for 2 beers, a pizza, and a basket of wings + tax/tip. 

Jeez I'm just so impressed with that pizza.
author: Selena S.

description: Beware of this place when getting gift cards.  I went in here shortly before Christmas to a get a gift card and I was charged a $2.00 service fee.  I inquired about the fee and the person helping me said it was because of city taxes.  C'mon now, really?   I just went to Devil's Teeth an hour earlier and they didn't charge me.  Hmm...I bought one from Noriega Teriyaki at the corner and they didn't charge me.  So I continued questioning.  Is this a new tax? And she told me it varied all over the city depending on the restaurant.  What!?! I'm a native San Franciscan and I've never had this.  Sadly, she had already ran the charge before I noticed it.  Buyer beware!
author: Donna W.

description:
Super bummed! I love this place and I really strive to support small neighbor hood run businesses but this place is so inconsistent! I've dined here a lot, At least once a month. Sometimes I come and the service and food is on point and other times it's totally off. They finally have some really great fun and social bartenders and friendly hostesses. But the food is really hit or miss. 

Tonight, I paid 6$ for fries "take out" and it was like they just gave me the leftovers from someone else's plate or what was left in the fryer after serving dine-in customers. Hardly any fries, cold, super small,  and then I asked for a side of aioli/ mayo and either they gave me Cesar dressing or it's completely bad/ funky. 

 It just sucks bc all I wanted was to treat myself and it was kinda just ruined. I really hope they can get the cooks and staff to care about the loyal neighborhood customers because after so many inconsistencies it's really hard to keep coming back.
author: Samantha J.

description: Great front of house service and decent food. I'd return. Be sure to make reservations!
author: Crystal K.

description: What can I say?  Habit Burger does a better job on food and service than this place.  Disorganized hot mess.  Waits while empty tables sit.  No one to offer a menu or water.  We had to look up the menu online and stop someone to order.  Food took unreasonably long to arrive - 47min?!? Really?  For a plate of fried green beans?!?  When they finally arrive, it's clear they used old oil.  Habit green beans are hands down much better.  Last, for a place with a giant BEER sign, I expect the beer to be good.  Best I can say is that it was tolerable.  Never again.
author: Win L.

description: Came in on a Sunday, and 2 out of the 4 taps were out, kind of crummy when you call yourself a brewing company.  The waitress was also rude.  I am not one to talk shit on yelp, but was disappointed.  The space is built out beautifully, very sleek and reclaimed wood.  The food looked pristine, but upon closer inspection was not as good at it looked. biscuit sliders were not warm, cheese not melted. Got the corporate hipster vibe here and not how I remembered the sunset.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I went in on a lazy Sunday last weekend. I ordered the "Big Bowl of Wings" and a sampler of their house beers. 
Let me start off with the wings,yes, there were a lot of them. The Frank's hot sauce worked well with the wings. Problem is that the wings were small, I should say tiny. As such,I am a big eater and the wings were not substantial enough to satisfy my hunger.
I would've ordered more food but the beers were quite mild. At this point I just wanted to finish up and go to another brewery.
The service was polite and attentive. I just wish the beer was a little bit more bold in flavor and the wings more sunstantial.
author: Zardu H.

description:
Overall a cool place to chill and try out some unique brews. The atmosphere is nice,good lighting and seating. Drive by this place so many times,finally decided to give it a try. 
Why 3 stars? Because I am not impressed,maybe just me having too much of a  expectation.  Since this place is one of the few places in this side of the city,I had high expectations that they have good food and drinks. 
I had the sampler,came with 6 varieties , dark ale,IPA..(Can't recall everything), only mediocre except the IPA. 
And the food?maybe I didn't expect anything about the food,I actually enjoyed the food here. Fresh and well seasoned. 
Maybe just my pallet,ill give it another try,will update again.
author: Neo C.

description: Went for a birthday & trivia night.  The service  needs improvement because it was slow & a few orders were wrong.  The food is overpriced & just ok.  Disappointed that pineapple salsa is listed with the pork tacos but they arrived with plain regular salsa.  When I asked the guy who brought them out said they didn't have pineapple salsa.  BTW, they do nothing special for a birthday celebration.
author: Kim S.

description:
We REALLY want to like this place. It's exactly what the neighborhood needed, the food is decent (not great, but good) & and the beer is fine.  The real complaint is around the terribly SLOW service.  We've been here maybe 6 times and without fail the hostess is nowhere to be found and seems to make guest appearances at the stand every 10 minutes or so.  While waiting for a table, we always see other people come in, wait a while for the hostess, get fed up and leave.  
Table service is also super slow, but friendly enough. 
I guess the overall attitude is typical for the Bay Area where you get the feeling that you're inconveniencing the staff by coming in. 
I want to give 2.5 stars, but will round up to 3.
author: Kent F.

description: Haven't been in a while so I decided to see if anything had improved. Stood at the bar with a $20 bill in my hand for 10 minutes while the "bartenders" ignored me and talked to their friends. As a person who works in the service industry, I have a lot of patience when it comes to bartenders, servers etc. However, if it isn't busy and you can't get a drink due to inattentive staff, all bets are off. Absolutely useless is how I would describe them. Who hires these clowns?
author: Kevin H.

description:
I'm not sure whether SF purists lament Sunset Reservoir Brewing Co.'s entry as gentrification as a trendy brewery restaurant encroaching upon the otherwise low-key neighborhood, or applaud it as a long-awaited addition that brings the community closer together through craft beer and gastropub-esque food.

In any case, Sunset Reservoir has exceeded my expectations. Their happy hour menu is a fairly good deal (in SF terms, meaning you can dine rather extravagantly without going broke;). I'm also impressed by their brunch, and even more impressed by how under-the-radar it is. (Everyone flocks to Outerlands for the cult-like 1-hour+ wait, culminating in overpriced small plates.) As expected for a brewery, SRBC's beer is solid, though I am more savvy on food than beer, as you can tell with the detail in this review.

(Note: SRBC = Sunset Reservoir Brewing Co. It's not an acronym that rolls off the tip of the tongue, but preferable to typing it out every time)

[PART I - BRUNCH REVIEW]

(++) French toast - housemade beer bread, seasonal fruit ($12): This is catered towards adult beer enthusiasts, as the beer approaches the upper limit for French toast before becoming beer toast. (I can imagine kids making faces at the taste of the infused beer). On the day I went, the fruit topping consisted of baked cinnamon apples, very reminiscent of apple pies. The light sweetness and dimension of spice masterfully complemented the bitterness of the beer.

(+++) Breakfast sliders - two buttermilk biscuit sliders, home fries, side salad ($12):
*eggs, bacon, cheddar, avocado & jalapeno jelly
*fried chicken, pepper jack & maple syrup
(Tip: you can get one of each!) The sliders may look small, but the buttermilk biscuits are an honorable mention. After all, SRBC is owned by the same people as Devil's Teeth, and the eggs/bacon/cheddar/avo/jalapeno jelly indeed conjures blissful memories of DT's famous breakfast sandwich. SRBC adds a little flair of gastropub-like cuisine by turning them into sliders and incorporating adventurous ingredients such as jalapeno jelly and maple syrup. Additionally, the potatoes had a nice outer crisp.

(++) Chilaquiles - tortilla chips, scrambled eggs, salsa tomatillo, avocado, ricotta, side salad ($10): I'm usually not a huge fan of chilaquiles, but SRBC's is surprisingly delicious and memorable. The sauce is very heavily tomato-based, interestingly similar to pasta, with an additional zesty kick from spices (I suspect paprika). I would have liked black beans in this, and I think they substituted sour cream for ricotta. Nonetheless, with the portion size and generous amount of avocado, this is a hearty and satisfying brunch plate. The accompanying salad is fresh and crisp, though they use more vinaigrette than I'd like.

[PART II - HAPPY HOUR REVIEW]

(+) Sliders  ($8)
*fried chicken
*pulled pork
The filling was flavorful, and the brioche bun tasted like garlic bread, wonderfully buttery but not too heavy. I would have appreciated a side salad, but I guess unhealthy savory food is the essence of happy hour.

(+++) Fish and chips ($10): I was still thinking about this the next day.... (and no it wasn't due to being hungover).  I actually liked this more than the more well known fish n chips at Fish in Marin. The fish retained a moist juiciness and flavor, and the ratio of batter was just perfect for an indulgent amount of crispiness. 

(+) Buffalo wings - franks red hot sauce ($10): The thin fried outer coating added a nice hint of crunch, and the hot sauce is.... hot. Goes great with beer, but those who fear spiciness may want to avoid. In any case, the portion is huge. Happy hour is indeed happy here.

(++) Beer flight ($12) - Good selection of diverse beers with distinct profiles. I initially discounted the cupcake pan as tacky, but it's really quite practical and the beer flight still looks rather photogenic.

[OVERALL IMPRESSION]

The decor is industrial chic, with lots of wood, metal, and brick (plus succulents, of course). It features a neat high-ceiling, partial dual-level layout which reminded me of Nopa.

My first impression wasn't great: we arrived at the very tail end of happy hour, rushed to the bar, put on our puppy eyes, and asked if we may order off the happy hour menu. The bartender was gruff and terse, and it was honestly difficult to tell if he was joking. I'll give him the benefit of the doubt since he was lenient granted the happy hour menu. 

SRBC reminds me of Social Brewery in the Inner Sunset, except I find the food here wayy better. It's more fine-tuned, more intriguing, and bigger portions. I'm definitely willing to trek out to the Outer Sunset for the noms of SRBC. 

So if SRBC is owned by the same people as Devil's Teeth, does that make it gentrification as an expansion of a local business, or counter-gentrification as the successful expansion of a local business....? I'm not sure whether I'll ever understand SF.
author: Edna C.

description: Bartenders are super nice, the food and drinks are delicious and the trivia on Tuesdays is really fun!
author: Zep B.

description:
Beer selection a little difficult to understand -- why not have a Pilsner in the summer? Most of the selection is dark, so not a lot of variety.

Staff is great though.
author: KS K.

description: I am a Sunset native and am pleased to have this brewery In my neighborhood. The food is FANTASTIC! Our favorites are the Pozole and the Chicken Sandwich. The staff are super friendly and always accommodating.
author: Tami A.

description: Always love coming here to hangout with my buds. Never too crowded. Must always order the fries because I love their aioli!
author: Cindy W.

description: They have been getting better and better since opening, from the food to the beers! For a small, relatively young brewery they have a small number of good beers in a wide spectrum. I love(d) being able to walk over and fill up a growler! (Pleeeeeeease bring back growler fill ups!)
author: Matt V.

description: I like testing something new for me. Our company ordered a lot and we weren't disappointed. Good selection of beer. My fish and chips were really good. Nice prices. High recommend !!!
author: Antoni C.

description:
Went here again and was given bad service.  I don't like seeing tables that get sat after me get drinks and food before I can even place an order.   

Went with the fams again.  Took a while to get the server to the table. Dropped water and left. Two tables came in after me and they got their drinks and food before us.  Went to the server that seemed to be on his game and asked about drinks and tol dme that our server was busy and he was going to take care of us.  Nice teamwork. Way to get your boys back. You make $14/hr? Health bennys? You want to see your establishment succeed?

Server was not good. He didn't even order our drinks until I said something. Saw a manager posing as an expo.  Sat in the window and did not see him do one thing except deliver one plate of food with a smile. At least he smiled. 

Losing out here. My wife and I would have had maybe 3 drinks each as we were celebrating.  Dude could barely get us one drink. What a joke. Missing out on sales. I mean that is why you're there. Right? Sales? Tips? Make money? 

Food was good. Came out fast after I was on the radar.  Server wasn't good. Sucks when you drop a bill and regret it.  Return? Not sure yet.
author: Anthony R.

description: There's nothing I don't love about Sunset Brewery. They have great craft beers, great food especially their burger and devils teeth breakfast sandwiches, and great service. There's so much space too so great for big parties which is hard to find in SF. I'll definitely be going back.
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
The review is only for the beer... I had a pint of their ale and it was just ok(budweiser level). My friend got a mixed drink and food which he loved. 

Stars are skewed because of the fact they call themselves a Brewing Company and I don't recommend the beer. Otherwise if they didn't claim beer as their signature items it is a solid 4 star joint.
author: yoni s.

description:
This place is really worth 4.5 stars. Some dishes are great. The artichoke and tarragon sauce are great. The chips and dip aren't bad. The taco Tuesday specials are solid. 

The burger is great when cooked correctly. But it is inconsistent. I like my burger on the redder side. But it often comes out "well done" even when ordered as "rare."  

Brunch here is also solid, but not perfect. My wife raves about the pancakes, and the breakfast sandwiches are the same as the amazing ones served at Devil's Teeth. The burrito is solid, but the potatoes bravas are not as good as the place claims. 

Be aware: they are spotty on take out. It is better to eat in the restaurant itself.
author: Jon L.

description: BEER has nice, modern/rustic look which I liked a lot. The place is out of the norm located in sunset neighborhood. The atmosphere is warm, casual, friendly and sweet place to socialize. For food we tried fried chicken, fish and chips, polenta and Mac & cheese. The fried chicken was nice and crispy. Although it was tasty I wish it wasn't as over fried as I'd like. Perhaps it would've been perfect if it was fried less than 1-2 minutes. The Mac and cheese was SUPER cheesy which I liked. The touch of bacon was good. Fish and chip was good. The service was good even when we were seated next to the bar. The bar people tended to our family.
author: Kay D.

description: came here with a friend and had a little too high of an expectation for this place. the food was decent but the service wasn't as good as i thought it should be. we sat upstairs and there was only one person taking orders upstairs. i guess the upstairs is too small to have two servers but i felt like we waited about 20 minutes to put our order in and another 20 minutes for our drinks. the lady said she was going to take half off of our drinks because it took so long but when we received the check, it was still full price, i guess no biggie though. the mac and cheese was very filling though and i did have to take about half of it home. the beers were good but nothing really special. gave it a four star because of the interior and food but knocked off one star for service.
author: diane d.

description:
Two stars for the bingets and dips. The rest of the food meh. The place is like a icebox, service is spotty but nice,,bacon floppy, food none of it hot, oh and the cold cement seats....omg we froze our asses off for real. Best was the coffee and bingets. The rest meh. 
Thank goodness for the wonderful company. We were visiting our dear dear 89 year old friend who lives right around the corner. They need to get a heater and cook and serve the food hot...oh yeah crisp up that bacon.
author: Ann L.

description:
Honestly, I would give this place 4.5 stars. 

I made reservations for 6 the day before using the Yelp Reservation system and our seats were ready and waiting for us upstairs. Not bad for a Friday evening. Finding parking, however, was another story. Don't even bother trying to find a spot on Noriega and try to go down the avenues.

Started off the night with their beer flight which includes 6 of their beers made right on site for $12. Their pale ale isn't very hoppy and I kind of like that. I'm not the biggest fan of the IPA (except for Russian River Brewing's Pliny the Elder). Overall, decent flight served in a muffin pan! 

I ended up getting their Fried Chicken that came with mashed potatoes and gravy and coleslaw ($16). The chicken had a nice crispiness to it and was of sufficient size. I could've used a bit more of the slaw but was happy with the overall dish. 

Overall, great random little brewery in the Sunset with a good selection of food and beers made on site (it's brewery for goodness sakes!). There aren't any TVs to watch any sports games upstairs so if you're here for that then stay down in the bar area.
author: Sam L.

description:
Except for when people would "TyPe LiK Dis" (facepalm), I've never considered myself a huge stickler for proper grammar.  I certainly try my best, but I know I make my fair share of mistakes. Over the years though, it's become like nails on a chalkboard when I see people misuse there/they're/their, you're/your, and "could/should of" instead of "could've/should've".  In the spirit of that, I'm dedicating this review to something that gets misused just as much:

The Oxford Comma.

Before I get to that though, let me just say that I'm still super stoked that a place like Sunset  Reservoir Brewery has popped up in an area known more for its Asian markets and eateries than anything else.  Their beers have all been fantastic (love the Blonde Ale and Autumn Bier) and the menu is pretty solid.  Although my friends and I have only managed to order the unhealthy stuff (it's a brewery, after all), there are several "gastropub"-type alternatives that look rather enticing (mussels, pasta bolognese, etc.).

-- HUSH PUPPIES - Onion, Corn, Jalapeno, Frisse, Sweet & Spicy Dip...$8
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunset-reservoir-brewing-company-san-francisco?select=8wo1Jj98hp-QuytWt14b7A)
Pretty meh overall.  While I didn't taste much beyond the corn and jalapeno, the flavors were good (as was the dip).  That said, the texture was a bit dry.  Plus, while they weren't exactly dense, these weren't light bites either.

-- THE BURGER - Double Patty, Bacon, Cheddar, Avocado, Russian Dressing, Fries...$16
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunset-reservoir-brewing-company-san-francisco?select=SxRBTIIWGEjCV-wUDLJn2w)
The burger was pretty beefy (two patties!), but that's about all I got from it.  Individually, the bacon, cheese, and avocado were fine.  However, the patties needed more seasoning, as they tasted purely like ground beef (that sounds odd, I know).

-- FRIED CHICKEN - Boneless Chicken Thighs, Mashed Potatoes, Pork Gravy, and Coleslaw...$16
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunset-reservoir-brewing-company-san-francisco?select=ewc20wiAs7n97T_50WWtqQ)
The best thing I've had here (I've ordered it twice).  Their quantity and size vary, but the pieces have all been juicy, crispy, and well seasoned.  The mashed potatoes were great as well; smooth and complemented well by the gravy.  The only flaw was the coleslaw - flavorful, but very heavy on the pepper the second time around.

-- MAC & CHEESE BITES - Pepper Jack Cheese, Old Bay Marinara Sauce...$8
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunset-reservoir-brewing-company-san-francisco?select=JI818_PkYxVfJqcQF7tAEw)
The mac was tender and each bite had a good amount of flavor.  That said, I wish it was a little cheesier.  Still, it's worth trying and better than the hush puppies.  As for the marinara, it was a little watery, but the bites didn't really need it.

-- FISH & CHIPS - Beer Battered Tilapia...$10
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunset-reservoir-brewing-company-san-francisco?select=-vEPoC5m7rvpoa9YbXfbxQ)
It's listed under "small plates" but the portion is HUGE!  As much as The Burger wasn't worth the money, this one was.  The tilapia was fried to the perfect crispiness yet managed to maintain its flavors.  Delicious and not hurt at all by all of the fries underneath.

-- KENNEBEC FRIES with Chipotle Aioli...$5
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunset-reservoir-brewing-company-san-francisco?select=GAc_GXujmqhtyhbdjDtKQw)
Quite a heaping plate for the money.  Some of the pieces were a little soggy, but the vast majority were fine.  I wonder how they would have been if we had upgraded them to garlic fries (+$2), but the fries and aioli were good enough on their own.

-- HOUSEMADE ICE CREAM...$2/scoop
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunset-reservoir-brewing-company-san-francisco?select=f0zKxlGgk9fg7EDQ7LiZ8g)
My friend and I intended to try only two flavors, but we ended up with a third (see below).  Texturally, all three were more runny than creamy, but the THIN MINT tasted the best, by far - flavorful, yet not too minty.  The BLACK SESAME needed a larger punch (plus, it tasted more like white sesame) and the GINGERBREAD might have benefited from a burnt/bitter tinge (a la "gingerbread cookie").

As for the Oxford Comma (or lack thereof), the menu read, "..., Black Sesame, Gingerbread & Thin Mint".  This, on top of the fact that it was joined by an "&" (like their "mac & cheese"), suggested that the latter two were actually a single flavor (and an interesting one at that).  However, had it been written, "..., Black Sesame, Gingerbread, and Thin Mint", clearly three flavors (see??  I'm not crazy!).

In any case, THREE AND A HALF STARS overall, but rounded down.  Much like with the food, service was a little hit and miss - great the first time I was here, less so the second, and okay on the third.  However, I will say the lack of the Oxford Comma left a bad taste in my mouth.  I know...kind of nitpicky of me, and perhaps a little anal, but hey, that was just my two (hundred) cents.
author: Mike L.

description:
This is my first visit and I'm sure it won't be last. I was pleasantly surprised at how the neighborhood has changed. I used to visit her often, since my mother used to work up the street and I used get comic books next door which no longer exists. 
Since today is Sunday, they were serving brunch. The menu has a good variety of choices, many items I would like to come back and try. But for today, I had the eggs and chorizo. It was served with a light house salad with vinaigrette dressing and pan roasted potatoes and onions. To say it was was great is an understatement. I loved every bite and the servings are plentiful. I managed to finish my whole plate and was truly satisfied.
Next time I'm looking forward to trying the breakfast sliders.
author: Agustin B.

description: Really hip spot and prices to match, but a great place to eat really well and enjoy your company
author: Odalis M.

description: Pleasantly surprised to try this brewery. We have been wanting to try it for a while now. First impression as I walked in was wow, what an awesomely huge space. High ceilings, so very airy and open feel. Love the industrial decor mixed with all the natural wood elements. They hit the mark with combining the perfect balance of great beer, food and ambiance. The family came in on a Sunday. Football on the TVs and projector, great selection of beer and alcohol and the awesome food menu. Bonus: kids menu and crayons. Food was delish and beer was a thumbs up for the Mr.
author: Audgal G.

description: Quaint neighborhood gem. Just driving by and stopped for a drink. Had the sampler flight of 5 home brews for $10. Great friendly service
author: Biren S.

description:
Not impressed with their beers.  Had the flight.  The sour ale had very little tartness.  The brown sugar pale Porter was bleah.   Not much flavor.  The IPL is high IBU.  Definitely all about the bitter and not much hop flavor.

I had the pork tacos.  They were very good. My Son had the Sunset Caesar Salad with Chicken.  The Chicken had a great roasted flavor with rosemary.  The rest of the salad was bleah!  Not much flavor in the dressing.  

The service was good but not outstanding.  Won't recommend the place but since everyone has their own beer taste won't thumbs down it.
author: Ron L.

description: Finally had the chance to check this local spot out. I like it! Good brews and tasty food. If you are looking for snacks or something to share s friends, the garlic fries & the Brussels sprouts are definitely tasty! Will def come again to check out the rest of the menu.
author: Helen W.

description: We ate here last night for the first time. Service and food were both awesome. We had the wings, tofu curry and burger - all delicious! Will definitely be back soon!
author: Molly H.

description: Had a great time here. Service attentive at the bar. Friendly atmosphere and great cocktails. Thank you, I will be back. Cute place. I didn't try the food so that will be saved for next time.
author: Guisela L.

description: My husband and I checked this place out during a two day trip to San Francisco. Very fun and inviting atmosphere, good mix of music. The beers were excellent! I had the hoppy amber while my husband had the IPA. Our waitress was very good and attentive, and even offered suggestions for must-see places during our trip (I forget her name I'm sorry!) The food was just okay, though. My husbands fried chicken didn't come with any sauce, and the pork on the pork tacos comes diced, which made it a little harder to eat. We would come back for the beer and the friendly environment!
author: Danielle P.

description: Staff is great! Food even better! We had a big group and sat upstairs. They were able to keep up with our orders. The food was yummy. We had a bunch of appetizers including hot wings, garlic fries, Mac n cheese, and various salads. No one was disappointed with the food or drinks. I was especially happy to see and use the elevator/lift to the second floor. This restaurant is 100% wheelchair accessible and I am thankful for it!
author: Sara D.

description:
Wow, cant say good enough things about this place! The waitress was very attentive, the food (chicken burger, tacos and quesadilla was deelish) and every time I come here, I always find a seat right away. 

Also, they like to play 90s rap and rnb so when you go in, you automatically feel like you're back in the 90s. 

My only complaint, and this doesnt pertain to the restaurant, is the homeless lady across the street (she sleeps outside of walgreens) that defecates and urinates on the street. The windows are huge and you can look outside and we had the unfortunate viewing of the homeless lady taking a dump. BLAH!!! You have been warned!
author: Annette F.

description:
Came here for lunch since a friend worked close by. I was thankful that this was open on a Monday for lunch! Lots of places were closed, but I'm glad this one was open.

Ambiance was really nice when walking in. The decoration is modern, with lots of wood paneling and skylights that provide lots of light! Service was prompt and friendly. 

Menu wasn't anything special, but it was fine. I got the veggie sandwich, just because I felt like having a meatless Monday. I thought the veggies in the sandwich were decent, but Foccacia was a poor choice for bread. My sandwich kept falling apart, and veggies were so soft and oily from the olive oil that they kept slipping out (veggies were perfect though). Maybe sourdough would have been a better choice. French fries were stiff, which was pretty disappointing.

I would want to come back for the beer. People I knew that dined here in the past always talked about how great the beer was. Will have to trek back!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Came in for dinner with a larger group on a weekday.

- Service was excellent (we had several children and they were very accommodating) 
- Food was better than I expected for a brewpub; everyone enjoyed their meals; appetizers, main courses and dessert.
- Beers, we got a flight to start - Some of the ales were pretty darn bitter and just didn't enjoy them (and I like Pale Ales!) but I did finally find one I liked (so minus one star for some of the beers).
author: Phil s.
