description: A neighborhood spot that we stop by once in a while. We went for taco Tuesday recently and had their set of 3 tacos for $10. Our favorite is fish tacos but the others were alright too. The food came out pretty fast. The bowl of chicken wings was a substantial size and we paid $2 more for the sauces on the side. Very kid friendly spot. We saw a ton of families rolling in with their toddlers. The restaurant gave them sheets to color on. It's a nice casual and convenient spot if you want to grab a beer, food and watch a game. It isn't gourmet food but it's decent. I would come back again for taco tuesday.
author: Antoinette L.

description:
Sunset Brewing is the only brewery I know of on THIS side of SF...which is surprising. There is so much room for growth and taproom takeover on the Sunset/Richmond side of SF, but we'll have to settle with Sunset for now.

Came here during their HH time with a fellow beer lover, and we are darker beer drinkers. We were super psyched for their stout, IPA, double IPA, and a malty beer that I forgot the name of. The IPA's were my favorite, but the stout fell flat for us. It didn't have a deep creamy flavor that most stouts have, but instead it tasted kind of watered-down and had a light feel in the body. We also had some happy hour truffle fries--YUM.

Other than that, the establishment itself has a few parking spots in front (for free) and if it's full you could probably park someplace close. It's Sunset! We also noticed quite a lot of stagnant flies just buzzing around and lazily staying in the air. That's not very appetizing for customers, but the good thing is that the high-ceilings and abundance of tables/space makes up for that. 

Bartenders were very chill dudes and got the job done. This is a great place if you're looking to chill with a bigger group or even for a low-key date night. They have delicious-looking food items, and a spacious atmosphere. However, if you're going to visit just for the beer, I'd say you can definitely find better microbrews in the city.
author: Jodi H.

description:
Wonderful local joint. Love the atmosphere and friendly service.

Craft beer is excellent
author: TC C.

description:
I've been here a few times now and each time I've eaten here and I've had the pleasure to enjoy their crafted beer.

The food here is really good. It's paired very well with the beer they serve. It's always a plus when this joint brews their own beer . Another great thing is that they serve different beer depending on the season. 

The food is a "bar" type of food, but decorated and presented with a more of a fancy view to it.
author: Sol P.

description: This place was great. Delicious food and beer. Walked in unexpectedly while strolling through San Francisco with my Chilean Miniature Pitbull Laslo. The steak was amazing and the service was great. Very nice staff with a nice man named Sammier managing. Decent pricing.  Try the IPA! So good. Best of all the bathrooms were really clean.
author: Dan B.

description:
The only redeeming factor in this review boosting it from a 1/5 is the unusually tasty cheeseburger, in all its charred and smoky glory. I would recommend not eating it with the veggies on the side, though, especially those nasty sweet pickles.

The rest of the food we ate was a train wreck. The only possible explanation for the waitress suggesting the puddle of bullshit that they call pasta bolognese is the $5 price difference. For $18, I can get a whole delicious pizza from The Pizza Place down the street. A brewery should know better than to serve beer that isn't quite lukewarm but definitely isn't cold enough.
author: Loveys F.

description:
Overall, my visit to Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company was mixed.  My friend had recommended this place, and we ended up visiting it during a Friday happy hour.  It was quite bustling, and I could see why this place would be a popular place to grab some brews and food before the dinner rush.  There's a sizable bar and seating available on both the upper and lower level, which could help if you are going out with a group of friends.

I ended up trying a few of their beers, including their IPA, and I thought the beers were find though not very flavorful.  I was expecting an intense hoppiness to the IPA, but it turned out to be not as sharp as I was hoping.  My friend and I shared a half-portion of their chipotle barbecue wings, which was quite huge!  While I was impressed by the portion, I thought the wings were more on the bland side.  

I would probably visit again if I was in the area looking for a happy hour spot, but I don't think I'll be clamoring to go back anytime soon.
author: Keith H.

description: IPA's are good.. the beers sometimes seem to look like they're pouring weird but whatevs... Fried chicken sammy is good.. so is the shishito peppers.. I come back because its close & the bartender is cool.
author: Victoria A.

description:
I've been coming here since they opened since I live in the neighborhood. I first wanted to write a negative review years ago because of the same incompetent bartender(s) that have been reviewed before. Since it's such a hip spot in this part of the neighborhood, I've always wanted to like this place. Today was the last straw. 

Came in at 4pm on a Sunday. Stood at the host stand with some friends for several minutes. No host to be found and not a SINGLE bartender or server could even so much as acknowledge us. Some even looked right at us as we looked around for someone to seat us. Even a "hey the host will be right with you" would've been something at least. 

This sucks because I like the food and beer here, but the service has always been terrible.
author: Shelby S.

description:
Their veggie burger was absolutely delightful. Thick, flavorful and just the right amount of messy. 
Note : don't expect it to taste like meat, it's a veggie burger. 

It comes with thick garlic  fries that are also yummy. 

I had leftovers and ate them cold and they were still delicious.
author: Trinidad M.

description:
Came here for the first time for brunch on Sunday. Waited a while to get seated and after the hostess never showed, we asked the bartender for help. Two other individuals walked in after we had been waiting a while but once the bartender got the attention of the hostess she didn't even seat us first and gave away the last booth to the people who had cut in front of us. As a hostess, you should make sure you're seating people first come first serve.

After we were seated no one came to take our order or even drink orders for at least 10 minutes.

Food is ok, service sucks.
author: Sosse M.

description:
For our latest beer club we hit up Sunset Resovoir.  We had gone to two great places just before this so unfortunately I was a bit disappointed in the overall experience and beer.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was initially super attentive but after that not so much.  We ordered the beer flight and it was pretty good but nothing really stood out.  Then when we tried to order another beer we couldn't get the bartender's attention.  And we were there an hour before it closed but they completely closed up shop on us which felt weird.

With so many great breweries in SF I'd check out Sunsert Reservoir but wouldn't have it high on my list.
author: Blake B.

description:
Hooray!  A casual bar/brewery with great beer options, fun flights, and good food. The atmosphere is great - I love the decor, the open space, the lofted second floor. I don't have kids but definitely appreciate that this is a place where you can comfortably bring them along (since there aren't many in SF).

I've been super impressed with some of the food items - the eggplant and ricotta appetizer is SUPER good (especially with the house bread), the burger is solid, the fettucine pasta bolognese is BLEEPING AMAZING. It's now officially the only thing I ever want to eat before a long run. Or after. Or you know, on a Tuesday. It's also probably two meals' worth of food.

Some food in the "pretty good" column -- the sea bass and the tacos (hit up taco tuesdays for a decent, cheap dinner). I thought the side of veggies was "meh" to just passable - that tasted like it came from a microwave pouch. I miss the pork shank and the shishito peppers that used to be on the menu, but since it changes seasonally maybe those will come back?

Both the fall seasonal beer and the sour wheat are favorites of mine, but I also appreciate that the taps rotate and they have a good variety. And seriously, the flights are adorable and so worth the $10. 

My one - and biggest - complaint is the service. 2/3 times I've been here, I've had really inexperienced, really mediocre/borderline bad service. The servers don't seem trained on greeting, check-ins, refills, pacing, or really much about being a server. They seem busy and rushed. If SBC could get this together I'd come back even more often.
author: Catie F.

description:
This is our second time at the RBP and I have mixed review.  First the food;  I will say the food is very good.  I have had the chicken wings, beet salad, goat cheese pizza minus the kale (blech) and fish and chips.  All were really good.  Wings were meaty, the pizza is excellent with the best crust in San Francisco and the fish and chips were tasty and not greasy.    

Beer and Bar Service:  the beer needs work.   The style is fine and flavorful but they have been out of my first and second choice both times.   The brew master needs to get his head in the game and have his taps full and with a good variety (not everyone loves a hoppy beer).  Speed in making drinks needs to improve as my spices margarita took 20 minutes.  

Service:  as stated this was only my second visit and the first time was a month ago.   The server said Welcome Back (not bad since we are pretty average people) and when our food came out a little late.   He was attentive and pleasant.  The two hostesses were also friendly along with the rest of the staff.   

Finally the dessert.  We had a great brownie 4 weeks ago and was very happy. This time we had a ice cream pie that was exceptional!   

If the brewer can get his act together this will be a great regular place
author: John B.

description:
The setting is nice. Something different for the sunset area. 

Generally the food was good

Don't have any recommendations here except for the burger. 

I wouldn't say no to coming here but not a place that would be first on my list. 

FYI not a big beer drinker.
author: Lyman C.

description:
Almost past by this place today because there is no noticeable sign outside to identify the business.

I found a sweet parking spot right in front which was awesome. As I approached the front door I had to check the address again because I thought the place was empty from the outside. After I looked around and noticed the menu in the window I proceeded on in. I thought because it was lunch time there would be a lot of people inside but there were only 4 or 5 customers seated inside. I was getting an order to go so I made by way over to the bar area.

The young lady at the bar was extremely nice and cordial. That was much appreciated. She greeted me and handed me a menu and gave me a few minutes to decide on my order. As I looked over the menu I realized that the food items being offered were great but the prices are a bit ridiculous. In this being my first time here I went on ahead and placed my order to see if the quality matches the price. After I placed my order I took time to scope out this place. 

The design of this place is very nice. The ceiling is high and I believe that there is upstairs seating as well. The lighting is nice and not too bright which provides a very relaxing atmosphere. There is also some seating near the entrance by the windows which is a very nice touch.

The bar area is amazing. I have been to enough dive bars to know that their shelves are just infested with whatever bottles they can find but this place has a clean bar area! When I say "clean" I mean thoroughly clean and probably dust free as well! That was the lingering impression that I got from this place. They are big on keeping this place keep and in "tip top shape". 

I was definitely itching for some beer while I was here but I did not have time to do that today. In reviewing the selection on the wall and having visited the website before coming here I knew that I wanted to grab a pint or at least try their sampler of beers. Oh well, next time I will make sure to do that. 

The wait for my food took roughly 10 minutes or so and then I was off. I headed straight home after getting my food. The smell of the food filled my car and that was a GOOD thing!! 

Once I got home it was time to EAT! I opened the box and witnessed the "glory" of my food. Not bad, the burger seemed a bit small but it looked really good.

The burger, it was well cooked and the condiments were great. The flavor and taste was perfect but I wish that the patties were thicker! The fries were just as good. The seasoning of the fries was a nice touch, much appreciated! This meal was a complete and utter SUCCESS! Not thrilled about the the cost. I would have priced it at about $10 but I get it, inflation...yada yada.....

I will come back for the BEER because who goes to a brewery and doesn't get a BEER!!! 

#successfulmeal #successfulday
author: Robert F.

description: Bad service, expensive food and just plain nasty food. Bland. no flavor. I wouldn't come back unless its for a beer and fries. Even still... I prob wouldn't.
author: Seven R.

description: The beer is really good but the food was less than stellar. I just don't like getting bottom of the barrel french fries. You should just not serve those to people unless they specifically ask for them
author: Sherif E.

description: Nice place, beer good, good food, but when we went there the people who worked there were acting like they hated being at work. Bartender looked like he was miserable behind the bar, no smile here or friendly attitude at all. We asked 2 waitresses if they could change TV channel to NFL playoffs & they both acted clueless & just pointed to sour attitude bartender. Nice place to hang out if you can get by the bored & non friendly workers there that make the place a "cold". Think about this before you go here, do you like to sit at a bar where the person serving you looks bored, uncaring, doesn't want to be at work, and a smile would crack his face? We didn't feel welcome here in the least.
author: Larry H.

description: This is my third time coming here and it has not changed, the service is bad the beer is OK and the food is overpriced. The bartender was complaining about pretty much everything in front of everyone which doesn't set a good mood. Trying to intimidate customers to buy more beer just because it's a slow night is not a good business model. Since parking is typically bad around that area, and the area lacks any type of good vibe it's not a place I plan to return. Oh and I tipped the equal to cost of a beer just because I feel sorry for those bastards. Lol
author: Gerald H.

description:
Shitty service, okay beer and okay food. I most likely wouldn't go back.

This place has so much potential, but honestly this place doesn't make me feel homey. Ordered a flight of beer, it was decent. I enjoyed the variety, but not worth all the abovez
author: Vicky P.

description: I love the SRBC. The beer rules and the food is fantastic. For people in TheSunset, the SRBC has been like an Oasis. Five stars just for that. But the SRBC gets more stars than that -- especially tonight -- for what has to be the best margarita in our microclimate. No way anyone can touch what they are serving up by the beach and/or in the fog. Five more stars at least.
author: derk p.

description:
Came for a mid day snack and beer. 

The shishito peppers were really good! 

Fries were good, but for garlic fries the garloc was kinda light. 

The menu is different from online bur the fried chicken was yummy.
author: George C.

description:
Was in San Francisco on vacation and was brought here by a friend that lives in the area.  We started off with the soft pretzel and beer cheese, and barely worked my way through a mammoth fried chicken sandwich that had the best BBQ sauce on it and a beer flight to wash it down.

I obviously was too full for dessert.
author: Matthew N.

description:
Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company is a nice, spacious, relaxing place to grab a drink and bite to eat with friends. It doesn't get very loud, they have bar seating, dining downstairs, and also seating upstairs. They also have TVs. It's a great place in the sunset that's different than your typical TikiHaven, ChugPub, Corner Spot or other bar selections in the area.

They brew their own beer and they serve Moscow mules in a cool copper cup! They also serve food at a reasonable price here. I haven't tried any of their food yet.

If you haven't tried any of their beers, they do offer a beer flight so you can have a tasting of each.

Things I noticed they could work on:

1. I went once to watch the warriors game. Awesome environment because of all the fans, BUT they didn't have the sound on during the game.

2. They close at 11 pm. SO EARLY!
author: Stephanie L.

description: A lot of screaming children for a place that's alcohol based. Will pass in the future. Hey maybe if I have kids I'll bring them here! Lol
author: T-Rev R.

description:
This is something we don't have enough of in the outer sunset. The space is gorgeous. Service was good and food was great.

The portions are generous. Which is nice to see for a change. Everyone else is downsizing everything while raising their prices.

Reservoir Salad ($12) - was great but I hate the name because it makes me think of algae.
Mussels ($18) - was a bit spicy for my taste.
Serrano flatbread ($13) - didn't look that great but it tasted great. Order this!
Wings ($11) - generous amount but I wish they were crispy and more flavorful. 
Pasta bolognese ($18) - was the best dish of the night. There is something really special about this dish. 
Pork chop ($24) - was well done but not dry. It was tender and tasted great. I just wish it came with something else instead of lentils.
Burger ($16) - was fine but not something I would order again. It comes well done so let them know if you don't want it that way. The best part was the fries that came with it. Order the fries by itself!

I expect a lot more from their desserts being that this restaurant is from the same owners of Devil's Teeth bakery. They definitely have the potential to do amazing desserts. 

The Beeramisu ($8) - was creative but it was a bit dry and tasted old.
Strawberry shortcake ($8) - was also dry. 

We ordered coke and ginger ale, they both tasted super watered down. We had to send the drinks back. I know this is a brewery but I wished they had more non-alcoholic drink options. At least the ginger ale should be housemade and on point.

Overall this is a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Andy W.

description:
Quick assessment.

Interior look great both up and downstairs.

Food is good, flavorful.

Beer is terrible...newbie brewer, with obvious lack of brewing background. We came there to sample some beer. We had the sampler set and nothing had any body...lasting flavor or pronounced appeal. In a word...the brewer is a newbie, serving his experiments to the patrons. Hardcore beer folks will out this place in a flash. Hopefully, for those who live in the area - the ownership will discover what well crafted beer means (and tastes) and make provisions to correct their offering.

Good luck.
author: Cliff D.

description: Amazing place,  great food,  friendly service and good beer. Nice for friends hang out, dates, bdays. Decor is minimal and modern.
author: Eleonora B.

description:
$13 for a breakfast burrito is pretty steep considering the ingredients used and the small portion. It was delicious, but I wouldn't get it again cause it's overpriced.

Beers: average, tried IPA and pale ale and nothing amazing. I'm a huge beer fan and this place, considering it's a brewery did not leave a footprint on my experience at all. $5 not too shabby but I wouldn't get it again.

Overall, the exterior does not reflect the inside, it feels upscale, and modern. In fact, I didn't even see a front sign for this place since the outside looked pretty beat and old. Great customer service though.
author: Angela T.

description:
Don't get duped into the Bloody Mary special, they say it cost $8 on the weekend, which sounds like a great deal at first, but the bartender offered me options for the vodka and I picked kettle over titos, I got charged $8 per shot of kettle, $32 for 4 shots in total, only because the bartender failed to disclose that choosing your own vodka would cost you more. That's pretty suspicious to charge customers without letting them know that there's an extra charge, I understand off the shelf stuff costs more, but when it gets offered as an equal option to other vodkas, that led me to assume that all options were equal. It's a bait and switch basically. 

To be fair, the French toast is pretty good, we also had zero service and I had to order from the bar, even though we were seated on a table.
author: Safe K.

description: 3.5 stars We go regularly for trivia and I have mixed feelings about the place. The beer is decent, and some of the food is pretty good (pork tacos, chicken tacos and veggie burger are personal favorites). Portions are usually pretty big but the service is totally hit and miss. We've had some waitresses who were pretty rude or hostess who would seat other tables that came in after us (and weren't reserved)- they usually recognize and own up to it. We've also had people who just wont take your order. I'm pretty sure quiz night is the least favorite night for the staff.
author: Jessica H.

description: When here for my birthday and engagement party combined together. Food was excellent . service was fabulous. atmosphere is fantastic. I highly recommend this restaurant and brewery.
author: Amina A.

description:
I am not impressed.

To start, my friend and I had to wait 50 min for a table of two, when there were only 2 people in line in front of us... It should not have taken this long. They told us we could drink at the bar, which we did and kept our tab open, but they didn't tell us that we had to close our tab before we could sit at our table! That would have been nice to know and sped up the process since the bartenders seemed to be avoiding ALL customers  eye contact.. We basically had to yell at them to get their attention to close out (Which is rude, and I don't like doing).

The food? Looked good! We werre very excited. When we got our burgers though.. we were very disappointed. To be honest, it tasted like an in n out double double... Not worth $16. I am sorry, but even with the small amount of bacon, it isnt. 

Sitting next to the kitchen we noticed that every plate of the same item coming out was different, some had more meat, some had more sides, they weren't all the same. Which is not fair to customers expecting the same thing as someone else.

The oysters, YUM! So good! But we only got 3.. for $14. They weren't THAT good. And how are you supposed to split 3 oysters? Typically, people go out in groups of even numbers... Am I wrong?

At the table, from the time we sat down and ordered to we got our food, another 45 min. To top it all off, our waiter, lost my credit card. 15 frantic minutes later he found it. I feel bad because he felt really bad, but take a breath, pull it together, you can do it.

One plus? A pint was only $6.

I understand that they JUST opened. Which is why they get 2 stars, in stead of 1. Even if I didn't have to wait as long and got better service, the most I would rate is 3 stars. I just think they're highly over priced for the quality of the food.
author: Elysia M.

description:
This is a nice spot in a neighborhood clearly lacking in "Brewing Company" type places. And here I was, on yet another first date (please put me out of my misery already). We were seated at a table near the bar and I ordered my standard, Moscow (Golden) Mule.

The TVs were showing the Warriors' game as I was trying to carry on an interview-type conversation and the intermittent cheering became distracting. "How many siblings do you have? How long have you lived in this neighborhood?" 

It was dinner time so we ordered some fried chicken to share. I was excited since the menu proclaimed that chicken thighs were being used in this version (check out my Headline on the topic of chicken). When the dish came out, I was extremely disappointed. It was oily and not crispy; I'm guessing it was fried in oil that was not hot enough. The mashed potatoes and gravy that it came with were dull and flavorless. I would hesitate to go to SRBC again but for those in this neighborhood, it's good enough.
author: Yi Z.

description: Went three times in three weeks! We just kept going back each weekend because we had such a nice time. Great beer selection and hands down the best shishito peppers I've ever had. So smoky and delicious. We ordered them all three times. Bartenders were all friendly and attentive. Such a different type of bar from the normal Sunset scene. Much more lively and open. And seriously. Those peppers.
author: Lindsay S.

description: This place had me feeling like I was somewhere else. I guess it's the sign of the times and a example of how the Sunset district is changing. The food was decent but overpriced for bar food. The beer list was varied enough and tasty but I'm not a huge beer drinker. The ambiance and service were adequate. Still trips me out though.
author: Adrian R.

description:
Amazing space! Hilary is like King Midas - everything she touches turns into gold. From a produce market to a brewpub, this place feels like it's always been here. I personally enjoyed the Dry Irish Stout while my friend Ashley loved the burger and the bread pudding. Ray thought the pasta was the best he's ever had. 

You have to check this gem of a restaurant/bar out!!!
author: Dyanna Q.

description:
Update: 6/01

Been here numerous more times since last year and I keep forgetting to update my review.

Food is way better now. Better selections and prices

Awesome Happy hour specials: 3-6pm 

Discounted prices on menu items when sitting at the bar. Ie. Spinach and mushroom goat cheese pizza is $12 vs. dining in the reg area for $14

All beers are $5 -- get their IPA and Russian Imperial Stout (very flavorful!). Ps you can ask for a pink rather than 1/2 pint as noted on the menu

Well drinks - $1 off

Atmosphere- better and I love hanging by the bar area. For warriors games they have a projection up on the mall along with two other TVs.

I should come here more often!

And I agree with everyone's review about the fries--yes they are THAT good. Right amount of salt and crunch! 


Pros: 
Just open but service was really friendly. Everyone was working hard
Lots of open seating upstairs
Portland hipster kinda vibe of the place but crowd not hipsters
Drinks were pretty good
5 flights for $10 (beer was just ok....too light. See review below

Cons:
Downstairs bar is too tight
Beer was good but definitely still need to work on the hops
Irish stout tasted like a Guinness
Least fav was the double ipa and I'm a big fan of IPAs but sunset brewing's was a disappointment. No hops whatsoever.
Kids friendly place is nice but during dinner team I thought there was too many kids. Way tooo many
I thought it was weird that some parents even let their kids sit at the bar while they drank? I don't know about that...I know some people were waiting for a table but still?! Maybe it's normal? But I wouldn't do that or at least wait to sit at a table then order yourself a drink.

Other than that, the place is promising and I will definitely come back here before or after dinner!
author: Carol Y.

description:
I came here a couple years ago when it first opened. Nice space, decent beer. 

I went back recently and while the space is still nice, the beer is not good. It's not as awful as the beer at Pizza Orgasmica or Park Chalet, but it's close. No body, weird flavors, and a finish that doesn't leave you wanting more. I tried four beers and settled on an English Mild, since that style's supposed to be a bit bland.
author: Eric S.

description: I road my motorcycle from Las Angeles to San Francisco on a mission for some delicious fish tacos and was lucky enough to stumble upon this place. The meat melted in my tiny mouth and made me feel like I was on the riviera. Excellent selection of bourbon and other drinks along with their own beers.
author: Russ K.

description:
Came here to see what the hype was all about this new brewery! Came on a week night and the place was packed. My friend and I just wanted to catch up and have some drinks, so we sat at the bar, which had no wait. I ordered the flight 5 which came surprisingly enough, came in a muffin tray haha. 

Very hipster vibe inside, but nonetheless a very chill environment to just hang out with some friends. Next time I definitely want to try some of their food, but have heard that it's pretty pricey.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Overall, I actually had a lovely time at Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company. It's such a breath of fresh air in comparison to the usual places you find in the Sunset District, as a youthful, trendy place for solid food and less-solid drinks. 

The kicker for me was just not liking the beers. The darker beers were too heavy, and the lighter beers just tasted off to me. And how can a girl give a brewing company a rave review if the brews they brew just aren't that good?

OVERALL.
+ Well designed interior that stands out well in the Sunset
+ Solid food and HH menu (especially their garlic fries!)
~ Nice service but slow, and it's difficult to flag down servers when needed
- Pretty un-spectacular beers across the board

It's a nice enough place to hang out at, and I'd still happily go back for lunch and some cocktails, but beer is not what you should be looking for here.
author: Claire S.

description: Love trying new breweries in the city. Great ambiance. Large space. We ordered the Serrano pepper app, a burger and garlic fries. The appetizer was delicious! The burger was average (I expect really juicy burgers at breweries) and the garlic fries were underwhelming. I didn't taste or see any garlic on our fries. Just some all pieces of herbs. A lot of other options on the menu, however. Beer was good.
author: Jasmine O.

description:
Bad. Service was terrible.  No hostess to greet you.  Forgotten after we we're seated.
We apparently were a big inconvenience for them. Food was nothing great.  They forgot half my order.  Won't be returning. Hope our hearing comes back some time soon from the women screaming into the microphone the whole horrendous hour we spent there!  One star only because I couldn't erase it.
author: Pat M.

description: Love coming to this place because it's two blocks from home. Definitely gives a very hipster feel when I walk through the door. It's two tiered, so there is plenty of seating. I always choose to sit at the bar because the bartenders are so nice! I also like the fact the drink menu is constantly changing every couple of weeks here. That way you get to try new drink and food options! I ordered the sliders for food and a cider for my drink of choice. Two sliders were pulled pork and the third one was chicken. I enjoyed the chicken slider the most because I felt like the pulled pork was a little on the dry side. The cider was excellent though.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
They didn't have all 6 beers on tap when I went so they couldn't serve their flight which was a bummer, but I'll definitely be back for that! I tried both the Amber and IPA. Both were good but didn't wow me. 

Ordered their pasta bolognese and brussel sprouts which were both delicious! A great place to catch up with a friend and definitely the first of its kind in this part of town.
author: Winnie T.

description: I was served a pint of bad beer and manager refused to change it for me. Angry dude. I left. There are so many great local bars you can go to in the Sunset with  superior customer service.
author: Paul R.

description: Sad to say the quality and taste of food here keeps declining. I've been here at least 10 times since it opened and it used to be awesome. But the last 3-4 times the taste is just blah. I don't know if the chef has changed or they're getting complacent but would love to see the quality improve again. This place is 4 blocks from our house and really needed in a sea of mediocre asian restaurants on Noriega. Please reasses the quality and get back to the great consistency gastro pub you once were.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Disappointing. Nice to have a brewpub there, in the outer Sunset, but they need to step it up.

The service was very slow despite not being busy on a Sun morning. The biscuit sliders were decent in concept, but half hearted in execution and not enough food for the price charged. Making matters worse, mine weren't hot when served; moreover half our party was served and then we had to wait another 5-10 minutes for the other half to get their food.

I ordered the black lager off the menu but received a beer that was more like a porter, and a stout one at that. When I asked about, the server said, "Oh yeah our new brewer decided to change it to porter because it seems more like a porter." Maybe mention that when I make the order? And update your menu.

Another favorite moment in service is when our server was taxed to put down a plate of food because of uncleared plates & glasses, then walked away leaving them there. clap_emoji.jpg

The atmosphere is OK, but hampered by the brutal acoustics.

They'll get by because there's not much else that side of 19th Ave to scratch a brewpub itch, but there's nothing here to recommend.
author: Striddy B.

description:
Perfect customer service right when me and my group walked in. We came in during their happy hour times which are from 3-6pm I believe. We were greeted right away by the bartender, he informed us we could seat anywhere and the server will help us out. (If you want the upstairs seating overlooking the ground level, inform the workers first before heading up or else they won't know and won't come up to serve) 

We headed to a booth and immediately the server walks by and ask if we are doing water all around, yes we gestured and off he goes. I really like this because regardless at a sit down restaurant is always like water by my side. Like any other he asked if we like anything other than water when he returns and if we had any questions with the menu. Then menu is simple and to the point. Myself, I had the fish and chips and their beer flight which allows you to enjoy three types of beer they provide. 

Food wise the meal was superb!! It was a very large portion but it's what you pay for. Prices are normal for their portion size. The fish and chips came with malt vinegar, tater sauce and ketchup for the chips. Very flavorful and fish packed! Loved it! The beer flight is a real kicker. I love beer and alcohol itself hehe but some reason the beer had a kick. By the time my flight was done I had a good buzz. LOL. 

All in all my experience with this place was excellent! Keep it up, and will for sure recommend this hidden gem. And I will for sure be coming back!
author: Aldrin D.

description:
Live right next to the brewery. Have came here since it opened and it's been just alright every time we've been. Usually get the buffalo wings and Caesar salad. 

The most recent time I went they gave us no drumsticks in our wings and there was a bug in our salad. Not coming back soon :(

When we told the waitress about the bug in the salad and showed her it up walking around with dressing all over it you'd think she would give us our whole meal on the house... Nope... Everyone who works here is pretty rude 

Now going to Kevin's noodle house for second dinner. Fail.
author: Hayley D.

description: Been going here for brunch and weekend drinks for over a year now. The service and beer are normally great and the food is decent. Last night we walked in and a new server that we never seen before tried to card us. We kinda took it as a joke because we are in our mid 20's and go to this brewery often. He was persistent and denied us drinks after presenting two forms of ID and even offering to present more proof. He was excessively rude and being a jerk about it. It's not like we were drunk and walking into this establishment-- we were completely sober. Due to the rudeness of the new bartender we were completely put off and don't plan on ever coming back.
author: Samantha Z.

description: Awesome little microbrewery. The beers are solid, the food is really great though. The burger is always on point. Cool place to watch a game as well or just grab a drink at the bar.
author: Sam A.

description:
All in all, I see a lot of potential in this place. It reminds me SO much like Nopa in the Panhandle with their printed out menu that looks like the selections change based on the season and what is available. Their menu consists of bar food with a variety of small bites and large plates. This review is based on the experience of two girls drinking a beer each, overall ambiance, and service.

Once greeted at the door, we found a table by the bars and seated ourselves. I had to grab menus from the bartender at the front since no one was really tending to the tables in the area we were in. My girlfriend and I weren't planning on getting any food since we just had dinner elsewhere, but it didn't seem like there was much hype on the food selection (from Yelp, at least). The beer here add no frills; it's all pretty standard stuff you can find at your favorite local brewery. I think I'm someone who likes to try unique stuff that a place is known for, but here I feel it is a place for people who stick with something simple/stay in their comfort zone. 

I would come back because of its convenience and how there are barely any breweries in the middle-outer sunset, but it is a chill spot for a catch-up or date.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
The Sunset needed a spot like Sunset Reservoir Brewing Co. Among the many Chinese eateries along Noriega lies this cute, upscale-looking brew house. I met my girl Becca last week for some gabbing, a drink, and something yummy to eat and was impressed with the look of the place: all grey wood, very sleek and clean, cool lighting, TVs, lots of beers on tap.

So, why the 3 star review, Crys? Well I'll tell ya! I love sour beer ever since a trip to Portland I took earlier this year. My tastebuds know what they're looking for and they get very excited at the prospect of a nice sour caressing them ever so gently. So when I spotted the Sour House Wheat, my 'buds started doing their happy dance. Sadly though, this sour was not sour in the least. It tasted just like any old wheat beer. I suppose it's my bad because I didn't ask to taste it or inquire about how sour it was going to be, but sadly this beer was not a homerun for me.

We ordered the Fried Mac n Cheese Balls with Marinara dipping sauce for our appetizer and I must say they were pretty good. Like, I would eat a plate of them right now if they were put in front of me. The outer seasoning was really tasty, crispy, and the sauce offered a nice tomato offset to the rich cheese and pasta, like tomato soup to grilled cheese. We both got The Burger for our main and again, I was not impressed. The double patties were really small and hard to bite into. I asked for a medium cook and they were well-done and dry. 

Service was sub-par as well. Our waitress was young, and I get it, I've been there, you lose track of what you're doing or what people ask for, but we only saw our waitress once at the beginning of our meal to take our order and the rest of the time we had to flag down busboys for anything else we wanted. Hoping this place turns it around as I'd like to go back at some point.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Note: review is solely based on the beer. 

Dropped by Sunset Reservoir because I love a good brewery.  The setting here is extremely modern and elegant with a very attractive long wooden bar.  This place has a very similar feel to the other brewery in the Sunset. Social Kitchen and Brewery. The menu looks pretty enticing, but we were here only to try a couple beers so I'll have to come back and update my review. I'll also have to come back because I hear they are now working with a new brewmaster. With that said, the beer offerings here from the prior brewing team are pretty "meh." Nothing on the list is that approachable. Alt Bier, Sour Wheat, 2 stouts, a brown ale and an English IPA.  I told my pal who works at Speakeasy about my experience at SRBC and he too scratched his head when I told him about the available beers. I tried a half pint of the English IPA which was actually pretty tasty. I also sampled the brown ale and the Alt. I don't think I would order a pint of either of these two. My buddy agreed with me, and he ordered Makers on the rocks. When someone who came to your brewery to have beer ends up with a Makers, you know there's a problem with your beer list. Hope they fix this! Still giving a few stars because the establishment is beautiful, the staff is friendly and the location is great!
author: Alex E.

description:
My sister and I had never been here before. I never knew it existed. We were late for our reservation, but luckily we were able to get a table  on the second level. The atmosphere was pretty laid back, but a little loud with the music and people trying to talk over it.

My sister's friends ordered a couple of beers on tap. My sister had their ginger beer and I decided to be boring and go with ice tea. For appetizers we ordered their garlic fries. It came with ketchup and chipotle aioli sauce. We loved and devoured them. We also shared the goat cheese and mushroom pizza. It was our favorite dish. The crust was light and not dense. The goat cheese was excellent.

Our main dishes were the boneless fried chicken that came with mash potatoes with gravy and a spicy coleslaw. My sister's friends both ordered the three sliders. One was the fried chicken with the spicy coleslaw, one with sloppy joe, and the last one was a pulled pork slider. Both friends have them a thumbs up. They highly recommend getting them.

I would definitely come back just try some of the other dishes and the attentive wait staff.
author: Rigel A.

description:
Overall atmosphere was good and beer was okay.  Salad was nice but pizza was too cheesy for me.

I gave one star because our server was very rude.  She forgot to give us beer until salad and pizza came out but did not apologize for it at all.  She also counted 5 beers in the final check (we had just 2 beers) and when we corrected it she made another mistake to count them 3.  We corrected it once more, and at that time, she stared us in a very rude manner.  I was very upset about that and I'm sure I will not come here again and want to recommend others not to come here.
author: Sangwhan M.

description: We got there and ordered drinks and dinner. As we wanted to order a second drink, we were informed we were cut off because a couple of people at the table seemed "too drunk". We were laughing and having fun but nothing out of the ordinary to suggest we were drunk. No one was throwing up, sleeping, yelling - anything to get us cut off.  We were all drinking beer and wine! We tried to talk to the manager to make this right but she stood by her staff and we will never be coming back.
author: Lauren S.

description: I have been here 3 times and have never been disappointed​. First time I came was for the brunch, no wait which was a plus for brunch in the city. Had the chicken sandwich with those amazing biscuits and a nice brew on tap. Also, came two times for dinner and loved my meal. My girlfriend doesn't eat meat so we shared the vegetarian burger and fish and chips, both were solid dishes with nice portions. Overall a good neighborhood brewery with good food and light on the pockets.
author: Isaiah E.

description: Visit SF for house hunting weekend. The coldness of outer sunset drove me to this place because I'm from Texas . I ordered my favorite Macallan 12. I was going to tell the bartender more about how I want it but he asked me what kind of ice I want! That's exactly what I was going to tell him--big square ice cub. After I told him, he put the big ice cub in a glass and poured my drink. Brian, the bartender has 20 years experience in restaurant industry. He is very knowledgeable of his liquors, and works efficiently and tentative to his customers. It's like his second nature from my observation. It's fortunate to have him in this place or any restaurant/bar. That's where customers will want to go back again and again.
author: Jun T.

description: Love the cocktails and the bites here. We always sit at the bar and receive amazing service. The tacos and Mac and cheese are the favorites of the moment. It does get rather cold in there, but that's my only complaint. Love this neighborhood spot after a hard day at the office.
author: A A.

description: I've been here 10+ times and never had a bad experience. Great food, great beer, great service. It's a little pricey but you get what you pay for. I strongly recommend the fried chicken, wings, or chicken sandwich (best bang for your buck)
author: Matt E.

description: This is a solid staple in the Sunset.  Very good food, great atmosphere and very family friendly.  Their fish and chips and Mac and cheese are amazing.  This is American food and not the best place if you're on a diet.  Knocking off 1 star because I think it's on the pricey side.
author: Kristina E Z.

description: This is my second time to this establishment and this time I'm leaving sadly underwhelmed. To start our server Giavana wasn't very welcoming. She sat us down and brought us two menus for 5 people...uh ok thanks. One of my friends asked her what the shot of the day was and she said "uh idono" and stood there. Horrible sales skills. After that horrible exchange we proceeded to order and everything was mediocre after that. Someone got a little to happy with the topping for the broccoli, the toasted nuts weren't seasoned at all. From everyone else at the table the Mac n cheese, wings, and greenbeans were good. Once she dropped off the bill we put three cards down and how much we wanted charged to each card. She told us "I can only do 2 cards." I'd believe that but last time we visited they ran 3 cards for us, on top of that I serve tables myself and inform the guests of how many cards are allowed. If they write for me how much they want charged on each card it's not an issue, splitting items is inconvenient which I understand and that's not what we were doing. She just didn't feel like charging the amounts to the cards we gave her for whatever reason being an unnecessary hater. Can't say I'll be back, and if I am I'll be sitting at the bar
author: Ant B.

description: Great food - way beyond your casual brewery food.  We were there on a Saturday (early evening) and had terrific service.  Our waitress was attentive and both drinks and food came out quickly. The manager or someone manager-like was walking around checking on tables as well.  No complaints from us!
author: Laura M.

description: One of my go to spots in sunset. Lots of amazing beers and really great food. Jeremiah and Juan are the bees knees aka cats pajamas aka awesome AF.
author: Edward H.

description: This place rules! I got into town from Portland yesterday and found SRBC while looking for a hipster brewery to get a beer with my friend in the sunset. Little did I know we were about to get the customer service experience of a lifetime! We ordered a couple beers and I got the fish and chips. Sometime later our server came by and apologized for the long wait on the food, saying they'd comped us some beers! Thanks, we didn't even notice the wait! Later when the check came they even comped the food! This was completely unneccessary, but very much appreciated. I'm not writing this to suggest people go get comped stuff, but to show evidence that this place really goes above and beyond. I'll be recommending them to everyone I meet tonight. Also, the fish and chips were amazing. Thanks SRBC!
author: Wyatt A.

description: Best French roast in the world.  Blackberry Sprits unreal cocktail.   Eat breakfast here.  Guaranteed happy.
author: Christopher M.

description:
One star for the beer.  One star for the nice server.

The beer flight is a total of two pints at the most and 12 bux.  We ordered a few pints after the flight and the bartender short poured  the pints (see photo).  A short pour in a brewery is like a white glove in the face in Paris.  Someone has got to go after an action like this.  It wasn't like the beer was not pouring right either.  It was just short.  They were not busy at the bar either.  OUCH!  

The food was pretty bad.  Shishito peppers were good.  Flash fried and sprinkled with good salt served with a tiny tin cup of ranch dressing.   That was the highlight of our meal.

Poke was bland and way overpriced.  They should just go get it from Costco or Safeway daily and have the floor manager/runner sling it to order.  

Rice balls were worse than they sound.   Crunchy undercooked rice inside.  Bland and kinda gross overall.  Don't get me wrong.  Ill eat a chicken mcnugget and not bitch but this ball was bad.  Mushy from the bad recipe.  Greasy from the deep fryer.  Small portion with a high ticket price.  Nasty old tasting tomato sauce on the side.  Bummer.  Arugula on the plate but there is a third sauce on that that does not help anything on the plate.  Four balls for like 13 bux.  Ouch.

13 bux for a caesar salad in a brew pub is like a 20 dollar bud light in a strip club.  The salad better better be off the hook.  This one is once again not as good as Costco or Safeway.  The lettuce is cut real thin.  The dressing is light and bland.  No salt pepper on the table let alone offered by the staff fresh cracked.  Total rip off.  

I had to get an entree to see how that would go so I opted for the Half chicken.   Its a small leg and thigh and a wing in breast.  Dry breast.  Weird kind of sweet bbq like sauce on the chicken as a glaze.  I had fries instead of the celery root puree since the server said it was pretty gross.  The fries were not seasoned and the plate overall was bad.  Veg was cooked well but that was it.  20 bucks for that one.  The plate was warm so that was cool.  Once again I would have been happier with a reheated half chicken from Costco's hot box.  

This pub has so much potential.  It reminds me of how Beach Chalet was when they first opened.  Total CRAP food.  It took them years to get it together and hopefully these guys will too.

I will go back for beer maybe.  Forget about the food.  No real chef here.  Prices are as high as it gets but the quality is absent.  No value.  Nice host and nice server were the highlights.
author: Johnny B.

description: My boyfriend and I are regulars here because the service is generally great and the food is delicious. The other night which was an NBA finals night, my boyfriend (who has a bit of a short fuse) was upset when I told him the hostess had no evidence of us putting our name on the list. Despite the mishap she helped by offering to put our name back to around the time we came in. Although I wanted to wait it out, we ended up deciding it would be best to leave. The next night when we came back, the owner and staff were so kind in making it up to us and even gave us a free round of drinks. We really love coming to eat at SRB and will continue to do so!
author: Caryn S.

description: San Francisco's best kept burger secret! Although tonight's burger was over cooked ant not as juicy as we are used too. Always a selection of house made craft beers  that are quite nice. I particularly like their English IPA. A gem of a spot in the Sunset.
author: Steven B.

description: I enjoyed their selection of brews, particularly the Maple one. Great selection of food! I recommend the brussel sprouts. The bartenders & servers are friendly & helpful. The place is inviting & they even have live music on some nights. What I also like about this place is that it's a gem in what I consider one of the last native neighborhoods of SF so the people there are also friendly. The brewery itself is a nice layout.
author: MARIA M.

description: Great atmosphere beer and food in the neighborhood. The fish and chips was awesome, melted in my mouth!
author: Lisa S.

description:
Finally came in to check it out. I have to admit I wasn't very impressed. 

Drinks:Had a flight of their house brews, cant say any particular one stood out to me as being very good. The beer was also warm. Their house cocktails were pretty good though. 

Food: We ordered about 4 items. Buffalo wings were good and big portion, the blistered peppers very good!, sliders were meh ok nothing special, and the mussels w/chorizo were not very good looked like they squeezed a tube of mexican chorizo into the bowl.  

Service: Our first bartender was awesome, we stayed longer just because of him. The guy who took over after him was basically a mute bar back, he never spoke nor was friendly. 

Might go back to give it another try.
author: Ed S.

description:
I wish this place was good, because the sunset needs a fun business of this type.  I've learned the food sucks, is expensive, and the beer is shitty too.  

Yesterday, was the 4th time I've been there.  Each time I am hopeful something will change, but each time I'm left irritated.  Let me tell you that yesterday, my companion and I both ordered burgers.  I ordered mine med rare, my companion, medium.  

Both were cooked to hell.  I didn't even say anything, because, unfortunately I  expected it to be not very good.  I can't tell how big the patty portion was (because it was fried to hell), but I would guess 1/4 lb at best.  No problem, but for $16, I expect a good, juicy, 1/2 patty.  

In contrast, I possibly had the very best hamburger of my life at Belcampos in Larkspur the day before, so the miserable piece of gristle beef they put on the bun was a major contrast.

Anyway, they've been out of the IPA the tree last times I've been there, and I'm not a huge fan of the other beers I have had of theirs.  A guest tap wouldn't be a bad idea.  

I don't think I will go for a 5th try.  Its too bad, because its walking distance from my house.... I've had it!
author: Mike P.

description:
I give them 3.5 stars.. 
What we ordered..
Green beans and cauliflower was solid if you want some fresh vegetables with your fries 

Burger added an egg! That burger was the best thing I ate all night, will go back for that.

Bolognese uhhh..never showed up! Oh well we were full already.

Caesar salad was really good!

Fried chicken, this was in a delicious red sauce. I wish it was seperated though, don't want soggy fried chicken. It jad a slight kick of spiciness in the sauce, yum

Banana pudding, bananas tasted too ripe and the pudding was so dense. I wasn't a fan. Tasted like rotted bananas eek

Ice cream tasted homemade

Beef tar tar was not good at all. It looked not too fresh, it had ginger in it, I hate ginger, nothing special to it, lack of flavor. 

My beer was good pale ale I think second one on menu.

Our waiter was nice

Loved their music! We ended the night with Mariah Carey's christmas song and some Jessica Simpson haha..throw back. 

Bonus it's not crazy crowded. We got in within 10 min or less.
author: Karen T.

description: Great food, we had the cheese pizza with garlic and the garlic fries. FANTASTIC! The beer was great according to the fellows, and I had their tap Pino Grigio Tap wine. Again wonderful! When it gets busy the waitress does take some time to get to you, the sections are a little larger than most places. Overall, great place!!
author: Renee H.

description:
4 stars because their chicken Caesar salad was the best I've ever had. This place would be 5 stars but their beer selection was a real let down. They only have 6 kinds of brews available-which is how many beers fit on a flight....any real brewery has 10+ selection of beers which is why flights are created so you can pick and choose which beers to have...having only 6 beers defeats the whole purpose of a flight because there's nothing to choose.

If this place steps up their beer game it can definitely be a huge success because the food here is really high quality, which is unusual for a brewery. My friends had the fish-chips, chicken wings, and mac-n-cheese. All delicious and well portioned.
Our bill for 4 came out at 100. Which is a bit pricey for the sunset but worth it honestly.
author: Yevgeniy V.

description: Nice and close to my daughter's house with great chicken burgers.  Loved the beer selection and the peppers for an appetizer!
author: Sue R.

description:
Our first time here. The service was rude. The bartenders ignored us while we were sitting at the bar. And turns out they assumed we were underage and didn't want to serve us. The bartender asked another bartender to check our ID's and then he came up to us and stated, "you have to be 21 to sit at the bar." in a very rude manner. Turns out my friends and I are almost 30 and were actually pouring beers ourselves that day. 

Only reason to go would be to have some small bites. Though they are not cheap.
author: Katie B.

description:
Terrible for sporting events.

A group of us came here on Sunday, 6/5/16 to watch Game 2 of the NBA Finals and were sorely disappointed when the restaurant refused to turn on the sound for the game. 

We asked multiple servers if the sound could be turned on for the game. One said the reason as to why was because they did not want to disrupt those customers that were not in to watch the game. Another said that he had no idea why the sound wasn't switched on, and even explained that several tables had left because of their refusal to do so. 

The managers of this establishment are inconsiderate of their customers' best interests. This was evident in the fact that on a Sunday, during a live, national sporting event, their restaurant still had tables to be filled.

I will not return to Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company and recommend that folks who are looking for a place to watch a game avoid this place at all costs!
author: Gary L.

description:
The bartender ignored us.  

I had been here before and would have recommended this place until the experience I had on Sunday.  Around 4pm in the afternoon, I went in here with two friends. The bartender had a beard and baseball ca[. Stood around for 15 mins and could get served.  There were maybe 6 people at the bar and most of them had drinks.  There was a solo patron next to us that even remarked how long it had taken us to get drinks.  After stand there another couple walked in and was served immediately.  At that point we left.

Did he ignore us or was he just a bad bartender?  Either way I feel less likely to go here again due to the fact there is good beer all over town and better service.
author: Bucky W.

description: Best Porter... fish and chips awesome blossom... Brussels sprouts must try... won't be dissatisfied
author: Sangamesh R.

description: Walked past this place and secided to try it. Ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and that s*** was bomb af. Approximately 7 mins later, my food was out already. Super quick! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because the bartender made the drink options confusing. I wanted to try the different selection of beers but he brought out the the sampler and charged me for it. Other than that, it was the shizznet!
author: Chong L.

description:
I came here with a group of friends to get together catch up and talk! This review is for the food and service didn't get a beer because I heard there was check points today! And right yes sir there was on 19th ave. thank god but the temptation to try the beers was real! 

The fettucini pasta that I ordered was really good.  The pasta was really flavorful and pretty hearty! Portion was pretty filling too. Would come here again to have a nice beer and chat with friends again.
author: Herman L.

description:
It's great to finally have a modern, hip addition to all the Asian restaurants on Noriega. The service was friendly and the food was good. 

We ordered a bunch of appetizers to share - buffalo wings, hush puppies, deep fried mac and cheese and fried green beans.  All were tasty. The bowl of wings we got were enormous. You could seriously have it as a meal!

For mains, the highlight by far were the burgers.  There was a lot of food envy going around the table when they arrived. I got the fried chicken which were essentially adult versions of chicken strips. I liked the freshly made mash but overall, the dish lacked flavor and was overdone. 

We had a great time here. It's just nice to have a restaurant like this in what is normally a food desert if you want something modern and not Asian!
author: Ada C.

description: Great room, great food, great beer, and a super helpful attentive staff. Also appreciate the accommodation for kids/picky eaters.
author: gary g.

description:
What an amazing discovery this place was. So my friend is in town and of course we wanted to catch up, so her cousin recommended this place. Off the bat, I was confused bc in this neighborhood... Never expected to find a place like this here. Once we got to the place.. (Granted, no sign outside) the place looks amazing! It's huge and beautiful. The place is so welcoming and I fell in love. And bonus points, I guess we were there close to closing and they were blasting some old pop music my friends and I were really enjoying. 

Okay, back to the review.. The food is abundant. I wasn't too hungry so I ordered from the salad and small plate menu. The fried chicken. Definitely was not small but it tasted awesome. Perfectly breaded and fried, accompanied with a tasty tomato sauce with plenty of flavor, also paired with peppery arugula.. Everything about the dish complimented each other so wonderfully. I would go back for it. And looking at everybody else's dishes, I was eager to go back to try some other dishes. 

Only downfall, the server was really forgetful and come of the prices of certain dishes were a little high, but I would come back and I would recommend this place. But I kinda don't because I don't want people knowing about this gem. Lol
author: Hepsie C.

description: Great service, and the brunch was DELICIOUS. We had to take a literal hike afterward to justify my eating two biscuit sandwiches and a beer. Worth it.
author: Heidi O.

description:
Nice place from the outside (hence star) 
Came here to have dinner,  told the host 2 for dinner.  She then proceeded to say,  if your only having beer and appetizers then our bar is open. 

We decided to walk out.  RUDE Hostess.   I leave 3 blocks away, this is a good neighborhood.  No need to be snotty.  You just lost a local patron.
author: SFoodie P.

description: The food is really good, service slow but can get over that. My main issue is the beer. For a brewing company, they have a very limited selection and it never changes! How about getting more and different styles of beer and or guest breweries. You need to up your beer game otherwise you won't last.
author: Jay D.

description:
Here for the first time ever as I write this at 10am on a Sunday morning, there is super loud music blaring from the restaurant speakers which is isn't a huge deal,  but when you combine it with the also extremely loud different music pouring from the open kitchen it creates a damned musical Sunday morning nightmare. There's obviously no manager or owner as they would (hopefully?) never let that shit fly if they wanted customers to come back or even stay for that matter. All the reclaimed wood and plants growing from the walls doesn't seem to help. 

Food was okay.
author: Nate T.

description:
Overall this place would be a 3.5 stars. The food is whatever, but they have good beers. Their menu changes often but their popular items usually stays. The service isn't great, they could be a little more attentive. 
The burger I got was disgusting. The appetizers were better than the main entrees they have to offer. I would probably try it again since its in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't come out of my way to eat here. However, I would come back for their Bloody Mary or just to have a drink with friends and sit at the bar.
author: Grace T.

description:
It's 3:30Pm on a Saturday afternoon. My wife, my 2 year old daughter, and I walk in and ask the host for a table for 3. Any of the then current 5 vacant tables would have been fine. 

He asks me, "Will you be having a meal or snacking, because if you're snacking then go to the bar." 

We immediately leave.

If I ask you for a table, I'm not asking to be directed to the bar with my 2 year old daughter. Have some common sense.
author: Ivan C.

description: A restaurant that seems out of place, but is a nice places for a simple, yet more than ordinary compared to other restaurants. Came in on a Friday night and was told a table for 2 would take at least 30 minutes, but we only waited for about 15, which was a pleasant surprise as the place as packed and there were a ton of people waiting for a table! Ordered the fish and chips, as well as the fried chicken. Both are usually simple dishes, but at this place, were definitely a step up. The fish and chips came with garlic fries and the fried chicken came with mashed potatoes and coleslaw. All delicious sides and would come again for both meals, or to try something new!
author: Courtney D.

description:
I really really wanted to like this place but sadly was disappointed.

The beer was good but the food was pretty awful and expensive.

Burger was bleh and not worth $16. 2 small patties together....should of known not to get it when they don't ask you how you want your burger cooked. The fries were undercooked and soggy.


The pozole was ok but really really tangy....there needed to be more balance. My bf said that it reminded him of salsa verde from a can and sloshed together with some other ingredients.

I am hesitant to come back to try other food as it is quite expensive and you can get better and cheaper elsewhere.

I would say come for a pint and watch a game...save your stomach for elsewhere.
author: Angela D.

description: It makes me a little sad that so many people are giving this place  bad reviews.  I had nothing but good experiences, the beer is great and the handcrafted drinks are just as great if not better.  I'm glad I don't have to go deep into the city for a good handcrafted drink or a good beer. We need more places like this In the sunset!!!
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
My coworker and I enjoy going to Devils Teeth Bakery and knowing this place is run by the same owners, we had to try it out. Our experience here was good, our server was really attentive and the food wasn't bad. 

I believe we came here with a lot higher expectations based of our experiences at Devils Teeth. We ordered the flat bread, mango salad and the pasta. The pasta was definitely really tangled so that was a bit tough for us to share and the mangos on the salad were a bit sour and the leaves were pretty big. We definitely do want to give this another try so probably after they settle in for a few more months, we'll come back and try their other dishes. 

Their sampler is super popular!
author: Eva O.

description:
Great place in the outer Sunset!  Really like the floor plan and how the place is designed.  

Got a seat at the bar on a Saturday afternoon; all the bartenders there were friendly, but not overly so (in a good way).  

We ordered some garlic fries, which were yum.  I was sad I wasn't very hungry, because a gentleman next to me ordered the burger which looked and smelled amazing.  

I'll be back and next time I'll bring my appetite.
author: Sarah F.

description: Great service, fresh food, great whiskey selection and plenty of beer. What more do you need?! Friendly atmosphere, will be making this a regular spot!
author: Chris B.

description:
Would have given it 0 stars if I could. We went when their systems were down unfortunately, but I couldn't understand why the restaurant has to be so chaotic if you one has to go old school for a day. That just tells me about the incompetence of the staff. We waited more than half an hour for 2 beers [ At a brewery!] , and on top of which.. the beer wasn't even good, in fact downright horrible.Food was decent I must admit, but when your salad comes after an hour, you really don't feel up to it.

The bartender [ some lady] was the worst. She had about 10 customers at the bar [ it wasn't even full], and she was so busy making cocktails, when she could have just served the beers first and made at least half the customers happy. Talk about prioritization and multi tasking!

And she was rude too. I am not coming back here ever. Though the food is good, there are plenty of places which serve good food in SF and have great service. At a brewery, the beer should be good and it sucked.
author: Neha K.

description:
Some things you can excuse for being new, but these you can't.

Your website said you open at 5.   We were there at 4:50.  You didn't open until 5:30.   Kind of rude.   Clearly there was staff inside, they could have come out and expained to the 100 or so people you were running late.   Instead, you ignored us and opened the doors like nothing ever happend.

Someone who appeared to be the husband of the owner also waited in line.... and let 20 or people cut the line in front of him... Mostly were parents with kids.. It just didn't sit right with me.

I wasn't a huge fan of your beers.  Your Double IPA tasted more like a real mild pale ale.     I tried all of your beers and none were stand outs that would make the beer nerds go out of their way for your place.   Look at your untappd reviews, I'm not alone. I'm hopefull as your brewer learns his new equipment and finds his way, these will improve... There is alot of room for improvement here.

Although we only had beers on our visits, it appeared the wait times for food were long.
 
The novelty of this place will wash off soon, and if they can't fix these things, they will not be around long.  

I do hope they get it together.. it is a great space and I like to support local breweries!

I'll give them a few months and update my review.
author: David W.

description:
Pretty chill joint to grab some drinks with a large group of friends in the Outer Sunset.  I really like the open, warehouse, organic, and rustic, kind of feeling when I walk in. We enjoyed our drinks upstairs where there was a planted wall, small bar, and large table seatings for the number of us to enjoy. I had the Dry Irish Stout that tasted exactly what it describes - with coffee and chocolate. I tasted a bit of light coffee and a smooth aftertaste of chocolate that lingers on the tongue. 

I really liked the beers, so I'm definitely coming back for their burgers next time. They have tacos on Sundays! WHUT WHUT?!
author: Linda K.

description:
So good! Really enjoyed the fantastic service. We ordered the bowl of wings - tequila/lime flavor and it was good! Lots of wings! Enough for 3-4 people to share!!

We also shared the burger and this was very good too :)

We each got flights of beer. My fav is the irish stout :)
author: Carina M.

description:
New place. I understand you're still working out the kinks. 

Arrived for Saturday afternoon and there was a line that lead out the door. There was a line because the hostess was gone long enough for customers to wonder if it was self-seating. 

The menus are on plain white paper and even the service staff can't distinguish the food from the drink menu. I recommend different color nice quality paper if you decide to stick with the paper system. 

Staff - we had an awesome waitress but she was hard to find. I had to flag down 3 people to get ketchup for fries and 2 people to get small plates. What really irked me was when I flagged down the 2nd person for ketchup she told me she's the hostess and that I should ask a staff to "help you with that." -- WOW.... Anyways, I feel like small plates should be a given if 2 people ordered 2 starter dishes...but maybe it's just me and I just like to share. 

The fries were good, but would've been better if I got my ketchup before we finished half the fries. 

Non-alcoholic Drinks - I ordered a glass of orange juice since I had work in a couple of hours. There was clearly more than just orange juice in there since it was a bit fizzy and bubbly and alcoholic tasting. 

Alcoholic drinks - I highly recommend your staff to ask for IDs when people place an order for an alcoholic drink especially since minors are allowed to come in. Just saying. 

I prefer my restaurant water served cold, not room temperature. 

At times the staff did not look friendly but maybe it's because they're so concentrated on their tunnel vision that it's hard to hear "excuse me" or to see a wave. 

I'll come back eventually but not anytime soon. I want to wait for things to improve.
author: Jess W.

description:
Went there on their opening night and was completely unimpressed. The only thing that looked good on the menu was the burger, but that was completely sold out and it wasn't even 8PM. The dishes that we did get were overpriced, but OK.

The beer was good. Go for the beer not the food.

When we finally paid our bill in cash, the waitress only brought us back the bills and not any of the coins. This was really odd...
author: Sandra L.

description:
I love this place. We come at least once a week. I like to come with my kids during lunch on Wednesdays but we love ordering to-go and especially telling our neighbors about it. After living in the marina for 7 years we were used to having lots of food options. Moving to the sunset we'll the options are limited to Asian, which we love but there's only so much of any type of food I will eat. So when Sunset Brewery opened their doors a few blocks from home, we were thrilled. 

We love their flight of beers. It's awesome to have a place brewing some delicious beers so close. I personally like their Arnold Palmer; just enough tang and sweetness. 

Food is always delicious, beautifully presented and so filling. I usually get a soup starter, a seasonal salad and something with chicken. I love their tacos, grilled chicken sandwich (enjoyed that during brunch hours) or sliders. 

We also love their decadent mac and cheese. It's really outstanding. The burger is also a family go-to. 

Please save some room for the dessert. Whoa it's always scrumptious. Whether you dive into the homemade ice cream or a seasonal dessert you'll be impressed.
author: Tamz O.

description:
Sunset Reservoir Brewing Co is off to a great start from the looks of the crowd last night.

The whole place was a little too packed for my taste, but what can you expect from a new bar/restaurant in a great location on a Saturday night? My party put our name down for a table and fought our way to the front of the bar area for some pre-dinner drinks. 

I'm a huge fan of the beer here. All of them tasted great, especially the amber and the blonde which were my favorites of the night.

The food tasted great and was reasonably priced. I would hope that they'd possibly expand their menu as time goes on!

Overall, it was a good experience coming here. However crowd was a bit.. unusual for the Sunset. As someone who grew up in the area, it's strange seeing a place like this on Noriega. Hoping that this isn't the start of a cultural shift in the Sunset...
author: Greg J.

description:
Sunset Reservoir Brewing has their "bar" to the left, brewing vaults in the left rear, and table seating in the rest of the space.

brew: flight of 5 ($10) 2 ales, 1 sour wheat, 2 stouts
-sour was sour for those who like it
-irish stout best of the flight

eats: baked oysters(14) with garlic butter, gouda cheese, horseradish
-5 oysters, 2 pea pod sized, not a good value
-sauce tasted nice, not enough oyster meat to taste
2 stars

take outs:
-ruling out fries, chips, bacon left most of menu off limits to me
-food menu pricey
-flight reasonably priced.
-service ok.
author: Victor G.

description:
Food is 3.5 stars, but our service was good and I had a good time with my ladies. Came here in December for brunch with my girls for an early Christmas celebration. We got a nice table. Our server was great and checked up on us enough, but also knew when to let us be. 

The brunch menu isn't usually my type of stuff I would normally get. I decided to pick chicken sandwich - grilled or fried chicken, cole slaw, chipotle aioli, barbecue sauce, fries-Not bad. Nothing special. Chicken had good flavor, but bread got a bit soggy. 

I would want to come back and try the dinner just to see.
author: Karen H.

description:
Meh.

I was really excited to try this place out and unfortunately I ended up very disappointed. 

There aren't many beer choices to begin with and one of the beers and the cider were out. So sad. We ordered burgers med rare and they both came out well done. And the burger is $16...cmon now it better be a hecka good one. We also got the shishito peppers which was supposed to have Maldon sea salt but instead we get Morton's iodized salt. It may sound silly but it makes a difference.

The service wasn't the best. I felt like our waiter kept forgetting stuff when we asked for it. We had to keep reminding him.

The ambiance/space is pretty cool. And it's in the Sunset District. I hope it gets better..... I'll give it another chance in the far far future.
author: J A.

description:
Incredible beers and they gave us a tour of the brewery area! 
Even good vegetarian options which I didn't expect. 
The braised pork was amazing!
author: Jay R.

description: Ate here while visiting my buddy out in SF. He was raving about it but I wasn't expecting much since where I'm from is known for their breweries. I've been to more than a few but was pleasantly surprised by this one. Good food, great atmosphere, and quality drinks. Not much of a reviewer but gotta give credit where it's due. If you're thinking about trying this place out I definitely recommend it.
author: Chris T.

description:
Truly fantastic experience here. The freshness queues and quality of the product can't most certainly be noticed in both plate presentation and taste. I believe the bread is fresh baked as well, something which you do not find everywhere and trust me, makes a difference when we make our selections on where to eat. Couple this with knowledge and hospitality focused waitstaff, its no wonder why this is quickly becoming an "it" spot.

A diverse whiskey collection ranging from deep smoky oak to smooth and fresh vanilla, yep they have it. Not your bag? No worries, you'll find a full bar where the mixologists will craft you a cocktail to please any patrons taste. All with craft beers you will find no where else? Goodness, why did I not know about you sooner!? Keep up the outstanding work and guest centric focus, we will most certainly be back!
author: Joshua S.

description:
