Good food. Good beers. Good music. Good service. 

The only rub would be to time your visit as you may run into a delay.
author: John M.

description:
I was really excited when I heard about a brewery opening up in the sunset. I'm a big craft beer fan and love trying out new breweries. The ambiance and design of the restaurant is beautiful. Very big and open.

I went there with one other person, the wait time was about an hour and 15mins. That's fine, not much they could do about that but they did say the wait would be about 45-50mins. Little disappointed but not a big deal because they had a warriors game on to take my mind off of it. 

Finally we got seated in a booth. Ouch! Not the most comfortable seats. Solid wood. No cushion. We ordered the hummus to start which was good (they forgot to give us small plates to eat off), for our main course I had the pozole which impressed me. Very tasty. And my girl ordered the burger which came out a perfect medium rare. BUT $16??? $16? We felt like it was overpriced. 

The beer was good. I had the IPA. solid, easy to drink but easy to forget. 

I'll be giving this place another chance because they are new and still getting the hang of things. The service was poor for us on that particular night but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. I'd really like it to become my go-to neighborhood joint but they're not quite there yet. With a few menu tweaks and additions and a better trained staff this place could be off the hook.
author: Travis I.

description: I'm surprised at all the poor reviews here.  It's not a sports bar so I don't know why anyone would expect that sort of vibe.  I've come here a handful of times now and with my dad.  I've come here on a Friday night when it was super busy and I was in a terrible mood.  I was upset that there was a wait; just me being a brat.  I got a sampler and was moved to a table and the food is so good it cheered me up.  I love that they have healthy options and bomb salads as opposed to just bar food.  I've also come here for brunch and got chiquilaques and everyone was eating off my plate after they had all cleared their own.  Food is always amazing.  Love the fried chicken slider or sandwich and the beet salad.  Oh ya and service has always been good.  Treat your servers with kindness and respect and you'll probably have the same experience.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Last night was our first night going. It's beautiful inside! We couldn't believe this place is on our street. The service was fantastic and the drinks well priced. My gin and tonic was $5. 

The only thing I have to ask is if there will be a happy hour? College night? Anything like that because we would love to come here all the time! This place is the perfect spot to meet some friends after work have a few drinks maybe an appetizer and safely walk home. 

For all you noriegers you should definitely stop by! It's so convenient and I love how clean it is. Wish I took a picture. Our upstairs table was awesome and looking down at everyone was pretty cool. 

Like I said before we would love to come here all the time it's the perfect hang out spot to meet a few friends.
author: Erica L.

description:
I went to watch a Warriors Finals game with a group of friends and I definitely recommend this neighborhood spot. 

The food is great. We shared the buffalo wings (MUST GET!), fries, mussels, and strawberry arugala salad. The drinks are good. They've got a good beer selection on tap and offer a flight of 6 to try their in-house brews. I'm more of a cider drinker, and I do recommend their Hatcher Cider (despite it being the only one on the menu).

The service was alright. The only thing I did not like was that they don't seat you until your entire party is present, despite only missing one person and the entire place is empty. But our waiter was personable and accommodating. They are sticklers about staying out of the aisles - which I get is fire code. 

All in all, if you're from or in the Sunset, stop in, you won't be disappointed.
author: Sharon L.

description: Super chill. Bartenders are super friendly and accommodating. There flight samples gives you an idea of what type of beer you like. I found out that I really don't like ipas especially double ipas and stout beer. My favorite was the sour wheat and maibock. Sweet and sour perfect combo. They have containers that you can bring your beer to go. They also have desserts that incorporates the beer. Tried the strawberry shortbread but will try one of the beer desserts next time.
author: Fanny C.

description: Always want to love this place.  It's in our neighborhood and it has a cool vibe. Food is pretty good.  But there's always something disappointing each time we've gone.  Like the most recent visit: the service was absolutely horrendous.  Our server (I think her name was Josue) was literally as incompetent as it gets.  In fact, her level of incompetency and rudeness might have been the nail in the coffin for us.  I don't think we'll be returning to this cute place any time soon. Sorry SRBC.  :(
author: Elaine M.

description:
When my buddy said lets check out that brewery in the Sunset, I thought Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company, that new place in the Sunset, which happens to stick out like a sore thumb being the only brewery I know of in the Sunset District.

The wood themed spot and ambiance is great. New. Spacious. Fine lighting. The first floor bar area is on the left and seating is on the right. The entire building must of been a large gym or market, upon discussion from my group, because the second floor seating overlooks the main floor, ala NoPA.

The reason why I give this spot 3 stars is I wouldn't make this a regular spot for drinks. The food is okay and $5.00 chips and salsa in the menu doesn't fit this neighborhood. 

I do want to try their flights the next time around and if they can find a nice groove between food, drink and prices, I would say they might have a niche.
author: Sam T.

description:
Food: beer average. 

Service: horrible, we sat down, it was empty, no one said hi or bother with us. I went up to the bar, got a flight $8 for 4. They didn't have the 3rd one, didn't tell me that they ran out gave me 3. I had to ask, I don't think I should ask in that case, didn't tell me the price adjustment or whatnot.
author: Kim D.

description:
Love this place, warm, friendly, inviting and fabulous food...and even better beer!

I had the  scallops--delicious, perfectly done.  My companion had the burger, and says it's one of the best he's had in the city.

Now the beer--I had a flight of their beer-each one had a distinctive taste, the sour was my favorite.  My friend says the Brown Ale is the best.  

Wait staff was fun and patient!

Can't wait to go backI
author: janet g.

description:
They were busy even early on a Saturday, but we were just there for drinks and we sat at the bar after a couple stools opened up. 

They were already out of one of the beers so we were only able to sample 3 and I didn't love any of the beers. Unfortunately, their food is really also expensive. It's too bad because it would have been great to have a brewhouse nearby.

I would come back again to try their other beers when their available, but I wish they had some less expensive bar food options.
author: Annaliese D.

description: Our server was awesome and I'm sorry I didn't get his name.  But all of the other reviews about poor service didn't happen to us.  3 Stars because my burger was a glorified fast food joint burger.  Two tiny patties stacked together with barely any avocado spread on top.  The fries were a little over fried and dry.  The salads though are huge and looked good.   Two friends ordered them and didn't finish.  Wings were ok, mussels good but not enough bread, flat bread also good with the salami.  Drinks came easily and we were checked on frequently even though the restaurant was full.  Definitely will come back!
author: Rosalind S.

description: Awesome service. Awesome liquor. Awesome beer. Awesome atmosphere.  And it's across the street from my son's house! Just don't take my parking spot when I'm visiting!
author: surf h.

description: Yikes. Ordered a non fried chicken sandwich to go $14 with fries. Also ordered a Caesar salad $13.  The chicken was dark meat with some type of red dry rub. It was terrible.  I was told the fried chicken sandwich was chicken breast. I poorly assumed that one.  The caeser salad came with dressing on the side.  I had to mix it all up at home since my order was to go.  What a pain that was.  The fries were ok,  how can you mess those up... The only positive was the very nice bar back.  I feel like I need to rescue her from that place.  Yuk. This is the place to go for fried food and burgers and of course drinks...
author: A C.

description:
THRILLEd to see a place like this in the sunset. WELCOME, WELCOME!! 

Just hope the wee high prices can withstand this area.... it's Marina-ish prices in the SUNSET... So... good luck, but ...
that being said, the venue is worth the premium. It's gorgeous, so far (Wear and tear will happen, so we shall see...)

My cocktail $9, the ginger mule? was weak and watery. Next time I'll venture out for the  beers- lesson learned.
author: Kim D.

description: I don't drink alcohol. Came here for Saturday brunch, didn't make reservations and 3 of us got seated in 5 mins despite the place being busy. I love brunch and will definitely return. Coffee came in a huge mug and refilled often. We shared beignets, with chocolate sauce and they were good, but I like a more light dough. The French toast with pear and syrup was yummy--the bread was crispy and not your ordinary white bread. The eggs Benedict was really good, crispy breading. We also had a salad, everything was very fresh, tasty, and beautifully presented. Nice, noisy bar atmosphere with a separate booth, eating space. Love the high ceilings. Good service.
author: Kudos K.

description:
This place is a solid addition to the Outer Sunset, so I'm trying not to tank their star rating with a few of my qualms. My goal is to provide honest feedback here, not berate the owners of this cool new establishment because the Sunset certainly needs more places to grab a craft beer. 

I got the chicken torta and it was so weird; it was sort of like dry chorizo with crumbled cheese on top. I saw a photo someone else posted and it didn't look a thing like the sandwich I got. For $10+ I wish I wouldn't have gotten what tasted like cafeteria food. Speaking of, there should be better descriptions of the food on the menu. We didn't know the burger came with fries, (there wasn't a note on the menu about it coming with a side) so we ordered a side of fries, leaving us with SO MANY FRIES. Also, my torta came with dry tortilla chips and no salsa. (Why? Why would you do that to me?! At least we had fries.) The burger was pretty good in terms of taste, but it came with two small patties instead of one big one. This led me to believe they had been sitting on the grill for a while and had shrank in size. Weird.  

The beer was good (though they were out of the Cherry Wheat that I wanted to try). We sat in the bar area, however, which led to us having to fend for ourselves when we needed something like a water refill. People kept walking past us at the little two-person tables and no one would make eye contact with us or ask how our food was. There should be a dedicated server for that area or at least someone floating around making sure everyone's okay. 

I might come back, but I'll probably get the soup, which looked pretty good compared to my sad, maybe-chicken sandwich. Also, guys, you're a restaurant with all-Spanish dish names and you have Tabasco instead of Tapatio or Cholula?! 

It's pretty obvious from my experience and other reviews I've read that the kitchen hasn't been able to keep up with the pace/demand, but it would be pretty easy to throw some chips and salsa on the table for diners to munch on while the chefs take the time to prepare food with a little more care.
author: Whitney D.

description: The beers are good but not great. The service is usually prompt, courteous, and helpful. They are a little out of the way for the typical SF joint, but it's great for us out in the Sunset. Good food and generally a good place to grab a bite and a drink.
author: Dave S.

description: A really fun bar if you're in the sunset district on a game night. Has great, house made beer, chicken wings and barfood.
author: Parker W.

description:
Went in yesterday for Domingo Sunday. Had the extra pale ale and irish stout, - both were good, not exceptional, but good.  Ordered the chicken torta...it was really good and the salsa that came with on the side had great flavor. I wish this place nothing but success and will be back a lot as it is one of the few quality places for good food and craft beers in my neck of the woods.  Prices were reasonable. Funny when people complain about prices when there is menu online that details how much items will cost.

From one SF native to another, best of luck and hope you are around for a very long time!
author: Michael W.

description: Breath of fresh air to the outer sunset community. Great craft brews and cocktails. A food and beer menu that is constantly changing to keep things fresh. Open face BLT with a poached egg (Saturday menu)  probably my all time fave. Wings are great deal. $13 for a large portion. Can never go wrong with their burger and fries either.
author: Matt A.

description:
Completely bad attitude, rude customer service, even when we made a reservations. Normal 15 minute rule clearly does it appy here. Neither the servers nor the owner offered any constructive resolution of the problem.

Stay away.
author: Pavel M.

description:
Im not impressed. Food is okay. Pasta bolognese tasted like hamburger helper. Sunset burger is a burger and I'd rather go to Jenny's burger on 9th ave. Chicken was a little salty. Flatbread was really dry. Mussels were super tiny. Not really worth it to go through all the shells. Oysters were pretty good. 

All in all it was okay. The beer is good. My friends got the sampler and I got cider. We enjoyed them. They have a very interesting dry irish stout and I loved the wheat beer.

Staff is really nice and friendly. Like really nice. I was a horrible customer and I also got drunk and was even more unpleasant but they remained nice to me the entire evening.

Also its crazy busy and I'm not really happy about their location. I dont think they fit in to the neighborhood that well. I feel like this place is more cow hollow or union street... not outer sunset.
author: Becca W.

description: Brunch Menu! I'm not a big beer guy, but I do appreciate good food and this place seems to hit the spot like no other in the sunset, except for Outerlands and the dim sum options of course. Wholesome food and plenty of liquor options. We went for brunch and got the chilaquiles and breakfast burrito and it was plenty of food! Their brunch menu is new, and different from the dinner options. They show the football games on Sunday, come and sit next to the TV and eat before the afternoon games.
author: Sergio G.

description:
We live in the Outer Sunset so it's great to have another kid friendly choice for dining out. 

Pros: 
Awesome, friendly and attentive bus staff & hosts
Good food 
Good beer
Good ambience
Loud (good if you r trying to muffle the sounds of kids)
Kid friendly


Cons:
Prices
Lack of bartenders (two on a Sunday night doesn't cut it) took at least 15-20 min to get our drinks at our dinner table. 
Our server was lack luster, although other servers that helped deliver our food were very nice. Forgot to order our kids drinks. Our bussed was way more attentive than our server. 
Parking
Had to ask for quite a few things. Salt, pepper, ketchup, garnish for our vodka tonic (lime) etc. Portions of ketchup are good for about 3 fries. Why can't they put a whole bottle on the table?

Would we go back? Yes, they have plenty of time to improve on some things.
author: Amy L.

description:
Definitely the new neighborhood hot spot. The space is gorgeous and the service great. The hostess was really nice and sat me even though my whole party wasn't there yet. The server was really friendly and personable and attentive- way better than what you expect these days in the City.
My issue was solely the food and the menu. Not the taste and flavor of the food- what we ordered was great. but the menu is over priced and pretentious. Entrees run from $14 to $27 braised pork including the $16 burger.
The beer was excellent but the vegetarian options were few and far between.
author: Stari N.

description:
It was easier to get pie on Pi day in San Francisco than getting a table or any of our first (or second) choice beers and menu items from Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company. This place brings some more of the hipstery action to the Outer Sunset (for better or worse), but there are some things that can be improved upon. Mainly, the availability of food and drink items. 

The beers were okay, nothing special, but it seems they're expanding their offerings in the future, so okay. But for the time being, especially since they only have 5-6 beers total, it would probably be easier for everyone if they had the beer menu on a chalk board so people could quickly see what's available (and more importantly what is not). When we finally got seated, we ordered the charred shishito peppers and the p.e.i. mussels. The clams were great, and it was big enough that one could probably eat it as an entree, but it's perfect to share among 3-4 people as a starter. Additionally, I'm glad that they give you bread and butter, so be sure to save that (or request more) to sop up all that remaining sauce.

We tried to order two burgers and one pasta. Maybe 10 minutes later, we were told they're out of burgers. Okay, let's change the burgers to the braised pork and trout. 15 minutes later, they told us they don't have the trout anymore either. Fine, let's go with the roasted half bird then. 15 minutes later, they came back to ask what the third person ordered (answer: pasta). Finally, all our food comes, and I have a pork shank that can feed a family, and my friend has a sad little piece of chicken breast on his plate (alright, I guess this is what a half bird is?). The pork shank was tender and the sriracha spaetzle and toybox carrots were really good, but the pasta was okay (improved by adding some pork shank) and the chicken was perfectly bland and healthily portioned. 

I don't know why we ordered dessert, but we did. And guess what, they ran out of something! Fortunately, it was not what we wanted. We got the bread pudding
made with bourbon, brioche, dried cherries, vanilla orange sauce, and ice cream they were proud to announce was from Polly Ann ice cream located nearby. We joked that right after telling us about the ice cream, we'd actually find out later that they ran out (they didn't run out! pleasant surprise!). The bread pudding was good, but I think I could've just eaten a bowl of the ice cream with sauce.

It's a fun addition to the neighborhood, but I'll stick to Social Kitchen & Brewery for now, since that's closer to me anyway.

Oh! An important note: there are additional bathrooms located upstairs.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Mission interior vibe minus all the parking hazard. What more can you ask for? 

We ordered reservoir salad and shishito pepper along with beer flight. Everything tasted delish, especially the salad and extra pale ale. I liked their serviced too. Will definitely be back soon :)
author: Amy Y.

description:
We came in last night for the first time, since we live around the corner. Let me sum this place up for you: awesome! Come now, and come often. I really liked this place, and I've been to many, many breweries in my day (even spent last weekend in San Diego touring breweries). This is a place the Sunset needed desperately, and it did not disappoint. 

We walked in, put our name in, and had a drink at the bar while we waited. The place was pretty packed for 8PM on a Tuesday, but the wait was only 20 minutes. The interior of the place is really nice... modern but with some subtle cues to a german beer hall. 

The Beer: really good. The Blonde & wheat especially surprised me, I'm not usually a big fan of those styles, but I liked theirs a ton. The double IPA will definitely become their most popular beer I would suspect. It's very citrus-y, with a nice hop bite. Very crushable. Can't wait for more beers from this place because this is a great start. Highly recommend the flight if it's your first time so you can try all of them. They come in a baking pan, which I thought was really cool since the owner is a baker (devil's teeth down the road).

The Food: also excellent. We had the flatbread and hummus for an appetizer, and it was very good. For the main course I had the Reservoir salad & my girlfriend had the chili. We shared both because they were both awesome. The salad was fresh and unique. The chili had a nice bite to it, but wasn't overwhelming. It was veggie too, which was great. For desert we had the bread pudding, and it was very good, too (as you would expect from a baker). 

The Service: top notch. Not sure what others have said in here about the service being slow. Pretty much every person in the place came over to ask if we needed anything, to take empty plates, etc. It was fantastic. I really can't say enough good things about the service we received. Everyone was nice and chatted with us. 10/10 here. 

The Price: on par with others like it. I think the other people saying it's expensive don't actually understand the market at all. This place is actually right on the money with the pricing I think. It's not too expensive at all. Especially if you compare to the other brewpubs in the city. Can't complain about the check at all.
author: Sal F.

description: I like the place.  I like the food.  I like the people.  You don't have to be in a group.  You can be any age.  You don't feel like in some places unless you play on their softball team you are an "outsider"  Can grab one of their beers and sit at the bar and watch a game or aways at one of their tables.  They even project games on wall so people upstairs can watch as well as people in the first floor dining area in case they can't see either of the tv's   Order their pizzas to go often when having friends over to watch a game.
author: Susan O.

description:
A good brew pub that makes it own beers on site and offers succulent dishes to go with the beer.  What is not to like.

We did the sample flight of 6 beers in 3 oz portions. We paired and shared it with the fried chicken, the mussels, the aragula salad, and the butter lettuce salad.  All dishes were well presented and delivered in a timely fashion.

One recent change of note- large parties (6 or more) now require a reservation.
author: John S.

description:
Quite disappointing. They are supposed to be a beer place, but after ordering I was told the cooling equipment wasn't working properly, and the beer would be warm. It took them quite a while to pour the beer, then a lot longer to get it to the table, so if it wasn't warm initially it was now.

I ordered a flight, and apparently the high temperature caused the beer to foam a lot, and basically filled the muffin tin with beer, so when I went to drink the tasters dripped all over my food and all over me.

The food was fine, but I really went there for the beer, and was less than impressed.
author: Chuck A.

description: we are so disappointed with this brewery. we came here last Monday (02/12/18). we got our bikes (foldable) with us that time. we asked them if we can bring our bikes inside since we can fold it. they firmly said "we dont allow bikes inside" so we said okay. we locked our bikes outside, 2 stores after the brewery. we have to check our bikes every 5 minutes to check if they're still there. that is a total inconvenience. then after few minutes of staying there, a man came in with his bike and he literally put his bike inside the brewery!! we thought he works there but no. he grab some drinks and stayed for a while and go. we were like "seriously?!!" they allow him to park his mountain bike inside?! why because he is a white person  and we are asians?!! also their servers are busy eithet chitchatting to each other or busy on their phone! we have to approach the bartender for our drinks cause they are soooo busy on their phones!!! we will never go back here! and will never recommend this brewery to anybody!
author: Melissa Mutya F.

description:
My review was just for the service that my friends and I received here the other day and that alone. I am a local and consider myself a regular as I come here on average once every week. The bartender this day was the skinnier guy with not much hair(my receipt says PM B.) Pretty sure his name was Dave. The service from him on this day was absolutely foul. I'll try to highlight some key events.

-sitting down the bartender handed us the menu and stood there looking at us waiting for us to place an order. What server does not give their customers any time to look over the menu? He did the same thing for two other customers that sat near me and they had to tell him they wanted more time with the menu. He did not say a word and just walked away.

-When asked about which is the most popular beer, the reply was "They are all equally popular" and proceed to walk away. 

-The first check we received was wrong. He missed a lot of things on there and having a good conscience I decided to let him know that I was undercharged. He was not grateful at all. He was almost appalled that I corrected him on his mistake. Note that the difference in the two bills was almost $200. I would expect a little more gratitude.

-When handing me the corrected bill he kept my credit card and asked if he can run it for the bill. I wanted to look over it again but again he stood there waiting for my reply while I go over a bill with well over 20 items on it. Feeling as he would not come back if I went back to my table to verify with my friends with that they ordered I just told him to run the card. 

-Checking the bill at home I was charged for an extra drink that no one ordered which was conveniently labeled as "open drink" on the receipt. 

-He pushed his way between two of my friends who were having a conversation and dropped his dish rack on the table and said he wanted to collect a few plates. No excuse me or anything before hand. That was really the last straw for us.

TL:DR - Server PM B (the skinny one with the hair that really isn't there, name I believe was Dave) has some of the worst customer service I have ever received with friends saying the same exact same thing. I miss the days when the ladies or the guy with the beard(Jeremiah) would work the bar. I'm not exactly sure what the guys problem was that day but I don't intended to stick around and find out. However I inbox is open, Sunset Brewery.-
author: W W.

description:
We celebrated my birthday here tonight and everything was fantastic! We had a large party and 6 kids and the wait staff was attentive and patient, got the kids food out quickly so the rest of us could enjoy our libations. The beer flight my husband had was plentiful and he enjoyed it very much. He had the burger which he said was great! I had the wheat beer, actually two of them, and was very happy with my choice. The pappardelle pasta is made in house and was amazing! 

Make sure to leave room for dessert! The chocolate stout cake was to die for with it's Bailey's cream cheese frosting and homemade maraschino cherries. Yes, homemade maraschino cherries!! 

We live in Bernal but will definitely make this family-friendly spot a routine visit once the newness settles down. Glad to see so much interest and hope to see more families there in the near future!
author: Heather B.

description: We had the Meat & Cheese plate which was a great disappointment because it only had two selections of meat and 3 pieces of cheese and some toasted croutons and no pickles - it is vastly and I mean vastly overpriced - an amateur job! Our group also ordered the Pasta Bolognese which turned out to have been prepared in a Salt mine! The beer selection for a brewery is rather sparse with only four draft beers on tap. The only good thing to say about this place is that the atmosphere is buzzing and it is good for people watching but overall this restaurant is very disappointing and we do not recommend this establishment.
author: Thomas C K.

description: Finally made it here after hearing about it and being a huge fan of Hilary's other amazing spot, Devils Teeth Bakery. I was not disappointed!! The pozole and chiliquiles were delicious. My kids loved the chicken tenders and burger which was big enough for my son's huge appetite. I did  borrow a few of my kid's French fries just to make sure they were fresh, they were crunchy and delicious. I had a lovely Sauvignon blanc on tap. Next time I am looking forward to trying the arroz con leche but I was stuffed after the amazing pozole!
author: Isa H.

description:
Great food and drink!  Had the beer flight - favorites are the blonde and the stout.  The rabbit rillete appetizer was awesome, and the burger excellent and huge - those 2 were enough for the 3 of us.  Friendly bartenders, and excellent selection of liquors.  The prices are normal for this kind of place, though much more expensive than all the dives and asian restaurants around here.  I would gladly pay extra to have this kind of quality and experience, and I hope it brings in other establishments at this level.  Word is getting around and you need reservations for Friday (90 minute wait at 6:30 PM.  The only improvement would be to add more wines - only one Chardonnay on the menu right now.   

As a local, I am so happy to see them here.  If you get there and there is a huge wait and you are too hungry, go up Noriega a couple blocks, towards 21st Ave, and eat at Peking.  There are some other good ones nearby, but be careful and read the reviews - some have low-quality ingredients.
author: Brayton F.

description:
Great Beer!  I had a flight of beers and thought the "wheat beer" was fantastic...subtle tastes of sourdough.  Really delicious!  I'm looking forward to digging into the food menu next time...

I loved the family friendly feeling...I grew up in the Sunset and felt completely at home.

So cool to have this place in our neighborhood!
author: Fred S.

description:
When I first heard of this place opening up right near by where I live, I was pretty amped since it would become the only brewery in the outer sunset.  I was expecting it to become my go-to spot (especially because the beer is only $6 a pint!), but I don't go as often as I had expected - the food is really good, but the beer and service are a little disappointing.

The decor is nice, I love the high ceilings and the outdoor lights that are strung around.  The variation of small and large table is good for all groups, and the bar is a fine place to sit if you are looking for a casual drink/meal.  The food is also good - the fish and chips come with malt vinegar (!!!) and tartar sauce, and the bowl of Wings is sizable (at least when I got it!).  The burgers are good too, along with the appetizers. No complaints about the food.

The beers could be better... I think we are pretty spoiled on the west coast with the number of great breweries we have, so this may just be because I know what I like and what breweries I like better - so it just doesn't meet my mark.  But, I have taken friends and they say that they like the beer just fine!  

My final comment is about the service.  Every time we sit down, the waiters are always great.  However it's the initial welcome (that others have noted in their reviews as well) that is a bit unpleasant. They require that your whole party be there before you are seated.  Sometimes this is not possible.  What if someone is late? We should be able to sit down and start perusing the menu and maybe order some drinks or food while we wait.  They seem to be super snotty about this and it has always put me off whenever I go.  It just seems unprofessional to me.  I get it if I am the only person there waiting for a party of 7, but when 5 of us are there for a party of 7 and you still won't seat us?  That seems a little extreme.

Also, if you want to take a bunch of friends and sit at a table just for drinks - forget it.  They want you to order food if you are seated at a larger table, so this place is not good if you are a large group and just want to have drinks.
author: Alicia L.

description:
My complaint is that this place is overpriced.  By about 25%.  The space is nice.  The food was solid, but not amazing.  Portions were not large.  Comparing to other similar restaurants we frequent, prices are high.

That said, the neighborhood is clearly happy to have this venue in the sea of Asian restaurants.   It is a great addition and variety from what is in the area.  Unfortunately due to prices, we won't come here often.
author: Genevieve B.

description:
Came here to watch the Mayweather - Pacquiao fight with a friend 5/2/15.

Drinks were good - I liked the amber.  I didn't find the food expensive, but then again, I didn't order the $16 burger either.  

We got fries, tacos, & honey mustard chicken wings.  Fries were good, tacos delicios, and wings were awful.  Probably just because I didn't like the honey mustard flavor.

I was however, amazed at how many chicken wings e were given for such a low price.  We couldn't even finish them no matter how hard we tried!

Would come again.
author: BizzyLizzy K.

description: I came here when this place first opened and wasn't blown away. But I recently decided to try again and I'm so happy I did! The beer is great and the food is amazing! Seriously the best brunch I've had in a long time. The food comes out fast and the service is great. They have a unique menu that is almost impossible to choose from. Expensive but worth it. The kitchen staff here really knows what they're doing.
author: Monica D.

description:
The food at this place is delicious, and the drinks are always well-prepared (if a bit inconsistent at times...) But every time I come here, the service is extremely lacking or uncomfortable.

I've continued coming back (been here a total of 6-8 times) because the food has always been good for the most part and it being so close to my home! Finally, a place I can get some California cuisine, within walking distance from my house! But after my service last night, I'm not sure i'll be coming back.

The entree we come here for are the mussels w/ chorizo. So delicious! The broth seems to have some ginger/lemongrass flavors in it that just make it unbelievable. We were drinking it out of the bowl last night. Last night we also got fried mac and cheese balls which were cheesy, creamy and paired well with their delicious marinara sauce. Portion was big also, for price. We also got the Sunset Caesar, which also was delicious, well balanced, and great portion size. The dessert, Salted Caramel cake, was great! It was our 3rd time having it in a row - couldn't bring ourselves to order a different dessert because of how much we loved this one! Old fashions, my go to drink, are always pretty good, if a bit inconsistent on the amount of alcohol from drink to drink. Last night, we got 2 old fashions at the same time, and it seems as if they weren't mixed well, because one definitely had way more alcohol then the other, and lacked balance.

The disappointment though has come with lacking attention or kindness from the wait staff. One day we obviously over ordered, and the bartender didn't let us know this until after all the food came out (mentioning at that point that he definitely thought we had over-ordered when he first put it in.) Last night we showed up at approximately 8:15, and they close at 9. We ordered pretty quickly and got through our meal pretty fast too. We ordered dessert as they asked for last call in the kitchen, and ordered our last drink as they asked for last call in drinks. We had already ordered a pretty good amount of food and alcohol, and asked if we could get another drink as we waited for dessert, and were told no. That's fine, but it was all done with no sympathy (as was her mood the entire time we were there.) Our dessert came out, and we had already given her a credit card to charge for our check, when they started TURNING THE LIGHTS OFF! We were literally a few bites away from being done, and still needed to leave a tip and sign before we could leave. This came across as a sign of us having overstayed our welcome. And although after tax and tip our meal came out to 100+, it seems like my business isn't appreciated enough to wait 5 minutes for us to finish our dessert, especially if we are repeating customers.
author: Mike V.

description:
Hopefully this place can work out its kinks, because it seems like a cool location and set up.  But everything we experienced was sub-par. 

For drinks, we ordered a beer flight, a paloma, a bloody maria.  Beers were bad, and they were out of one so we only got 3.  The paloma was bad.  The bloody maria barely drinkable.

For food, everything was average, except the flat bread... It was described as something you would make if you were hung over and only had burnt flat bread, beans and lettuce.  It made me sad I had to pay $10 for it.

Service was... a bit off.  They seems to be new, so hopefully they can work out the kinks.  Just stop trying to take away plates when there is obviously food left and we are eating it, get the orders right (cheeseburger has cheese), and try not to run out of half of the food on the menu by 1pm on Sunday.  On the plus side, the waitress was very nice.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Everything was great!!! Friendly service, very tasty food!! I had the BLT; most unique and scrumptious BLT I have had during my brief time on earth. I gave (4) stars just in case I missed something.. If I have the same experience for my next visit, it will be 5!
What a nice afternoon!
author: Michael W.

description: Stellar service, front and center. Our sweet server gave us the perfect amount of attention and play. Get. The. Caprese. Salad. Also had the hot wings (amazing) and the burger. Burger was well made, though the bun left something to be desired. But any tiny shortcoming is fixed by the incredible service.
author: Vieve R.

description: Plenty of street parking.This place opened last Thursday. So it's packed, be prepared to wait for a long time to be seat. We had a party of two and waited 45 minutes. The atmosphere was pretty nice. We ordered a flight of beer and d'anjou pear galette. For a 45 minute wait, we were not disappoint. The sour wheat , rye amber, and dry Irish stout was our favorite out of the five. The dessert was good too. Pretty satisfied with our experience.
author: Kristie C.

description: Awful service and a rude bartender. The food was good, its too bad the service wasn't.
author: Allison M.

description:
Stopped her for the first time with our son and granddaughter. He had been here before and  had good things to say so was looking forward to a good meal.
The food was okay but the service was so bad.
To start we ordered coffee and hot chocolate. After about 15 minutes we ordered our food and were told by our server that there were no clean mugs and she was waiting for some to be cleaned. The place wasn't even busy. A lot of empty tables. 30 minutes later we received coffee and now they had to "warm the hot chocolate". So they couldn't be warming hot chocolate in the 30 minutes it took to wash the mugs?? 10 minutes later we received the "warm" chocolate. And still no food.
When the food was finally delivered, we were missing fries, a bowl of fruit and salsa. We told server that all we wanted was the salsa and to forget about the other items. Of course the salsa never made it to the table. 
Again, it wasn't busy at all!!
We didn't complain and the only reason it made for a good time was being with our son and granddaughter.
author: Marie O.

description: Great , live close and few times I go are awsome. Stafford super friendly the food is delicious and the beer it's amazing
author: Steven W.

description: I came here last night as part of the Drink SF free beer shuttle between different breweries. I thought this brewery had a great look and atmosphere, but I got the flight and didn't like any of their beers that they brew. The Mexican Brown Lager was the best, but the others tasted watered down. Still a fun place to go, and I've enjoyed their food and cocktails!
author: Brooke R.

description: Been here before and liked the drinks so we wanted to try the food too but unfortunately that didn't happen.  It was near empty with plenty of open tables so we walked to the hostess and she said she would get our table ready and walked away leaving us waiting, all normal so far.  We then see her bringing out food back and forth to other tables which is understandable when you're busy, but it wasn't.  Then we see her standing there at the bar talking to the other servers for awhile. Another couple comes in afterwards and walks right to the bar and immediately getting seated and attended to all while we're still standing there waiting.  The whole experience didn't leave us with a good feeling and we probably won't be back for a bit at least.
author: Ben L.

description:
Not much of a brewery, only a few mediocre beers on tap, was hoping that would improve, but it's only gotten worse over the past year. Do not go here for the beer. Or the poor service, tried it one more time.
The food has only gotten worse, and so as the service. The surly taller balding bartender seems irrated if you ask about the beers.
Clearly they are more focused on mixed drinks and mostly over priced food.
author: Charles K.

description:
While in SF, we checked out this new brewery... There are some pluses and minuses.... I think we would have to go back to give the business a fair chance.

There is no sign on the front or in the business that we could see except on the shirts on the staff....

They have four beers... We tried the sampler. It was actually very messy because the beer spilled over the sides of the glasses which led to a mess on the table.

The beer was ok. The stout was the best we tried. It looked good, tasted fine.

The food was better. We tried the burger and fries... It was above solid. Tasty, hot....

I think if this place gets a sign, adds a couple more beers, and works on the staff undersranding beer a little more, it would be a nice spot....

It does seem out of place for the area... I hope it works.
author: Joe B.

description: Came here from Florida to visit my girlfriends, who live in the area. They recommended Sunset so we came for a drink. The place was definitely a remarkable place to come have a beer. After ordering and paying, we were told last call, at 10:30. No problem. As we sit drinking our drinks, the music falls off and we ask if they could put on a specific band. "We're closed", abruptly comes out of one of the bartenders mouth. Still with 15 minutes before closing time. Ok, we get that you're closing, but the rude, snarky remark from the tall, lanky bartender was unnecessary. Customer service goes a long way. There's a great chance we won't come back nor will spread the word of your establishment.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Came here for lunch. The restaurant is beautiful and spacious. We had their chili chicken torta and sunset burger. Both were good and pair well with their beer!
author: Anita T.

description: Great place...love the food, bartenders know their stuff, the beer types are not only interpreted well, but re-defined by the brewmaster's vision of each type. SRBC is a staple in the neighborhood...
author: Jesus G.

description: Good food and decent beer, but have had good and bad experiences with service! Sat alone at the bar on Sunday afternoon for a quick reprieve from the kids and my bar tab was named "Big Lady". Pretty insensitive to the customers feeling... Don't see myself returning!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
An interesting add to avenues life from the people who brought us Devil's Teeth bakery. I see a few similarities between them. More on that in a bit. 

Architecturally, the place is impressive. Designed with a raw, warehouse kind of feel with exposed girders and wiring, it kind of says SOMA to me. Or if you know Southern Pacific Brewing, it has a similar vibe which is weird for the avenues. I like the airiness, it just feels like it is out of place. 

The service is eager but a little scattered. Young, attractive, but perhaps not highly experienced. Clientele is youngish, hipsterish, chill. Lots of hoodies, backwards ball caps, and neck beards on the men. 

The menu is on point, lots to choose from with interesting offerings. My main unhappiness with it is a kind of rigidness that probably protects the quality of the service but is kind of a pain.  Like Devil's Teeth the hours are not wide open. When I left at 3pm there was a sign saying the dining area was closed until 500 p.  The first time I tried to go it was 945p and they close at 1000p. But it isn't just the hours, I wanted to order the chilaquiles with a fried egg instead of scrambled. The kitchen wouldn't  do it because it would "Change the dish". Never mind that in the Mission at Boos Voni I get the eggs to order on my chilaquiles, what do they  know about it?

The fries were a little soggy like the oil was a little on the cool side. Beer was good. Prices decent. This is the kind of place where if friends said they were going, I'd meet them. But if they asked me where to go, I wouldn't pick it.
author: jim b.

description: A little gem in this area. Have good options for beer ($6), including a flight for $12 as well as a lot of other drink options (wine, cocktails, etc.)
author: Nina S.

description: Beautiful ambiance and delicious food and beers. Upset that pizza was up to an hour late and nobody noticed to check. Other than that, great new sunset gem
author: Mariam T.

description: Came here Sunday for lunch. 3 groups ahead of us.  Employees saw us but ignored the groups for 5min. Finally someone came over and told us it was a 30min wait however the place was 1/2 full? Based on my observation they were in-adequately staffed except for the bar. Looks like service is poor in this restaurant so I took my business elsewhere.
author: Cee B.

description: When this place first opened the food was only so-so and I suspect that's why it isn't 5 stars right now. But they've hit their stride! It's a great space and everything on the menu is delicious.
author: Marsha S.

description:
Awesome! So so so happy to have this neighborhood brewery. The beer was delicious. They were slammed on a Sunday evening, but that's to be expected since they just opened. If you want a table, I would make reservations on the weekend. The bar was pretty busy but the bartender kept a smile on his face and was ultra friendly. 

Beer flight came in a MUFFIN TIN, which my inner secret hipster totally loves. The space is huge which is a far cry from SF's normally intimate atmospheres, and I was very much okay with it. 

Shisito peppers were wonderful, so glad to see one of my favorite treats on the menu. Prices are a little high for what you get, but not enough to bother me. 

Mussels were delicious & brothy - I wish they served it with a soft bread instead of a hard toast. I thought the flatbreads would be more pizza like, I liked them, but probably won't order them again since they seemed to be more bread than substance.
author: christen V.

description: I like the way they lay out the place ... their menu is awesome. . very good food and service. . love the wings !! and the beers!!
author: Cris G.

description:
A little bit of the Mission in the Sunset. Worth checking out to form your own opinion as overall it is a decent place and a welcome break from the vast majority of the restaurants in the Sunset. 

Interior/Staff:

Hiding in plain site on the outside - its interior has the ubiquitous lofty brewery space that will not be mistaken for a Chinese run sushi restaurant. At 7pm on a Thursday the patrons were all mixed 20 and 30 somethings. Those with children occupied the downstairs section while the unencumbered were safely sequestered upstairs on the mezzanine. Our server was very cheerful, got everything right the first time, though a bit slow. Despite a few concerns/misses described below we will likely return.  

Food:

*Hummus & Sambal - Everyone at the table liked it. Even the flat bread on it's own was tasty instead of merely being a cardboardy delivery vehicle.
*Ahi Poke - This was decent, but could have been better. Too much orange rind throwing the overall taste a bit too far towards citrus and my standard gripe for poke outside of Hawaii is that the fish could be a little fresher.
*Fettucini Bolognese - As tasty as it was heavy. Recommend sharing and offsetting with a salad. Hands down the winner of the 'what gave me heartburn' question.
*Sea Bass with Cauliflower Puree - Turned out to be grouper that was a tad overcooked and overpriced, but otherwise good. I don't feel this is the place or the neighborhood for $28 entrees.
*Burger - Average burger... as good as say Barneys on 24th/Castro but smaller and $6 more, but not as good as either The Corner Store or Super Duper. Something about the audacity of charging $16 for an average tasting (and sized) burger just irks me. Will not order it again or recommend for those reasons.
*IPA - The only beer I sampled. It was a decent IPA though a bit warm. It was not a particularly warm day, so not sure if this is the norm.
author: Easwud C.

description: We had Sunday brunch.  The food was great... they also have a kids menu so that's awesome as well.  The wife enjoyed her mimosa saying that the juice tasted fresh squeezed (not sure if it was but hey... that's good).  I had the IPA and it was refreshing.  All around great experience.  A little pricy, but I'd go again.
author: Mario L.

description: Nice open contemporary place for good beer and food.  We had flights of beers to try them out. We ordered Brussels sprouts, flash fried green string beans, hush puppies, rye bread with goat cheese, and sliders. All the dishes except rye bread were big. All of them were really good.
author: Sid P.

description: Fantastic beers, food, and service. The neighborhood needed a place like this!  Kid-friendly to boot, with great design elements (lofted ceiling, rustic wood and steel and glass design)
author: Sid D.

description: Good food & good service. This was our first time for dinner but have been there before for lunch. I was disappointed that they they didn't have the green beans appetizers anymore, but everything that we had was really good.
author: Karla T.

description: First time visit for brunch and was very impressed! Food was top notch and reasonably priced. Great ambiance and great cocktail/beer menu. Never a long wait for a table either
author: Tom S.

description:
I love beer and I love supporting my local breweries even more. With that said Sunset reservoir is a solid 3 stars. I have been there 3 times so this review is a combination of the 3 times that I have been there. I am going to start of with the cons and then move on the the pros.

Cons:
1. The first 2 times I have been there, it was some of the worst service I have experienced in SF, but this last time was much better.  
2. The food is over priced. I like my food to be full of flavors and take my mouth on a journey, but everything I have had has need twice the ingredients including some of there beers (the session IPA is one of those beers) Seriously I wish the Session IPA tasted as good as it smells. The habanero mango chicken wings special was boring and had no flavor along with the "habanero" ranch that did not have any kick let alone taste like ranch. Also the menu does not always describe what they are serving. The second I went I got some Mexican soup with pork that said it with corn on their black and white printer paper menu, but it actually came with garbanzo beans. I still liked it a lot and really respected that some of the chunks of pork still had the skin attached. #nomnoms
3. Not all the bartenders know how to pour stouts from a stout faucet. Twice I have gotten their Irish Stout and twice I watched in horror as the bartensee improperly poured the beer. I expect more from a brewery when it comes to how beer is poured and I won't be getting another stout until they address this problem.
4. The real reason that is making me write this review is the growler fill. Before I say why I am so upset, I must say I respect the SS Growler they sell for $60. It is the nicest growler in my collection, but their label and brand imagine isn't as well thought out as the place's atmosphere. Now back to the real reason I am writing this review: they advertise 2 liter growler fills, but don't even pour you 64 oz. The growlers they sell show you a 64oz and 2 liters fill lines ON THE GROWLER. My first fill that was free with the $60 dollar purchase of the growler was at 64 oz fill line from this beautiful bar tender. But my second fill from some hipster, black bearded fellow was below 64oz fill line. I was really starting to change my opinion about the place until this hipster barely gave me 64oz after clarifying the fill was 2 liters. I got my favorite beer there, the sour wheat, and for a beer enthusiast, who likes supporting local brews, this was more offensive than when Social Brewery stopping their growler fills. Social at least announced they stopped doing growler fills. I am bitter about the few oz I lost after dropping $60 on my growl daddy. For the love of beer please start labeling your growlers with the name of the beer and the info like every other brewery. 

Now for the Pros:
1. Baes. Not only is the staff attractive, but the crowd that comes in is just as good looking. From the 21 year olds to the cougars and that goes for the men as well, but I don't fancy them. Everytime I go in the place is packed with the Outer Sunset's finest.
2. SOME of the beers are tasty. My personal favorites are the Sour Wheat (made with Devils Teeth sourdough and if you don't know about Devil's Teeth you need to go. Hands down the best place in the Outer Sunset) and the Mai Beck.
3. The atmosphere. The place is gorgeous large open space with big dark wood beams and some steal beams. They have 2 bars one up stairs and the big one down stairs that has 2 televisions always playing sports. Upstairs would be epic for a private party, but works well for families with young kids in the mean time. There are men and women's bathrooms on both floors. I really love that you can see part of the brewery through glass windows that span the 2 floors.  The music is great and not too loud which is nice since I have bad hearing on my right side. It is a great spot to get dinner with your friends, family, or go on a date; I have done all 3.
4. Great selection of liquor and cocktails. They got whatever you are craving and every house cocktail I have tried has been delicious. I am impressed with there selection. 

Overall it is a good place to go get a sit down meal whether you are on a date, with friends, or family. They are a new place intown and are still working out the kinks. With everything I've said, I will still be coming back for dinner and to fill my growler, but only as long as they keep on improving.
author: Taylor F.

description: Great burger. Good beer. Don't order any single malts here though. $22.00 for the tiniest pour of 1 shot of macallan's. That means the profit is 500%. In my book that is a rip-off. Probably true to all their liquor sales. Stick to the beer. I just don't know how they justify stealing like that. Sigh....
author: Hackey S.

description: This is so cool to have this brewery in this part of town. We had dinner late there and our waiter was very friendly. The food was delicious: the shishito peppers were tasty and the fish and chips very fresh. They make the garlic fries with fresh garlic. Yum! Their beers and cocktails are also very good. The industrial decor looks nice too. It really adds to the friendly atmosphere.
author: Apis M.

description: The fried chicken was tender, tasty and moist. I also tried the beer flight and it was a good mix of what they offer. Service was on point!
author: Em G.

description: New favorite place! We come from the UK where "Sunday lunch" is basically sacrosanct. There are zero places in SF to get an actual traditional Sunday roast so we came here for burgers. It has a "pubby" feel, really nice cider on draft (critically important to the ritual) & our waiter was super friendly too. Frankly, I could've sat in there & drank cider all day but as ever in the U.S. a post lunch drink order causes a bit of disruption (I get it, it's not what you do here in the same way). Nevertheless, we'll be back. It's a lovely place to spend time.
author: Fi M.

description: This has become a regular spot on our neighborhood restaurant rotation.  They have an excellent beer selection, as well as a well stocked bar to create any number of delicious cocktails. I would recommend starting off with the beer sampler to try the great variety of current tap beers. The food is consistently good, and its clear that they use high quality ingredients. The Mussels and Chorizo is a particularly good dish.  So why not 5-stars? I would say that the only thing keeping from that fifth star is that there seems to be a bit of a trend of running out of certain items early, and the fact that they dropped one of my kids favorite items from the menu; the cheesy rice balls. However, these shortcomings wont deter me from going back... soon.
author: Rein G.

description: The updated 3 stars reflect only on three particular dishes. My family and I come here often, ever since they opened. But my parents had never gone, so I took my parents to SRBC the other day bc I kept talking about the fried chicken, and fish and chips to them. Unfortunately, they have a new chef, and s/he changed up the recipe on the batters. When our food came, I immediately knew something was different. The burger my dad ordered was smaller than before (patty wasn't as thick or big), and the bun didn't seem like the brioche-like bun they used to serve, it looked like a standard burger bun. It used to have a visual presence, and this was simply ordinary. Instead of large pieces of fish (like thick strips of cod), the fish came as smaller pieces, think chicken nugget sizes. The fried chicken batter wasn't crispy, but more on a doughier-chewy side. I must admit it was a disappointment. What good is fried chicken if it's not crispy, and what fun is it to eat fish and chips if it doesn't fall apart as you bite into it? Even the flavor of the batters were different. I asked our server if there was a new person in the kitchen and the server confirmed it. The server was impressed I could tell from the taste and I mentioned it wasn't just the taste but the texture as well, not to mention the portions were significantly smaller. The server put a good spin on the new batter formulas, and I agreed just to make it not so awkward. But honestly, I wish the new chef kept the original recipse. Please bring back thick juicy burger patties, crispy fried chicken, and hearty strips of fish!
author: cg w.

description: Brunch was delicious, the brewery is super clean and well laid out. It wasn't too crowded and the service was fantastic. We'll definitely come back. Our 3 month old liked it too!
author: Heather C.

description: Great beers, good deal on house brews - $6 a pour! Food looked delicious, but will have to come back to try it out.
author: Jordan W.

description: My first visit to this restaurant was for lunch on a rainy day. Soup would have been perfect but we were told that the soup of the day wasn't made yet. After ordering two roasted vegetable sandwiches, we were told that they ran out. It was noon and they had just opened. We ordered caesar salads which despite the bacon and hard boiled eggs , had absolutely no flavor and tons of iceberg lettuce. What a disappointment. I was so thrilled to have this brewery in the neighborhood, but very sad on my first visit. Maybe the chef didn't make it in with the rain and if we were told that, I would have understood. I will try it again for dinner as I have heard good reviews but please keep some consistency for your patrons. The decor was great and the beer tasty.
author: Josie M.

description:
If I had written a review the first time I went on opening weekend it would get one star.

Since then the kitchen and chef have made great strides and food is great. Beers they brew are solid. That being said, bartenders are lacking in effort. They avoid eye contact at all costs and make you wait as long as possible to get a drink. I have almost left several times as the wait for a drink is unreasonably long.
author: Igor K.

description: It's steadily improving. Let's start with a recent dessert - Caramel cake and orchata ice cream from their own bakery. Wonderful. Chicken piccata over vegetable and cauliflour puree, not bad. Salad very good and the best was the large pasta with chorizo marinara sauce. Beers - good variety of their own brews. Thanks for saving the neighborhood from a coma.
author: Fred  D.

description: Really nice and roomy walking in.  Not crowded for a nice Saturday evening, now I know why :(   Out of beet salad, fried chicken was worse than the colonel.  Manhattan had way too much bitters. Nothing above mediocre, unfortunately :((
author: Kelly B.

description: I don't know....I wanted to like it. I feel the service is good, and the beer is ok, but I don't really care for the food. I know this is subjective, but I tend to like bolder flavors, and I didn't get any of that. I was there on Taco Tuesday, which is a pretty good deal, and the portions were good.... I guess I'm just a point in my life where I don't want to spend my money on things that are just OK. It's not a horrible place, just not somewhere I would go out of my way to hit up again. whomp whomp.
author: Caddy M.

description: great service, kid friendly, plenty of space and plenty of beer. need more places like this in the sunset!!
author: Katie L.

description: Don't order the fried chicken. It's minuscule in its portions. You'll have a better experience at KFC or Popeye's
author: Kind C.

description:
Night #1: we heard great things about this new bar and I honestly couldn't stay away from a place so hipster in the sunset, so I dragged my non-drinking boyfriend here after dinner one night. The bar was extremely crowded, but we ordered our drinks and were hanging by the bar when 2 servers collided behind us--spilling beer all over our shoes! I had boots on, so it came right off, but my boyfriend had white suede sneakers that definitely were stained. They also didn't offer us any paper towels to clean ourselves off! I had to grab a handful of napkins from the bar while they proceeded to wipe the floors with their towels, completely ignoring us while I was flipping out. Are we invisible? Another customer saw the whole thing and asked if he could buy us a drink which we politely declined. I mean, it wasn't HIS fault. It would've just been nice had the staff apologized and gave us some towels to wipe out shoes since it WAS just an accident. 

Night #2: We decided to give this place a second chance. We waited about an hour for a table (even though estimated wait time was 2 hours) to have some dinner. In the meantime we thought we'd grab a drink at the bar. Wrong. It was so crowded that it was impossible to order, let alone walk to the other end of the bar. We tried multiple areas of the bar and couldn't get any of the bartender's attention. We got yelled at multiple times by servers asking us to "move out of the way" to which I responded "there's nowhere else for us to go!" It was frustrating for them and it was very frustrating for us. We finally got our drinks near the end of the bar where the servers pick up their orders and skedaddled off to a small little corner. When we were finally seated upstairs, the food was mediocre, not memorable, and a little overpriced. We did have an extremely nice and amazing waitress though. She was blonde with shoulder length hair, and she definitely kept the night from being a total disaster. 

Also a tip for this restaurant: add more tables upstairs because there was a lot of empty space that could've been used more wisely. And the bar upstairs is much less busy. Wish we had known.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Too expensive...was my most prevalent thought in the hours after our visit.  The next day too.  
Food was really good and the beer was good. 

Both were overpriced.  $16 for the cheeseburger?  When did beers go for $6 standard?  
I guess it depends on what you're looking for in a place. If you're looking for an authentic place to drink beer and eat and bring your young kids for a reasonable price, this isn't likely your place. 
You're Probably alright with this place if you're cool with BMW's and private schools, but (really!) you're real! (Can't you tell?)
author: Jack D.

description:
Really Good Brewery! 

I was a bit skeptical about going to a brewery in the Sunset. I have lived in the sunset for a very long time and I guess its changing now, and for the better. 

We came here with a group of about 10 friends because a mutual friend was visiting from out of town. The place is HUGE. It is very spacious, has two floors, and very good vibe. 

Don't judge me, but I didn't order any beer. I wasn't really feeling it. Instead I ordered some whiskey with ice. Nothing special, the only thing that could have been better is if they had one large cube of ice instead of many. But I came to a brewery and I guess I deserve this. 

Food. Food is really good. We actually ordered 2 orders of their hot wings. They come in a bowl and you don't get just 6. You probably get about 20 small wings that all taste really good. We also ordered fries, which were nice and crispy. And we ordered some eggplant dish that looked really tasty but I didn't try any. 

About the beer. One of my friends ordered their flight. They make 6 beers from light to dark. 4/6 beers were apparently really good. I tried 3 of them and each of the three were amazing. 

Definitely a place I'd come back to and this place is the best thing on Noriega for big crowds. Check it out!
author: Yevgeniy K.

description: Super cute spot!  It's a little pricey, but I'm liking the change of scenery in the sunset!  I'm no beer connoisseur, but my friend and I enjoyed the flight.  I was happy with my salad, and he was a happy camper with his roasted chicken.
author: Michelle K.

description: A bit slow in writing this, but went here in April and liked the beers. The burger was good if a bit expensive. My wife, who does not like beer, loved their ginger beer, which, of course, is not really beer. Very sweet and very gingery for those who like such things. Like Arnold, I'll be bock.
author: Rich P.

description:
I really want to like Sunset Brewing. I want to root for a good place to hang out in the Sunset. 

Been here 2x. First time just for a beer, which was fine. 2nd time was last night for apps and drinks. We were seated in the dining section, ordered a beer, a cider, Kennebec fries and Buffalo Wings. Our waitress was very nice and said, "sorry, we have no more bread but I've got some water for you and so sorry, I'm serving the water in plastic kid cups." Not 2 minutes later, she brings a bowl of bread out for the table of 4 guys sitting exactly next to us, and brought them out water in regular water glasses. 

Hmm? Weird? Gets weirder. She brings out our drinks - a beer for the hubby in a typical 12oz glass and my cider in a glass that's meant for a drink 7-8oz at most (we have the same exact glass at home). On the menu, the cider is listed as a 10oz serving of cider. I ask the waitress whether this is the right pour and she says,"Oh! I'm sure that's 10oz of cider!" And that's that! I decided not to push it. 

Moral of the story - when you're here (if you so choose to patronize Sunset Brewing) make sure you are getting what you pay for! 

I would love to return but it looks like they have a lot of sloppy kinks to work out.
author: Jo A.

description: 3 1/2 stars really.  Nice spacious space with friendly service.  Friendly menu to suite every palate.  The taste itself is hit or miss.  Poke was excellent.  Oysters frustratingly non existent (too small).  Spinach beet salad good but needing more sourness to the dressing.  The very good but annoying butternut squash soup that had way too many seeds.  Great portabello mushroom burger though!  Really uneven menu.  Prices are slightly on the high side.  Great set up though with two floor seating.
author: Joel M.

description:
Full disclosure: I'm a Sunset boy. Like, if you click on my profile picture, you will see I'm wearing a Sunset shirt. Born and raised, and I still hang out there regularly. My boys and I ordered Purple Dragons from Polly Ann's Ice Cream when it was a hole in the wall in the middle of the block, not its current location on the corner. So I'm confident in saying I got a good vibe of what will work and what won't work in the neighborhood. 

With that said--and it pains me to say this--I don't see the Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company doing terribly well in the long-term unless they make some changes. Particularly regarding the food prices. 

Let me preface this by saying the experience itself was good--no complaints about the quality of food, the service, or the ambiance. Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company (which I will call SRBC for short) just opened a couple of days ago, and they were packed on a Monday night. Cool vibe. 

And given they are a BREWERY, their beer was great. I had the Flight, which gave me a sample of their five beers. I'm an IPA guy, and their Double IPA hit the spot. (My benchmark for IPA is Deschutes' freshly squeezed IPA from Oregon, for those of you wondering about my beer palate). Their wheat beer was pretty unique too, in a good way--it had a sweet aftertaste. So, no complaints about their beer, which is what a BREWERY should be judged on.

BUT! (There's always a but). My complaint is with the food. Or, more specifically, the price of the food. We got flat bread ($11) and mussels ($12), which were OK but nothing special. For our entrees, my friend got the pork loin and I got the chicken dinner--both recommended by our very friendly server (who was great). It's not that the food was terrible--the meat was cooked well (the white meat wasn't dry, which is how I judge how well the chicken was done). It's just that it wasn't anything special. Now, what's the big deal about being special? Well, if you're charging $26 for the pork loin and $20 for the chicken, there better be something special about it--especially in the Sunset. I get it, the neighborhood is starting to attract a different kind of crowd and what not, but I know that location very well: On one corner is a Japanese restaurant that serves heaving portions of food for a relatively cheap price. On the other corner is a Chinese takeout restaurant where you can get a rice plate for $5. Those places are still in business because they know what the local market wants. I understand the SRBC isn't necessarily trying to get that clientele, but the point is, the SRBC's prices are going to be a big turnoff for the locals, if I know anything about the locals (and I do). 

If I had to come up with a comp, it feels like the SRBC wants to be kinda like a fancier "Q", which used to be in the Richmond District before they closed. But "Q" had a pretty distinct identity--and to be fair, the SRBC JUST opened, so this can change. But considering this is a BREWERY, I was a bit disappointed that there wasn't any typical bar fare. No chicken wings. No calamari. No sliders. I suppose SRBC is trying to raise the stakes with higher quality food, but if that food tastes just OK--and is expensive--that isn't a recipe for success in the Sunset. 

Now if this review makes it seem like I'm cheap, let it be known I would pay $2 for a regular chocolate chip cookie from the Devil's Teeth Baking Company, which, from my understanding, has a stake in the SRBC. And I know plenty of people who would balk at paying $2 for a cookie. I'd still argue $26 is high for pork loin from a brewery, but if it was really good, I'd pay it, no questions asked. 

I'd be happy to go back and enjoy a Double IPA, but unless their food game improves--either in deliciousness or price--then I don't envision going back as often as I might. The SRBC has time to make changes and tweaks to improve, and I'm hopeful they will: It would be great to see a place like this thrive in the neighborhood. But unless they make those adjustments, I question its staying power.
author: Chris W.

description:
Can't knock a brew pub setting up shop in the Sunset.  I tried three of the beers and liked two - I did not care for the sessions ale (out of balance and the hoppiness seemed to cover up something that was just off - maybe the yeast stopped or the line was dirty.  I have had a hard time being consistent with my sessions brews, so I give them a pass on this.)

The food was tasty.  I brought my daughter in and she like her food too.  

Staff was young but friendly.  I wonder what it is like when it get crowded?
author: Why N.

description:
cool addition to my 'hood!  seems out of place in certain respects, but that's kinda what's neat about it!

staff: super friendly and helpful.

atmosphere: it's loud (errr, it's a brew pub), but it's a cool space with a great vibe.

wait: you will likely have to wait a bit.  i hate waiting, but this place is worth it.

food: flatbread and shishito peppers were really good.  burger and fries were 
amazing!  my friends got the pork dish (huge and tasty) and the pozole (really good).  i would like to know if they source their food in a responsible manner (will need to find that out).

price: reasonable considering the portion size and quality.  

now the fun stuff!  i feel like my reviews have been getting stagnant, so i decided that i will start quoting some of the things i read in the reviews of this joint...and provide my snarky comments.  fun, right?!?!?!  i think that people forget that these businesses are people's livelihoods, so if they're going to mess with it, at least have some valid reasons for doing so.  (note, i am in no way affiliated with this restaurant)

"Also its crazy busy and I'm not really happy about their location. I dont think they fit in to the neighborhood that well. I feel like this place is more cow hollow or union street... not outer sunset."
-uh, who gives a crap about whether you're happy about their location?  what's it to you?  

"You're Probably alright with this place if you're cool with BMW's and private schools, but (really!) you're real! (Can't you tell?)"
-huh???  judgemental, aren't we?  

"Staff: If you make eye contact with guests coming through the door, greet said guests."
-OR, you could go up to them, and greet them yourself, you prima donna.  

"My issue was solely the food and the menu. Not the taste and flavor of the food- what we ordered was great. but the menu is over priced and pretentious."
-so, let me get this straight, the food tasted good, but it was "pretentious"?  what does that even mean?  was the food speaking in a proper British accent?

"The burger has no veggie option, which is a bummer! Our friends ordered a burger without the patty, and I'll just say it was not good. Gotta get on that veggie burger game."
-okay, so you ordered the burger without, ummm, the burger?  and you're complaining about it?  i ordered a lemonade the other day, but i asked them to leave out the lemons, because i don't like lemons.  it was HORRIBLE...it tasted like sugar water.  2 stars. 

"mission prices in the OUTER sunset. got to be kidding me."
-huh???  no, YOU got to be kidding ME.  how about marina prices in the mission?  or tenderloin prices in russian hill?  or downtown prices in china basin?  didn't realize that prices were based on the area of a place, i thought it was based on stuff, like, you know, the actual items being sold.  

"Dinner for 4 adults with tip came to $280. Felt high."
-ummmm, well what did you order, yo?  usually bills come with an itemized receipt.

"Apparently they only serve food starting at 5. Isn't it supposed  to be family friendly? Families tend to like to eat early. Kids go to sleep early.  You mean I have to go around 8-9 with my daughter in order to be served ?"
-nope, that not what that means; it means that you can go at 5PM to eat, but thanks for redefining what "family-friendly" is supposed to mean for the rest of the world.
author: Miss P.

description: My experience was simply at the bar. They don't have very many beers, and they don't really blow you away, but they weren't terrible either. I was impressed that they actually had a full bar with some pretty good cocktails. The fact that it's in the sunset, and not terribly busy, would give me enough reason to come back for a drink at the very least. I hate places that are too overcrowded, no matter how nice they are. From reading some of the other reviews, it seems the owners and managerial staff might have some work to do, in order to offer better hospitality and customer service, but I can't specifically state that I had a bad experience with my bartender when I was there. It was a cool place. I liked it. I'll be back for the food next time.
author: Eric M.

description:
mission prices in the OUTER sunset. got to be kidding me. im only writing this review because all you hipsters are giving it 5stars when it def isnt 5star. look around this whole area. there is no food at this price. insane.
the starters with the pickled vegetables n oily vegetables, no pickled. olives are olives. almonds are normal. for $14. kidding me. 
beer was fine. not amazing. 
friend got the ginger drink -radio rocket or something. it tasted like licorice. bleh. what ginger. he also dod not like it.

flight, 1 starter, 1 radio drink = about 45$

youve got to be kidding me.

o yeah, and a crazy wait for tables. 2hrs but u have empty tables upstairs...

and they need those buzzy things to let u know when ur table is ready. walkin around asking everyone if they are laura party of 4 isnt workin.
author: just k.

description:
Not one to spend time writing negative reviews, but hopefully this constructive feedback will make its way back to the management. 

After we were seated, we waited over 20 minutes for a server to assist us, then decided it was time to leave (after asking twice for someone to send a server over with no success). Even during the busy dinner rush, it should not take 20 minutes for a server to introduce themselves and take a drink order, at the very least!
author: Kelly M.

description:
Since this place is fairly new, I'll be basing my experience on just that.

Just had their burgers, very good and tasty.
Their pale ale was good too.
The service was excellent, nice people.

I'll be coming back.
author: Edwin L.

description: 4 star warning. Most of the most 4 star reviews are by friends of the owners.  That aside. We came with plenty of tables open and they gave is a 20min wait.
