The line packed out the door with people told a longer waiting time with still open tables.  2 words.  Soft opening.  We ended up leaving because 20 minutes wasn't worth it.  Feel free to let m know when you guys have gotten it together. I'll come back through and see what it's about.
author: Sa V.

description:
Just poor all around. The service, the food, the beer, and the prices - all disappointing.

Bummer.
author: Jon B.

description:
We all wanted to really love this place. A new local place. Great ambiance. Although the service needs much improvement, the wait staff were willing to learn and more than accommodating - but the food - OMG - beyond horrible
Lets start with the Beef - I am not sure the beef is Grass fed or they would have advertised that it was - besides being well done. 
Avocados - Frozen pulp - California is the largest producers of Avocados and these were frozen!
Tomatoes in the salad - Canned - yikes - what happened to fresh!
Fried chicken - pre-battered frozen chicken which was dropped in the fryer and came out black - bad oil with absolutely no meat left! I don't even think the servers would have eaten it if they were asked too.
chicken in the Cobb - pre diced? really
Bacon - pre-cut?
For the price  - they are either paying off the price of the remodel or taking nice salaries - 
I hope they can bring in a consultant and bring in the Fresh, Organic, Non GMO, Grass Fed ingredients which we are leading the rest of the country in! Only then will I be back.
author: Julie J.

description: Great beer, good food, great atmosphere for families. A little pricey, more of a special occasion place for us.
author: Emily W.

description: 1st visit was an ok experience though they just opened so its expected to have a few service hiccups, my wife and I and a friend enjoyed a Sunday afternoon with a beer flight and some pints after :D. My 2nd visit I had lunch here with my brother the sour wheat and the IPA are the stand outs. We split an order of sage fries and honey mustard chicken wings, both were great. Haven't tried any of the entrées yet maybe next time. There are menu changes from lunch to dinner. I've lived in the outer sunset for quite some time so this is a nice addition to the local dive bars scattered in the avenues.
author: Wei W.

description:
The owner of Devil's Teeth have done it again.  Great food, great beer, and a great place for the people of the Sunset to hang out.  

Ambiance and service: i came a few times with my wife and son, who is 2 years old, they served us quickly and surprisingly knew we needed, high chair, plastic spoons, extra napkins, and served the food to ensure the little guy didn't pull things into his lap.  We have trouble finding places to eat that get the struggles of trying to eat with a little one, this place got it.

Beer: Had the wheat beer, refreshing, had an interesting sour finish, loved it so much I got it each time, sorry don't know about the other beers, but my friends had the stout and IPA and they were very happy.

Food:  The beer braised pork is awesome. I have had something like this when spending some time in Bavaria, its great to scratch that itch.  Great for me as I am trying to move away from red meats, just waiting for studies to say red meat is not that bad for you, just like eggs.
The bolognese has comfort food written all over it and is a decent portion.
author: todd m.

description: Don't come here! I live in the neighborhood and this place is amazing. But it's way too far from the city so don't bother driving all the way out here. The dry Irish stout that is better than anything I've ever had in Ireland is not worth the trip. Trust me. I wouldn't just be saying this just so I don't have to wait in line. I wouldn't do that to you. Nope.
author: Levi H.

description: We came in at the right time on a Friday night before the rush. Beers were quite good as was the pasta bolognese. Our server, Lewis T. was very good and took great care of us. Best service we've had in a while.
author: Nick K.

description: The ambiance and drinks were good. But horrible service; it took almost 20 min to clean up the table when the waiters/waitresses are just walking around. We had to walk up to one of them to clean the table.
author: Jessica L.

description: Great place, drinks and food fab
author: Sheigla M.

description: Sat down around 750 on a Wednesday, someone finally took our drink order at 815. While the food was not bad , (nothing to trade the farm for either) the service and nonplussed attitude of some staff members leaves much to be desired. Beer was okay, need to figure basics of running a restaurant. Also saw a profane altercation between staff and customer, this kept us entertained while waiting for our beers.
author: Ryan M.

description: This place SUCKS!! I can't even begin to tell u what I had to go through for just a to-go order.. I waited 10minutes for the bartender to look for plastic forks for him to tell me they had no more, I had to check my 4 fish and chip order which they forgot all the tartar sauces, then the kitchen put the salad separate but put them on the top of the bag so all the hot food wilted it, then all the prices on their website were cheaper and hadn't been updated so they were trying to charge me more $$ and I had to argue with him that it's not my fault they didn't update it and they need to honor those prices.. had I paid the prices they were trying to charge me , the portions were not worth it. I finally had to tell the manager about running a restaurant and that she needs to make sure people update pricing, order forks and stock the bar, and tell the kitchen to stack cold food on the bottom and then make sure everything is going out with the food! I felt like I was at work for a Togo order! Never again
author: Nory M.

description: This review is delayed by a few months.  Food and beer is good but I lowered the rating because of the attitudes of two bartenders on a QUIET weekday night at the restaurant. First bartender was annoyed with helping me choose which beer to try.  It wasn't like I was being indecisive (ex: um, hmm, um, let's see) but I am not familiar with their brews. The second bartender was annoyed with helping me close my tab.  Again, food and beer was good...service sucked.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Let's call this an almost 5. Great service. Surprisingly outstanding food. As it's are related to Devil's Teeth Bakery, the baked goods are among the best I've had in the city. I had the prawns for my entree. Again, a delight to find such a well-thought out dish in SF. Giant prawns were served European-style with full heads and tails on. My son had the kids' cheeseburger. He described it as "juicy". A notable comment, given he's 8. His fries were perfect. I checked ;-).

The main drawback is that I wouldn't expect to pay quite so much in a brewery. In a higher-end restaurant, sure. I'd love to come back here often. It's close to my Ocean Beach 'hood, and I look forward to checking out other menu items. Wines too. The small  wine list has some great selections. But for a brewery/sports pub-style spot, I've got more budget-friendly options. But I'll for sure be back for more special occasions.

Overall, really friendly service, outstanding food, delicious wines, and a great atmosphere. Really glad it's here. Maybe a lower-priced bar menu would help my willingness to make it a more regular stop? Or, go full in and make it a high-end Sunset dining spot? Perhaps we could use one out here ;-)
author: Chris M.

description: Just had the worse bartender in the history of restaurants. I don't relish criticizing service but this one deserves it. It was June 18, 2016 at 1pm. I sat at the bar and ordered a mimosa with 70% champagne and 30% orange juice on top. I told him it didn't taste right and the glass was half an inch shy of the top of the glass. It said it made no difference. I said it did. We argued back and forth about 3 times. Finally, he made a mimosa in front of me. It still wasn't right cuz he didn't mix up the fresh orange juice in the tall container. I ordered a cheeseburger which was way smaller than when they opened. The burger came and I had no utensils. I was to ask the bartender who was way down at the other end of the bar. He should have provided me with utensils at the time of my order which he did for my neighbors. It was a good thing that the basket of wrapped utensils was just on the other side of the bar. All in all, it was a miserable experience.  Won't be back. G.
author: Gladys K.

description: Interior spacious and inviting. Portion of the food is generous. Taste Of food is good. Beer is good.  Bar Service poor. Sunday early evening before the crowd hits, 3 people working at bar and no service. One big guy shot a menacing stare at us for trying to get his attention bc he's probably thinking we are rude. Really? He was chatting and we were Standing there for at least 10 mins. We finally ordered from the younger guy which seems better. We manage to grab a side table and decided to order food. My husband stands at the bar waiting and waiting again and sees a taller guy. He tries to talk to him but he keeps staring at the ground. With beer in hand my husband asks the top of his head if we order food from bartenders or if there are designated waiters. Also if we can get a menu. He actually spoke and told him that he can order from bar but not from him personally and walks away. What is he doing behind the bar if he's not working and how hard is it to Hand a patron a menu. It's obvious he isn't going to order a beer. Wow! Conclusion: Bar staff lack of multi tasking and people skills. This place gets 3 stars because I really really want to like this place.
author: Ellen T.

description: Great new place to spend a foggy afternoon in the neighborhood. Can't go wrong with the peppers and a few double IPAs.
author: Mark O.

description: Went here last night for dinner and had a great time. You get bread butter on the table. Fried chicken was good with the red sauce. Pork chop was ok good flavor but a little dry. The shrimp was very fresh and they keep the head of shrimp which was awesome. Only gripe I had was the sauce on the shrimp dish was a bit salty. Ahi poke was good also. Kids meals are pretty big portion. Atmosphere is good a bit loud inside but surprisingly you would never know walking by outside. Good decent restaurant in the neighborhood would definitely recommend.
author: Larry L.

description: Love this new addition to the neighborhood! The mussels/chorizo & the shishito peppers are delicious - the double IPA is my favorite, but try the flight first! Bartenders are really nice and add to the laid back vibe. Was originally sad to hear the mercado was closing, but this brewery is great! The interior design is really beautiful, too, especially paired with all the natural light.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Hooray for Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company (SRBC) - I can tell from other reviews that just about EVERYONE who lives anywhere near here is glad this place has opened. I have waited desperately for a place like this for almost 20 years......

Went tonight for the first time, arrived about 5:45pm. Great decor, reclaimed wood wall behind the bar, exposed industrial look, modern, fresh. Complete opposite of the tired look most of the remainder of Noriega St. businesses present. Good thing we arrived early, because within an hour it was bursting at the seams. Fantastic vibe and energy. We sampled beers and snacks first (olives and chili almonds). Lighter beers (wheat, blonde and  double IPA) were our favorites. Consistent with the styles of beer we like other places as well. The snacks were fine, but not yet as good as they can be. My wife had a Martian Ranch Syrah after finishing the beer tasting, and we both thought it was excellent. I had a full pint of the Blonde, probably my favorite of the beers.

Our server took great care of us, despite the place being a madhouse. I am sure it will quiet down as SRBC gets settled in. My wife and I split a Reservoir salad and burger. Loved the burger. Although we didn't quite figure it out at the time due to animated conversation, our salad (butter lettuce, mango, avocado, palm hearts, pistachio), was missing the hearts of palm and dressing! We did mention in passing to our server that the salad seemed "off", and it was removed from the check without question. We will have it again next time and pay more attention!

We finished off with bread pudding. Generally not my favorite, but I was really pleased with this one. Not too sweet, not soggy, it was just right. Given that one of the owners is from the Devil's Teeth Bakery, I suppose that isn't too surprising!

Price? As expected in San Francisco. Quality and nice decor costs more. Always, and everywhere. You simply don't get a steak for the price of a hot dog, no matter how much you may want it.
author: Ernest C.

description: Great food with nice portion for lunch and reasonable priced. A very nice addition to our neighborhood.
author: Susan E.

description: We were not impressed. The beer was decent. The food was ok. The service was poor. We came for lunch and had a flight. I would have enjoyed a broader selection. It was hoppy, hoppier and hoppiest. The wings were average but a good portion! We notified our server that the bun on our chicken sandwich was stale. It was almost crunchy and was falling apart. She didn't seem to care. We were not offered a substitute or even as much as a "that's too bad." When I spend over 45$ for lunch I expect excellent service. There are way too many great breweries to return here again. Sorry.
author: Mellissa B.

description: The reservoir salad is so tasty with mango, Palm hearts, pistachios, avocado and butter lettuce!  The scallops and roasted corn are delicious!  So happy to have a trendy place in our hood!
author: Angelene B.

description: This is a great place to grab a refreshing beer or other beverage and a great meal.  Great staff!
author: Michael P.

description: Full disclosure... I'm a Sunset Girl and I love this place!  It rocks!!!  Went here opening night with my husband for date night.  It is located on Noriega near 25th Avenue, next door to Noriega Teriyaki House.  This new hot spot boasts lots of space, wooden bar area and an upstairs area with more seating.  Oh.. and they serve beer!!  We each had the beer sampler.  My favorites were Blonde and Rye Amber.  We also ordered the meat and cheese plate.  I loved the loukanika sausage and the country  pate.  This place is such a WELCOME CHANGE  TO THE NEIGHBORHOOD especially to the Outer Sunset!!  I work in the FiDi and the prices for this place are about right.  And yes, one is not too far from places serving heaping portions of greasy, salty food at cheap prices.  But how much of the same thing can you have??  I see success for Sunset Reservoir Brewing Co.  Why? Because it's different, the ambiance is nice, the food is so far good... and they serve beer! I love the vibe and can't wait to go back.  TIP:  I recommend people take Uber or Lyft to this place.  Parking is not that easy to find AND if you go with friends you'll find yourself having a great time and drunk.  So, better to pay someone drive you and your friends home.  :)
author: Vespa V.

description: Domingo! My family and I came to try out the brewery's Sunday brunch the chilaquiles had a wonderful flavor and great texture, a little hint of spice -- just right. The arroz con leche exceeded all expectations, as good as anywhere south of the border. All of this of course is well complimented by a bloody Maria (basically a Bloody Mary with tequila instead). This meal is a must!
author: Marshall A.

description: Came here on a Thursday around 5:15ish and it was still fairly slow. The decor is hip, urban and reminiscent of a hipster bar you would see in the Mission/Dogpatch. Ordered the sour wheat, which was light and a little tart. It was yummy! Tried a sip of the brown ale, which was flavorful but not too bold. Order the hummus, fries, mussels and burger. The hummus was declious being paired with the warm pita bread. Loved the mussels but it was very small sized. The soup base for the mussel was buttery and a tiny hit of garlic, which made for a good dip with bread. The burger was delicious! Overall, I enjoyed the food and ambiance but it was a bit pricey.
author: Rosanna T.

description: Like the food recently. But the douche of a host dude is way too much of a jerk. You shouldn't cringe after someone utters just a few words. My few words to him...attitude and for what reason????
author: Chris C.

description:
Great spot for after work or with the family.  I have been here twice and was very impressed with the variety/quality of the food and the drink availability.  Full bar with many options for liquor and beer on tap.  Some of the beer is malt-based (eg English IPA), so you should be into that, but I was impressed and great to have a spot out in the Sunset with beer straight from the source!

First time I was there, I ordered the burger - contains guacamole and is well-done unless if you request otherwise.  Very juicy and tasty burger with a boatload of fries.  A bit small for $16, but I suppose that is becoming more common in such an expensive city.  Would certainly recommend if you don't mind the price.

Second time I was there with a friend from work and ordered the pasta bolognese.  It was around the same price as the burger, but portion-wise gave a lot more.  I can take down a lot, but I was definitely full by the time I finished.

Will definitely go here again - easy to park right after work!
author: Brian C.

description: Went here with a friend a couple of months ago. The ambiance is fairly nice, but there's not much by way of a local feeling atmosphere, which is a shame because community is why I live in the Sunset and not down town. We enjoyed the beer, especially the sour wheat and the stout; no problems with service, however, the food was way too expensive! This place is 3 blocks from my house, but I haven't been back. I won't pay that much for a burger, (even if it's organic and ethically farmed...because I can make that, or get it for a bit less elsewhere...and let's face it...a $16 burger?! Ok...) and the atmosphere isn't quite what I'm looking for in a local neighborhood bar. Overall I think Sunset Reservoir brewing co. is there to cater to the new influx of affluent techies, not local natives.
author: Liz R.

description:
I think they nailed their concept:  sunset family restaurant and brewery. Families (esp those living nearby) will love it. Others may not understand the draw. 

My wife loved her food, I thought mine was average. Beer is good but not good enough to be considered a destination. 

Dinner for 4 adults with tip came to $280. Felt high. 

Family restaurant at date night location prices.
author: John B.

description:
We live in the Inner Sunset and are always looking for new casual places to eat, especially breweries. And very much want them to succeed. So, I'm hoping this place either just had a bad night, or gets better soon.

Upon walking in, my 7 yr old daughter started walking up the steps into the dining area and I quickly asked her to come back. As she was walking back, she slightly got in the way of one of the staff. I politely said "Excuse us" and he didn't look up or even acknowledge us.

The hostess arrived in short order, was polite and we were quickly seated. 

As an app, we ordered Wings and received a bowl of the "wing" part of the wings, not the mini-drumsticks. I'm not a wing expert, but every other time I've had wings, you get both parts in equal number. The wings were fair in taste, but very small and very little meat. However, the blue cheese dressing was not in short supply and with large chunks of cheese. Had we only had thick wings to pour it over.

My wife enjoyed her Sea Bass, but just coming off a dozen years as a vegetarian, she didn't have much to compare it to. I tasted it, and it was dry and a bit more fishy than Sea Bass I've had at finer establishments. At $24 I would have expected better. 

My roasted chicken was a fairly ample helping, but the skin looked plastic and tasted the same. The meat was fairly moist, but tasteless. The cauliflower was a bit too hard, the beans were listed on the menu as "string beans", but were a mixture of green and waxed beans, and were tough. Overall, not at all worth the $20.

Off the kids menu, my daughter got pasta with red sauce, in a smallish bowl for $9. If we'd paid $4, it would have been fair. And it was unusually (temperature) hot. My son's fried fish plate looked great. The salad was large, the fries were the best thing we had. But the fish was "Mushy" according to him, and looked to be pretty greasy. When he asked for vinegar for his fish, the waitress responded with "we don't have any", yet the salad was drenched in vinegar. I'd say if you're going to offer a battered fish, offer vinegar. Something even my 12 yr old is aware of.

In terms of the beer, I'm an IPA fan, to a fault. But, have not had an "English IPA" and gave it a try. Not at all hoppy, citrusy, or creamy the way I'd hoped. It was fairly flat, warm and I can't say I ever leave a beer on the table, but this one got left. I asked to try the Extra Pale Ale and was brought a small glass. IMHO, a bit flavorless. But the big issue, was I had over half a glass of beer in front of me, asked to try something else, and my server (who was otherwise pleasant) didn't once ask if I wasn't satisfied with my beer. Any other brewery I've been to, would have asked if I like it and offered something as a replacement.

I sincerely hope this place gets it together. It would be great to have another go-to brewery in the neighborhood as an alternate for Social Kitchen and Magnolia. The place has a great aesthetic, beautiful vaulted wood ceiling, great looking bar, and ample seating. 

My beer issue might have just been my aversion to the English version of the IPA. But, the food was on the low end in the taste department and at a premium price. Two kids meals, two adult meals, one beer and two sodas sets us back over $90 before tip. I'm going to keep checking the reviews... I'd love to give this place another shot, but not until I'm sure they've made an improvement.
author: Dustin S.

description: I have been there twice since they opened and am headed back tonight for some more great food and brews! The burger is fantastic, loved the sourwheat brew, also grilled paquillo peppers are the best, watch the sneaky spicy ones!! Great people, making tasty food, with excellent drinkable craft beers, what could be better for the sunset?!
author: Chelsea J.

description: We had a great brunch today with our daughter. While the beer is good, not necessarily excellent, the food is bomb. We got the breakfast sliders and the blte sandwiches for ourselves and the french toast for our daughter (did we mention that they provided us with crayons, a children's menu to color on, and a covered water cup?), and we were kind of embarrassed by how quickly we HOUSED it. I highly recommend this for families who want to hang at a good brewery with great food to boot.
author: Kate W.

description: Unremarkable beer ... IPA lacked hops. So underwhelming that we left before we got to the food menu. Not sure what the recent articles saw...
author: Caitlin D.

description: Both the hostess and waitperson were attentive and good service. The menu changes every season as I was told, so don't expect you can find the same dish from the yelp's picture album. The price and quality of food are reasonable. However, they need to update the furniture, all the chairs are wood and hard broad at the booth with no cushion and that's very uncomfortable when trying to enjoy dinner with friends. One last thing, there are only three restaurants in the block but finding street parking is horrible at dinner time.
author: C K.

description: I like to come here for their fries during happy hour with the orange cream dip they pair it with and it's so good! I haven't tried their beer yet since I prefer light beers but one day I will. Service was hard to receive when you're not at the bar but the seats behind it and there wasn't even anyone else to serve.
author: Mandy M.

description: Big, beautiful, modern space, great beer (I had the sour wheat and a guest brown), the fries are good (and come out quickly, as did the rest of our food--almost fast food quickly)...just a bit let down that the Sunday brunch Mexican burger was underseasoned and bland. Was hoping it would be on par with Pistos' burger, but, nope.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Food: 4/5
Wings were tasty and the chicken sandwich was good.

Beer: 3.5/5
The IPA was solid.

Service: 3/5
We went on Sunday at 2pm, and there were several wait staff with just a few tables of people. Service started out fine, until the end of our meal when we asked for the check. After putting the card on the table we sat there several more minutes as wait staff passed us by a few times without a glance, and finally I had to get up and walk the check up to the register myself. We also got our own box to pack our leftovers, as nobody was following up after we got the check and were clearly getting ready to leave.

If the prices were cheaper I wouldn't nitpick about service, but at this price point they should be more on top of it.
author: Erin Y.

description: Eh. Came here for a friends birthday, everything is overpriced and extremely mediocre. I got the mac and cheese and it was not good, looks great but tastes very bland and watery. My boyfriend got the steak and also mediocre, especially for paying 30$ for it. However the fries and the beer is good and service is pretty good but they didn't even comp a drink or sing happy birthday or bring anything out for the birthday girl, extremely disappointing given that we spent 400$ total. Probably won't come back or if we do definitely with a smaller group and not getting food.
author: Milla K.

description: Great food. Mussels were tasty, pozole was flavorful. Don't understand why it's called a brew co when there's more wine available. Nice date spot but a little pricey.
author: Bryce W.

description: Good Service and atmosphere. Great place to meet and just hang out. Wings are good. Entrees too salty and oily so 3 stars.
author: Jane N.

description:
WOW!  Wow!.....Wow! 

Where to start...

The interior is spacious and  inviting with brew tanks visible through glass in the back.  The ground floor offers  a choice of booths for food and a big bar... upstairs tables for larger parties and you guessed it..a bar.  2 bars.  Fantastic!  

The beer crisp and fresh for my liking, but a creamy and delicious irish stout is offered with a spectrum in between...order the beer sample to choose your favorite!   

The menu is varied and fresh, with age old favorites like burger and fries, abundant local salads, pasta.. but you'll also find a fantastic flatbread appetizer , oysters and a braised pork shank cooked to perfection!  Top it off with the best citrus tart I've ever tasted.

Kid friendly to boot!

Welcome to the Neighborhood Sunset Brewing Co.
author: Heather b.

description:
We were back this evening and although the place seemed just as busy, the service and food were right on point. Our service staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and the food was cooked just right. My husband had the burger again and this time it was perfectly pink. Our party also had the roast chicken and the pan-fried trout, both also delicious. Dessert was fantastic, as to be expected; we had the chocolate cake again and this time added the pear galette, which was also cooked to perfection with the pear sweet and still al dente and not mushy. 

The SRBC is definitely now our neighborhood favorite. We can't wait until our college kids come home so we can take them there.
author: Sandra E.

description: We were tired of dinning at Mom's and pa's Chinese kitchens...Finally a cool place, with terrific beers and dishes , at decent prices IN THE SUNSET ! Bravo.
author: Pierre F.

description:
Went to the Reservoir last Saturday to check out a brewery in the Sunset district.  The place is very modern and high tech with a lot of natural wood materials.  Unfortunately, San Francisco was in the midst of a heat wave and the upstairs seating was unbelievably hot.  Luckily, my group was seated downstairs near the open door.

Started the experience with a nicely priced $10 drink at the bar before getting seated for the meal.  The Reservoir then started to show they still have growing pains.  The waitress must have been new and took our drink orders at different times so, three flights came to three different people at three different times.  Also, for our table of seven, four meals came first then the remaining three came much later.  The food came so late that the half the table finished before the other half got their food.  

I think they recognized the huge error because we got better service, plates being removed timely, and more attention as we waited for the last three entrees and as we finished our food.  The manager (I think she was) came and personally served those last three plates.  

The Reservoir got back a star because they didn't charge us for all desserts.  And those desserts were very delicious.  Nothing wrong there.

Overall, the beer as just ok, the food was about even, with half of the plates better than average and half was ok too.  I think I would go back but just give them a little time to perfect the service, beer and the kitchen.  Why not, it is a brewery in the Sunset district.
.
author: Victor S.

description: Overpriced for everything, especially the sub-par food. Oh, and the bartender who will hit on your significant other as you stand and watch. Extremely unprofessional. The beer is decent, i liked the stout. But won't be back due to asshole behind the bar.
author: Cliodhna R.

description: So excited to have this in the neighborhood, but would make it a regular stop even if it wasn't nearby. Family-friendly and nice servers. We loved the fries, reservoir salad, mussels, the beer (double IPA especially) and the St. George and the Dragon cocktail.
author: Carrie H.

description: This place is pretty disappointing. It has so much potential. The space is giant with nice decor and good service. But the food is incredibly disappointing. It's like the owners got lost on their way to opening a brew house on fisherman's wharf. The burger is roughly denny's quality, with low quality meat and kraft cheese. It's pretty unforgivable. Even if they lowered their prices by half, I'd still consider the burger a total let down. However, this place still seems to have brisk business, so hopefully someone with a clue steps in saves this place before everyone figures out how terrible the food is.
author: SFA M.

description: I came here last night with a dear friend I had not seen in years. We were talking our heads off and our waitperson was extremely kind,calm and patient about it. In fact all of the employees we came in contact with were very friendly and polite.  Now the food- we had the heirloom tomato salad and it was delicious! Next we had the hummus and sabal with flatbread- the hummus mixture was wonderful but the flatbread was stale. Then we had the scallops which were perfect! All around a great experience
author: Moira M.

description: When we walked through the door we were completely ignored. We were finally sat and brought menus. The server was very nice and attentive. The food was solid. We'll be back.
author: Paula B.

description: This is a really super cool place...love the design...love the food and the price....I will be back with some family coming to town for a visit.
author: Richard G.

description: I was so happy to find a brewery in my new neighborhood, especially one with so many positive reviews.  What a disappointment!  Service was awful, food was bland, and the beer tasted sour and poorly maintained.  I've been to many breweries around the area and this is by far the worst.  Stay away!
author: Richard R.

description: We were a difficult table due to the fact that everyone showed up at different times. They worked with us and made everyone feel comfortable.  The beer is terrific and the heirloom salad was fresh and presented well.   Fried Chicken could have used a breast or couple of wings but delicious as well.   Noreiga needs a brewery!
author: Chris D.

description: When I first walked in I noticed all the built in wooden booths.  They looked about as comfortable as a church pew.  Luckily there was a table with chairs available.  I had the burger for $16.  It came with bacon, cheese and onions.  I don't care for those items so I got it without.  The burger and fries were good.  For $16 I expect they be GREAT.  I don't know why they don't charge for a basic burger than charge additional for bacon and cheese like most places do.  I can get a Bill's Buger at Bill's Place for $8.50 and it is just as good.  The price point is too high for the neighborhood, by the time you add a soft drink, tax and tip - $25.
author: Margot M.

description: Sunset Reservoir is a solid neighborhood place. Several beers brewed on premise are available from lagers to IPAs to stouts/porters. The menu also is unique with several interesting with several carnivore and herbivore options. There is also a lunch menu if you can stop by for a little day drinking. Cheers!!!
author: Randall H.

description:
The place is a great option in the outer sunset- it has pleasant ambiance, kid-friendly food, and a small, but tasty menu. my only negative comment is that most of the food we ordered was very spicy, and while i'm happy with spicy, it became too much when literally every dish that wasn't on the kids menu was hot!

the bloody mary i had was also spicy, but quite delicious!
we'll be back!
author: Adelie P.

description:
Beautiful space, really good beer, exceptional food for a brewpub.

Had a great experience at SRBC. We came for dinner with a large party and got seated upstairs at a big round table that was comfy for all of us. Service was friendly and prompt, and the food was surprisingly good (and varied) for a brewpub. Most importantly, I thought the beer was terrific - I had the rye amber and it was very good, full-bodied without being either too wimpy or too heavy. Great warm-weather beer. We had a couple of wine drinkers in the group who brought bottles with them, and the wait staff dealt well with that. 

I'd go back in a heartbeat and would recommend it to anyone looking for fun, casual, good food and drink.
author: Beverley C.

description: Beer is non-exciting even when they make it in house. Nice environment and friendly staff. Hot wings were excellent one night...then totally mediocre the next. Fish and chips are a winner.
author: JP S.

description: Nice atmosphere, great food. But I came in a group and the waitress said she couldn't split our tab onto more than 2 cards. She eventually relented and let us use just 3 cards, but said we should keep this in mind for the future and plan accordingly. I mean, seriously? Is there a reason or are they just trying to discourage big groups?
author: Lucy M.

description: Still finding their sea legs at a brewpub which thinks it's in downtown but really is in the heart of a Chinese neighborhood in the sunset. Service is slow, the food is mediocre and beers hoppy and bitter. The interior space is nicely designed with an open concept. Staff should be more friendly to patrons, not act elitist.
author: Michelle O.

description: Food tasted good, service was fast, but pricing is a little inflated. I'd try it again.
author: Aly S.

description: Fun place to be to watch games! Good food! Excellent bartenders! But if you plan to come to watch a game and snag a seat. Come hours ahead. The place gets packed!
author: Gabriella T.

description: So yummy and nice! We had the BLTE - blt on sourdough with a fried egg - holy cow good! Also, heirloom tomato salad and grilled veggie sandwich great. Enjoyed the pale ale and mexican brown ale and bread pudding for dessert. Nice ambience - seems like it would be fun to hang out here in the evening!
author: Lena C.

description: Love this place. A great neighborhood gem in the Sunset. I live walking distance away from this place so I've gone enough times to see the menu go thru seasonal changes. I've never had a bad experience. The only reason for the 4 out of 5 stars for me is they took away my favorite from the menu. Grrr. It was the mussels in a broth with chrorizo, cilantro. It was so good I would order it as an app while waiting for main dish. The burger is good, the fried chicken dish is good too. Fries, yum. Beer, yum. :)
author: Juan C.
Jennifer O.

description: Loved it.  Finally a place in Sunset with good food. I'm a beer snob and the beer definitely passed.  My wife is a food snob and the food definitely passed. We will come back!
author: Peter O.

description: Crappy service, whatever beer. Had high hopes for this spot cuz we live in the area. We went for my husband's bday. Food was fine, but beer was nothing special. Social Kitchen & Brewery has way more interesting beer. The service came with a high attitude toll -- as in douchey, too cool for school bullshit that makes SF natives like me cringe. Who do these people think they are? They chased us out by slamming chairs on top of a tables all around us. No one came over to give us a heads up that it was close to closing time. They just blasted Beyoncé to drive us out the door. This place is not worth the attitude. There are other quality spots in the neighborhood that know how to treat their customers right. This place is clueless. Take the hipster BS to another neighborhood. Would rather see another pho place open up here.
author: Troy E.

description: So I live around the corner from this place and was excited to see it finally open. It's nice to be able to walk to a restaurant other than Chinese food now. I have not dined in yet but called to place a to go order and was told that they do not do to go orders normally, unless they aren't busy. So the person that answered the phone checked with the manager and said I could place the order for pick up. Ordered their burger and fries both were very good but $16 for a burger cmon! I definitely think that's way overpriced. Other than that the restaurant is brand new looks beautiful inside. I will dine in soon or go have some drinks, they have a full bar and are open late ;) but because of the menu prices I will not be a regular.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I have/had high hopes for a restaurant at this location. Went on a Sunday (Mexican food day). Unfortunately it's some of the worst food I've had in a long time. Entree was salty to the point of almost being inedible. Stale chips and under-ripe avocados used in the flavorless guacamole. Three stars for service and ambiance, and because it's still new.  I hope they fix the food/quality/price ratio... 1 beer, 1 mixed drink, two lunch entrees $50+.  Sorry, not worth it at all.

*Update
Kudos to the owner that reached out to me about my experience. With her earnest attempt to understand what happened, I have faith that the kinks will soon be worked out.
author: Gingersnappy T.

description: Great neighborhood place. But  won't turn up sound on games even if it is the finals.  Come on. Making bank due to game.   Think again.  You miss the pitch.  Don't strike out
author: Kathy B.

description: We have been here twice. First time, we came for lunch and were underwhelmed but decided to give them another shot for brunch. I had their breakfast sliders with egg, bacon, avocado, onion and jalapeno jelly. The biscuit got really soggy really fast and I could barely pick it up. The jalapeno jelly was strange - didn't add anything to the dish. Potatoes were not good at all. My husband got the eggs benedict. Instead of an english muffin, they do a slightly larger version of the biscuit - it's totally rich and didn't pair well with the egg, canadian bacon and rich sauce. My husband commented that the egg was cooked well, bacon was really good and the sauce was also done well. If they'd served with a normal english muffin, I'm sure he would have liked it. With that heavy, buttery muffin, he couldn't even get through it and felt ill afterwards. The server was nice, although slow, and it was expensive. Oh, and the mimosa I had was flat. I mentioned it and she brought me another that was also flat. We won't be coming back.
author: Kathleen D.

description: Beer-so so. Service - horrible. It was not busy when we arrived, and there was very few people trying to order at the bar. We waited for a few minutes one end of the bar to get some beer. No one talked to us so we moved closer to the middle. The three male bartenders continued to ignore us and continued to wipe glasses instead. We called for their attention and tried to ask for advice since it was our first time there. The first bartender refused to talk to us and called someone else over as he went back to cleaning glasses. The second bartender was very abrupt when we were trying to describe what we usually like to drink. The beer was mediocre, so after one round, we left.  Never coming back as this was the worst service I have experienced in a long time and it was not even busy.
author: Marilyn O.

description: Food and drinks are good... Prepare to wait as they get the hang of volume of business...
author: Minna M.

description: The owner contact me and we are wiling to try this place out AGAIN. I hope we can finally get inside and eat.
author: Claudio L.

description: So Happy to have this place in our neighborhood! The beer is good, great atmosphere, we ordered their peppers, a flight, and burger,and stout chocolate cake and loved everything. Service was on point. We went back a few night later for drinks and it did take a while but hey they were Packed!
author: staci H.

description: Good collection of beers and nice place to watch sports too
author: Ramraj G.

description: A great neighborhood restaurant that's not only kid friendly but has a good selection of libations!  The service is excellent, friendly, and very accommodating!  The food is good too - especially the desserts!
author: Sidney D.

description: Excellent place! Beer tasting is great and food was amazing, including desserts! Deco of the place is very nice as well and the service was great overall. Must try this place, highly recommended.
author: Adriana A.

description:
Cool decor but that was about the extent it.  Food was overpriced, under portioned and mediocre flavor.
Cant comment on beer since I didn't try any.
author: Patricia A.

description:
3.5 stars would be my honest assessment. 
I immediately liked the faux-rustic, cavernous space that, on the afternoon we went, admitted a generous amount of natural light. One half of the ground floor is bar space, the other table seating. There's also a crow's nest section. I must say, the reception was enthusiastic, the host seating us (a young, slim Asian) stuck around several minutes to chat and find out what part of town we lived in. I wish she'd been our server, because she was very nice.
I ordered a flight of five beer samplings to get a sense in one fell swoop I guess of what this brewery was all about. Of the five, the stout, the blonde and the Double IPA stood out. I've never understood the appeal of sour beers, however we were told that the sour element (yeast?) had been brought from a sister venture located elsewhere in the Sunset. My girlfriend ordered the Sayulita Sunset, a juicy tequila concoction, that was a tad sugary but overall decent.
The primary failing and disappointment of our visit was that the cured meat flatbread dish, although served fairly promptly, arrived cold. Otherwise, a generous portion was afforded, and would have been a true winner if hotter. While not specified as a stand alone side, we asked for and got an order of fries. These tasted fine. In way of food, all we really wanted the afternoon we came was something to wash down with beer, otherwise the small menu offers finer culinary prospects. If we return it will have been the beer that brought us, and my overall ranking of that is: decent. I'm not sure I could pinpoint any unique flavors, though one of the beers that was described as having flower and honey elements did smell rewardingly of those.
author: Brian G.

description:
This place is such a welcome addition to the Sunset!  Great neighborhood vibe with food and drinks that make it a destination place, too.  I've been 4 times - dinner for 2, dinner for 9, dinner for 4, and lunch for 2.  Service has always been friendly and welcoming.  There is a wait sometimes, but never has it been awful, and they're very up front about the wait times (though we didn't wait as long as they quoted).  

The food is fabulous.  The burger is one of the top burgers in the city, the fries, too.  The house-made flatbread with hummus and sambal is almost perfect.  The polenta with the roast chicken is spectacular - creamy polenta, just the right consistency and texture, with a nice chili kick on the chicken.  The chicken torta was delicious, with great flavor but hard to pick up to eat (dove in with a fork and knife).  Only small mis-step I've seen was the chile - great flavor but the beans needed more time to cook.  Overall, definitely a place to look forward to eating. 

Our two young kids also enjoyed their food - there is a kids' menu with good choices.

The drinks have all been wonderful, too.  The beer is fabulous, and the brewmaster has come by to check up on that.  Friendly guy who will chat you up about the beer and the process.  He even showed a couple folks the brewing facilities in the back.  All the beers I've tried were great, but my favorite is the amber - deep flavor, refreshing, and great finish.  It's tough to move away from that one to try the rest!

So glad to have this in our 'hood.  Proof that we need more options in the mid-sunset area!
author: Garth G.

description: Great food and beer. Just wish they had more beer varieties! Chicken wings are extradoinary
author: Nik R.

description:
Super excited to have this place in the sunset. 
I've been looking forward for it to open.
The place is beautiful with a full bar and good beer.
However I really wish they would change up their food offerings.
The food was just ok at best. Why can't they offer more seafood and casual food. I don't care a bout the price just please step up the food game.
author: Mike B.

description: I have been here several times and I am very impressed with the service and the quality of the food. Had a retirement dinner there last night and everyone was pleasantly surprised with their dinner and the attentiveness of the server. A hidden gem in the Sunset!
author: Matt S.

description:
Decided to check this place out with my sister in law and her family.  We had a lovely time. The decor is amazing.  

I'm not a beer drinker, (however, my sister in law is quite the beer aficionado) so I had a couple Moscow Mules.  They were delicious and I HIGHLY recommend you try one. The bartender was friendly and polite and got our drinks to us in about 2 minutes flat, and they were slammed!

I love that this restaurant is family-friendly. As a mother of a small toddler, it is quite difficult to find restaurants and establishments that really mean it when they say they are family-friendly. 

I've been telling all my friends about this place and will definitely be back!
author: Dina H.

description: Just had Christmas Eve dinner with my family here. The staff was very friendly. The atmosphere was cozy but cold. The food was okay. The best thing we ate were the mac and cheese balls (also ordered the burger and fried chicken, which were average at best). The portions are huge. No refills on soda. This place could be better for how much you pay. Overall, your average hipster brew pub. Not sure if I'd come back again or even recommend it to friends and family.
author: Michelle D.

description: Usually, this is my go-to place for our of town visitors, but not tonight. I know they were a little busy, but they weren't very welcoming tonight, and I felt it better to leave with my friends for a better dining experience.
author: Andrew M.

description: I've been to SRBC 5 times now.  It's getting better every time I go.  My 5 star review should be coming soon!!!
author: M G.

description:
NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY. Heard there was this new business in the neighborhood. 
It sounded like a god place to bring our kids and some of their little league team. Some appetizers for the kids. Some beers for the parents. Walked in and place had a half filled bar and four table of people sitting. Asked if we could get a big table. Waitress said no. Dining is closed for two hours. We would have to stand at bar--with 8 kids. So I asked if we could sit at table but not order food. No. But there's no one sitting in that part. No. She walks away. Then walks back to tell us all move to the back in case people want to walk through the front. Rude.  Not helpful.  I've never written a yelp review like this but this place the two people we dealt with here were so disinterested.  If owned a new place and 16 people came in when the place was 1/4 filled I would try extra hard to work with the patrons, not push them out the door. 
I'll make sure our little league, soccer league and volleyball leagues all know to stay away with the kids. And even without.
author: Michael S.

description: My family and I love this neighborhood spot.  The beer is great, the food is equally good and my children love the kids menu.  The staff is always very nice and are very accomodating with our children.  When it's just the 4 of us, we usually sit in a both on the main level.  We invited another family of 4 to join us and they and they loved it as well.  We sat upstairs, there were 4 adults and 4 kids and the service was quick!  We could see the big projection TV from upstairs as well.
author: Chris I.

description: Well I'd love to talk about how the food is, except I didn't even get to try it. Unfortunately my fiancé and I ended up walking out due to the fact that we sat there waiting for some acknowledgement and received absolutely none, all while a group of three employees stood around talking amongst themselves. The place wasn't even busy at all, as this was before the dining area was even open for dinner. Lame.
author: Sofía P.

description: Great food, great atmosphere, and great staff. Been there a few times since opening. Haven't had a bad experience yet. Would and have recommended friends to the brewery.
author: David N.

description: Bad food good beer. The chicken in the fried chicken sandwich was about three chicken nuggets' worth of chicken meat in too much crust, fried in super hot oil such that the crust was dark brown and hard. Same with the fries that were fried so long and in such hot oil that they'll cut your mouth. Cole slaw lacked flavor. The beer was good, though.
author: S Y.

description: We went here on a Saturday afternoon and had a wonderful experience.  The staff was super-friendly and attentive and were also passionate about beer. They have a nice variety on tap and the Double IPA was my favorite.  The food was outstanding and was definitely a cut above the typical brew pub fare. I'd highly recommend it!
author: Peyton L.

description: This place looked like a really nice new addition to the Sunset neighborhood but it was disappointing.  I went with a friend to check the place out and to sample their beers and food.  I ordered the dry Irish Stout which proved to be quite good and my friend order the Rye Amber which was well crafted but a bit boring. The staff was very friendly and helpful but getting refills on our drinks was at best slow. Now about the food. The burger my friend ordered was pretty tasteless and the small portion of fries where cold and less than appealing....the  Iceberg lettuce and tomato looked like something from a cheap diner on the East Coast.  I just ordered the hummus and flat-bread starter  to have with my beers and while the flat-bread was tasty there was very little hummus with the dish. We ordered the bread pudding to see if the deserts where any good and it was very dry and not very tasty.  Summary : Beers where OK, food was high priced and inconsistent. Staff was friendly but a bit slow. Not impressed.... won't be back.
author: Jim W.

description: Been there before and liked the hamburger I got but this time tried to go as a walk in with a group of 7 for lunch and the hostesses were very un-accommodating! The only option they gave us was separate tables they weren't willing to put together and when a booth opened up instead of asking if we wanted to take it they gave it to a 2 top that came in after us! Very disappointing customer service
author: Ashley L.

description:
If you only knew how badly I wanted to LOVE this place. Being that the Outer Sunset lacks a solid brewery, I was incredibly excited when I heard that the lovely owner of Devil's Teeth was opening one up! You can imagine my disappointment when I went for my first time and not only was there a TWO hour wait at 5:30 on a Wednesday, but the hostess was incredibly rude to boot. AY. I understand that it recently opened, so I gave the benefit of the doubt and decided to give it a second chance. This time around, I was seated pretty quickly which was a plus. Our server was very nice and knew the menu well, which was a second plus. Now for the drinks and food: Beer was honestly OK. Tasted a little flat but did the trick. For dinner I decided to try their burger (a staple of any good restaurant), even though $16 seemed a little steep given the environment. I have to say that the meat itself was tasty and seemed of good quality. Unfortunately the fries tasted like they were frozen about 20 minutes prior to being on my plate. 

My suggestions? This is a brewery, so ideally there should be a decent selection of small bites/bar food. I understand that this city has turned into a yuppie's paradise but common people! After the hype wares down, it will be the locals that keep this place open. It's as if one side of the brewery is geared towards having drinks and socializing-- and the other half feels like its trying to be a higher end eatery that belongs on Valencia. 

Hopefully they are able to work out the kinks and give the locals a friendly, tasty go to eatery.
author: Ahna K.

description: What a nice place in the neighborhood. Cross section of neighborhood folks, great staff,  good food and drink. You can't ask for much more.  This is going to be on our regular rotation.
author: V. L.

description: Such a cool place! First of all, you walk in and it is so dramatic and open. The server was so friendly and helpful in walking us through the beer menu. I'm not a beer drinker but my friends loved the flight that they tried. The burger was amazing and it came with loads of delicious fries and the bun must have been baked just for the brewing company because it really put the burger over the top. I would absolutely recommend this place.
author: Terry K.

description: Just home from another great dinner at SRBC.  However kind of disappointed with the changes to the desert menu.  Bring back the beeramisu and the other in house wonderful creations!
author: Howard O.

description: we are so happy to see this place in the neighborhood!  i love the decor and the open feel of the restaurant.  the food was so good and definitely comforting.  we ordered a few plates to try and the heirloom tomato salad was so juicy and flavorful!  the ahi poke was fresh and delicious but a little spicy.  underneath the poke is a big drizzle of sriacha so it was hard to avoid the spice.  the steak was the main course and pretty tasty.  good beers too.  we've only been here once but plan on coming back!!
author: jennifer l.

description: Loved this spot. The servers were friendly. The food was fresh and tasty. The ambiance was a breath of fresh air and hopefully a beacon to other businesses looking to open out here. Great to find this gem in the business drudgery of the Sunset! We will be back!
author: mike m.

description: Went to this place for lunch and drinks after work because I heard they had extended their hours. I can't tell you how happy I am to have another good place to hangout in our neighborhood. I know some people are complaining about price, but give me a break, the city is uber expensive and I can't even imagine how much it costs to run anything here after all the taxes and red tape. It is what it is people. I found the food to be quality. The peppers were delicious, the mussels were off the hook (served with Devil's Teeth bread) and the pozole was a big bowl of warm love. The ambiance is open, airy and modern. The beers and wine were great too. Our server took care of us well and chatted just the right amount. The only thing I would have hoped for is some nachos or wings. Just seemed like it would have gone with the beers I was having. Go, drink, be merry!
author: Mona R.

description: Come on people, this place has just opened, and of course there are some kinks to work out.  We've been regulars at Devil's Teeth, her bakery, and so when we heard she was opening a brewpub, we wanted to check it out.  We went for lunch, and loved the space.  We tried the stout, which is my go-to beer, and it was one of the best I've tried.  The burger was great, and I appreciated the Russian dressing and the brioche bun.  And the chocolate stout cake...what's not to like?
author: Barbara S.

description: Thank you thank you thank you!  The transformation of a former dingy and dirty produce market into a very cool brewpub in a historic building with high beam ceilings, a mezzanine and plenty of free street parking is a blessing!  We had the beer sampler, the shishito peppers and serrano ham flatbread appetizers.  They were delicious and generous servings!  Owner Hilary opened Devil's Teeth Baker a few years ago on Noriega near the beach and helped transform the neighborhood into a destination.  We are looking forward to the same positive effect in the Noriega & 24th neighborhood.  Cheers !
author: Rob S.

description: This place was wonderful. Bright, well designed and appointed, with a lighter, more sophisticated menu than a typical brew co.  The service was excellent and so was the food.
author: Maureen O.

description: Having gone 10 times because of living across the street. This place is crap. First of all let me say I was excited to have this place open to have somewhere to go to without having to move the car. Each time we have gone has gotten progressively worse. Menu changes. Food boring and way way over priced for Noriega. You want chicken and mashed potatoes 26$ come on it's the friggin sunset. We just left here tonight. Went over for beer and wings. Staff are useless. Apart from the bus boys make them waiters!!!!Bus boy checked in more often as our waiter was too busy chatting with his friends. Food is bland and boring. Would love to see a brewery menu with decent flatbreads etc. not hipster stuff. Walking across this eve I seen a Senoires pizza delivery car outside. I joked..food must be crap this eve. Walked in there was Senoires pizza delivery guy with 5 large pizzas brought upstairs and given to what we believe we're staff. Hold on staff orders pizza while kitchen is open. Wha wha wha????? Serious red flag when a restaurant gets a pizza delivery. Last time there. So sad it didn't work out between us.
author: Atha B.

description: Much like the now beloved Devil's Teeth Baking, this owner/operator has created another winner. Beautiful, good food, kid friendly, yummy beer and where else can you get mussels and oysters this good out here in our parts? Major kudos and two thumbs up.
author: Mark T.

description: We live in the neighborhood and finally had a chance to try SRBC!  It so great to have a casual place out in the Sunset with decent food that's reasonably priced.  I think 4 stars is a bit over, but 3 stars too low.  The service was great and staff very friendly!  The food was good.  Pork chop - tasty but mustard sauce a little heavy, burger was good and fries amazing! Veggie satay a bit underwhelming - charge a bit more and add a few more  veggies and couscous (it's a good option for guest who want to kind of stick to a diet), and peanut sauce delicious but not diet food.  Salads were really good but it would be nice to have a salad on the menu with mixed greens instead of mainly arugula. I prefer a little less dressing on my salads, but next time I'll just ask.   Loved the beer and drinks.  Again, Great staff!   We will definitely make this a go regular place to go for a casual night out.
author: Chris W.

description: The beer was fantastic, the pozole was the bomb and the service was on point. The fact that they are super kid friendly and there is nothing else like it near them makes this place a gem.
author: Lara L.

description: This place is legit.   Much like its sister The Devils Teeth Bakery, this place has everything it should.   Killer menu, drinks, and location.   Staff is into it too making this an A+ all day--and night--long.  3 stars due to lack of vegitarian options on the menu.   Understand the menu rotates, but the few times i have been in, have been relegated to only a few options.
author: Johnny C.

description: So happy that this was added on to Noriega especially considering I live a 2 minute walk away which is totally dangerous. The place is super clean and beautiful on the inside. I went on a Thursday and didn't think it was overly crowded. I ordered a snake bite (some refer to it as a black velvet) which is cider with guinness sitting on top. It took a while to come back to me because the bartender was a little confused as to what it was and ended up mixing the two together- not personally how I like it, but I drank it anyway and thought it was fairly priced at $6. My friends got the flights which I tried and liked most of them. The Irish stout does def taste just like guinness. No complaints here tho. My bf liked his blonde ale. The service was also friendly. I really would like to try the food as there isn't many quality traditional american food options in the neighborhood.. It's a shame that it's a little more on the pricey side. All in all, I think this place is great and after some more time will become even better! Will probably become a regular. :)
author: Nicole K.

description: Went there last evening . Amazing food and ambiance , friendly staff . Would go back again . The place was buzzing with people , easy parking if you plan to drive
author: Pratibha T.

description: Great beer and atmosphere. Could easily be a four star if it weren't for the food being too expensive for what you get. $16 for a not very impressive burger!!??
author: Peter N.

description: So sad to have to update this.  Last night we were looking forward to drinking some good beer with dinner while watching the Warriors win in the finals. I'm not an extreme sports fan but I think its fair to say most of San Francisco is thrilled and captivated by this team ( Go Dubs!).  When we walked in to sunset there were kids all over the bar - not one, not two but about ten 4-8 year olds taking up seats.  They had the sound off the two TVs at the bar.  We asked when they were turning the sound on for the game and were told that they were not as they 'didn't want to be a sports bar'. This came directly from the manager. Um...when you hang two large TV's in your bar you should probably own that and in any case, this was more of a special occasion. There were a lot of glum folks in blue and gold who left when we did.  I should mention that there were many empty tables still at prime dinner time so if Sunset Reservoir is aspiring to be the Applebees of the Sunset they are missing the mark there too.  Ended up at Underdog and had the best food and best time with a lot of San Francisco spirit and hospitality. Happy to be there when the Warriors won. Looking forward to Sunday's game but will not return to Sunset any time soon.  Hope they get it together - its a beautiful space but is leaving us cold.
author: C. G.

description: I LOVE fries and sunset reservoir knows just how to make them.  Love the room. The staff were great and I'm particularly impressed with the owner.  Looking forward to my next delicious visit!   LDH
author: Ld H.

description: I had an amazing experience at this resturaunt. Ive been twice and both times were excellent. The food is delicious, the atmosphere is warm, the ceiling is high (which I love), and it lookes clean and like I said before, warm. I was gazing around with a really good beer in my hand thinking that I would try to get a group of my friends to switch to this place on Friday nights. It's got enough of everything, and all of it fantastic quality, that everyone will be happy. There are plenty of neat beers to try. I like the sample platter, me and my two friends had a blast comparing beers the first time I was there. The second time we tried something the bartender recommended with basil and gin. Sounds hit or miss, but It was amazing! The place seems like it's really well done to me. I love the wood and the big bar, there was plenty of room to sit.  The bartender and waitstaff were professional, friendly,  knowledgable, and there was an excitement about the place: maybe because it's new and the neighborhood really supports it. It's a very local endeavor, not a chain or a VC project and they really seem to care about service and quality . I also really recommend the burger, sounds typical but it was really satisfying. I'll have already gone back by the time you read this, I think this is a great place.
author: molly d.
